item.title: Multilateral Development Banks unlock over $180 billion worth of climate finance at COP28
item.description: Multilateral Development Banks (MDBs) made commitments at the COP28 climate summit in Dubai to take ambitious climate action and unlock over US$180 billion in climate finance. The Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) announced that it will triple its climate lending to US$150 billion over the next decade. The World Bank pledged to increase its climate finance target to 45 percent by 2025, amounting to US$40 billion annually, with an additional US$9 billion per year for the next two years. Furthermore, the World Bank announced a US$5 billion initiative to provide clean energy access to 100 million people in Africa within seven years. Other MDBs also made significant commitments, including the Islamic Development Bank's US$1 billion climate finance commitment for adaptation in conflict-affected countries and the African Development Bank's launch of facilities for green infrastructure and climate impact insurance. The UAE pledged US$200 million for climate resilience in low-income and vulnerable middle-income countries, and the COP28 UAE Declaration on a Global Climate Finance Framework was endorsed by various countries.

item.title: Panel discussion on empowering women refugees hosted
item.description: The Brussels International Center (BIC) co-hosted an event called "Empowering Women Refugees: Opportunities and Challenges for Climate Action" during the ongoing COP28 in Dubai. The event aimed to highlight the importance of empowering women refugees in the context of climate action and focused on the challenges they face as well as the solutions they develop. Dr. Sultan bin Ahmed Al Jaber, Minister of Industry and Advanced Technology and COP28 President, delivered concluding remarks emphasizing the UAE's commitment to climate action. The event featured distinguished speakers who shared their expertise on supporting women refugees and presenting innovative solutions. Topics discussed included the resilience of women refugees, strategies for support, and the disproportionate risks and burdens faced by women due to climate change. The event emphasized the need for gender-inclusive climate policies and empowering women for resilient communities and sustainable development. The report concludes by highlighting the BIC's commitment to seeking solutions for the consequences of climate change through data-driven research and engagement with climate leaders.

item.title: ‘Renaissance: A Film by Beyonce’ tops box office
item.description: The film "Renaissance: A Film by Beyonce" premiered at the top of the U.S. box office, earning $21.8 million during the typically slow first weekend of December. This marks the first time a movie has crossed the $20 million mark on this particular weekend since 2003. The release date was strategically chosen as it is historically a dead zone for the box office. The film gives fans of Beyonce, known as the Beyhive, a chance to experience her concert tour even if they couldn't get tickets to the sold-out shows. The film received praise for its behind-the-scenes look at Beyonce's world tour and her candid discussions about fame, motherhood, and being a Black woman in the music industry. Although the box office results fell short of Taylor Swift's opening weekend earnings, experts believe it will still boost music downloads and provide a more affordable alternative to attending live concerts.

item.title: Cloud-based software provider Five9 considers options for sale – Bloomberg News
item.description: Five9, a call center software firm, is reportedly considering a sale after a failed buyout by Zoom Video Communications two years ago. The news caused Five9's shares to increase by over 7%, bringing its market capitalization to $6.2 billion. Five9 is said to be working with advisors to assess interest from potential buyers, including Zoom, which has had discussions about reviving the deal. However, there is no certainty that a sale will occur as deliberations are ongoing. In October 2021, Zoom's proposed acquisition of Five9, valued at $14.7 billion, was terminated due to concerns raised by proxy advisory firms about Five9's growth prospects. Five9 declined to comment on the recent developments, while Zoom has not responded to requests for comment.

item.title: Philippines’ Marcos tests positive for COVID-19
item.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has tested positive for COVID-19, according to a statement from the Presidential Communications Office. Despite the positive result, Marcos is said to be healthy and will continue to carry out his duties through online meetings. He will isolate for five days, although the exact timing of the positive test was not disclosed. Marcos, who is 66 years old, was last seen in public on Saturday and has canceled his events for the day, including a visit to Mindanao. This is not the first time Marcos has contracted the virus; he previously had it in 2020 and received his second booster dose last year. The Philippines has reported 1,340 new cases of COVID-19 in the past week, adding to the country's total of over 4.1 million confirmed cases.

item.title: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu convenes war cabinet meeting amid Gaza tensions
item.description: Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu convened a meeting of his war cabinet at the Defence Ministry headquarters in Tel Aviv. The meeting included top officials such as the IDF chief of staff, the National Security Council chief, the head of the Mossad, and the Shin Bet chief, along with Defense Minister Yoav Gallant and Minister Benny Gantz. The Israeli Prime Minister's Office shared details about the meeting on Twitter. Meanwhile, footage showed wounded people being taken to hospitals in southern Gaza after Israeli bombardment. Netanyahu also held a telephone assessment with his advisors regarding the war against Hamas in the region. Israel has been increasing its aerial bombardment of southern Gaza, and the IDF spokesperson announced the expansion of ground operations to the entire Gaza Strip. The World Health Organization (WHO) stated that the Israeli military ordered them to remove medical supplies from their two warehouses in southern Gaza due to ground operations, urging Israel to protect civilians and infrastructure.

item.title: US restricts visas for Uganda, Zimbabwe officials, citing repression
item.description: The United States has expanded its visa restriction policy on Ugandan officials, now including those who are believed to be responsible for undermining democracy and repressing marginalized groups in Uganda. U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken made the announcement, citing the marginalization of the LGBT community and civil society advocates in Uganda. The U.S. previously imposed visa restrictions on Ugandan officials following the passage of the country's anti-LGBTQ law and the flawed 2021 elections. Blinken also announced a new visa restriction policy for officials in Zimbabwe who undermine democracy, particularly in relation to the upcoming August 2023 elections.

item.title: Israeli activist group publishes full-page ad, calls on world to recognise women’s abuse by Hamas
item.description: An Israeli activist group placed a full-page ad in the New York Times, urging the UN and the world to acknowledge the sexual abuse of Israeli women by Hamas. The advertisement referred to a UN Security Council resolution condemning gender-based violence, stating that it does not exclude instances of Hamas raping Israeli women. The founder of the organization, Moran Zer Katzenstein, emphasized the growing evidence of crimes against women and will present evidence at a special UN session on sexual violence. In addition, the Israeli military announced that it would not wait until the end of the war in Gaza to investigate potential failings in preventing Hamas' attacks on October 7.

item.title: AT&T chooses Ericsson for new US telecom network, will drop Nokia
item.description: AT&T has announced that it has chosen Ericsson to build a telecom network in the United States using ORAN (open radio access network) technology. This new network will cover 70% of AT&T's wireless traffic by late 2026. ORAN technology promises to reduce costs for telecom operators by using cloud-based software and equipment from multiple suppliers, rather than relying on proprietary equipment from companies like Nokia, Ericsson, and Huawei. While some telecom providers have tested ORAN technology, mass adoption has been slow. However, new networks by Dish and Japan's Rakuten are already using Open RAN. AT&T has spent six months analyzing Open RAN and has looked at multiple vendors before choosing Ericsson. The company plans to invest around $14 billion over the next five years for this project. Winning the Open RAN deal will make Ericsson the largest supplier to AT&T, potentially overshadowing Nokia. Nokia shares fell on speculation that they might lose the AT&T contract. Ericsson has agreed to open up its interfaces, which were previously proprietary, across its footprint. AT&T expects fully integrated Open RAN sites operating with Ericsson and Fujitsu by 2024, and by 2025, their network will have equipment from multiple suppliers. AT&T views this move as a game-changer for the industry.

item.title: New Zealanders gather across country to protest new policies
item.description: Thousands of protesters gathered in various locations in New Zealand to demonstrate against the new government's policies that they believe are racist. The protest, organized by the political party Te Pati Maori, took place on the same day as the opening of New Zealand's 54th parliament. The coalition agreement between the National Party, New Zealand First, and ACT New Zealand, which formed the new centre-right government, includes plans to reduce the use of the Maori language, review affirmative action policies, and examine the interpretation of the country's founding treaty in legislation. The protests were peaceful, causing traffic disruptions but no arrests were made. Some protesters expressed concerns about the government's agenda, while others dismissed the demonstrations as theatrical and urged the government to focus on addressing more pressing issues in the country.

item.title: Pune civic body razes dilapidated Bhide Wada in midnight action to make way for national memorial
item.description: The Pune Municipal Corporation demolished the dilapidated structure of Bhide Wada, where Mahatma Jyotiba Phule and his wife Savitribai Phule started the first school for girls in 1848. The civic body plans to build a national memorial dedicated to the couple at the site. Despite court orders, local people and traders had refused to vacate the place. However, the Bombay High Court and the Supreme Court cleared the way for the civic body to build the memorial and ordered shop owners and tenants to vacate the premises. The structure was completely demolished after midnight with a large police force deployed in the area. Bhide Wada is located in the Budhwar Peth area of Pune.

item.title: Soccer-CONMEBOL reveals 14 host U.S. cities for 2024 Copa America
item.description: The Copa America in 2024 will be held across 14 cities in the United States, with the final taking place at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, Florida. The tournament will feature 32 matches and 16 teams, including 10 from South America (CONMEBOL) and six from North and Central America and the Caribbean (CONCACAF). The opening match will be at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, Georgia, and the semi-finals will be held at MetLife Stadium in New Jersey and Bank of America Stadium in North Carolina. The other host cities include Las Vegas, Orlando, Santa Clara, Inglewood, and Kansas City. The draw for the tournament will take place on Thursday, and the previous Copa America in 2021 was won by Argentina, defeating Brazil in the final.

item.title: Delhi recorded 16 murder cases stemming from love affairs : NCRB
item.description: According to a report released by the National Crime Records Bureau, there were 16 murder cases in New Delhi in 2022 that were related to love affairs. One noteworthy case involved the murder of Shraddha Walker, who was allegedly strangled and dismembered by her live-in partner, Aftab Amin Poonawala, due to suspicions of her infidelity. The body was subsequently dumped in a jungle in south Delhi's Mehrauli. Overall, Delhi reported 501 murder cases, with 13 linked to illicit relationships, 54 stemming from personal enmity, and 197 arising from family, property, and other disputes. Additionally, there were 35 murders related to monetary matters, one related to water, two resulting from road rage incidents, and three due to gang rivalry. The report also noted that 10 murders occurred during dacoity and robbery attempts. Lastly, one case of murder was attributed to human sacrifice. This article was auto-generated from a PTI news service, and ThePrint claims no responsibility for its content.

item.title: Three ‘abducted’ stone quarry labourers rescued in Assam
item.description: Three stone-quarry labourers who were allegedly abducted by militants from Assam's Cachar district have been rescued in Dima Hasao, a neighboring area. The incident took place on Saturday when suspected members of the Zeliangrong United Front (ZUF) kidnapped the labourers from Chiri quarry in Udharbond. Police conducted a successful search operation and found the trio in Lodi Kuki area in Mahur town. The abductors managed to escape, and efforts are underway to apprehend them. The rescued labourers have been identified as Raju Tanti, Amit Orang, and Biswa Dhar from Udharbond in Cachar district.

item.title: India’s ReNew signs pact with Asian Development Bank for $5.3 billion
item.description: India's ReNew Energy Global has signed a memorandum of understanding worth over $5.3 billion with the Asian Development Bank to collaborate on climate change projects. The pact was signed at the COP28 conference in Dubai and aims to meet the growing demand for clean energy. ReNew and the Asian Development Bank have already identified potential investments, with the agreement covering projects from 2023 to 2028. This collaboration is expected to attract interest from international investors, allowing ReNew to secure further funds for its renewable energy projects. India has set a target of achieving net zero emissions by 2070 and aims to increase its non-fossil fuel power capacity to 500 GW by 2030.

item.title: Dual radiance: India’s Dev Deepawali, Thailand’s enchanting Loy Krathong illuminate the night
item.description: Thailand is currently celebrating the Loy Krathong festival, also known as Thailand's festival of lights on the river. This festival, which takes place in Sukhumvit, Thailand, is believed to have originated from an old Brahmin festival honoring water spirits before being adapted to pay respects to Buddha. During Loy Krathong, people gather at lakes, rivers, and other water bodies to float flower-decorated cardboard vessels called 'Krathongs' with candles and incense sticks after offering prayers to the Moon. The festival is seen as a time for celebration, prayer, and wishing for well-being. Thai people light diyas in ponds and engage in rituals to rid themselves of evils and eliminate bad effects. They hold deep respect for gods like Shiva, Parvati, Ganesha, and Indra and worship them along with Brahma, Vishnu, Mahesha, Ganesha, and Buddha.

item.title: Delhi’s air quality improves slightly after rainfall
item.description: The air quality in Delhi and its surrounding areas slightly improved on Monday due to rain and favorable wind speed caused by a western disturbance affecting northwest India. The rainfall of 7.2 mm and wind speed of 20 kilometers per hour helped disperse pollutants, resulting in an improvement in the air quality index (AQI). At 10 pm, the AQI stood at 387, better than the readings earlier in the day. However, the city has experienced 10 severe air quality days in November so far, compared to three in the same month last year. Biomass burning has been identified as the top contributor to Delhi's air pollution, accounting for 31 to 51 percent of the city's pollution levels. Authorities have been directed to enforce restrictions on polluting vehicles and curb biomass burning.

item.title: Kashi’s ghats adorned with around 21 lakh diyas on Dev Deepavali
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The ghats of Kashi (Varanasi) were illuminated with around 21 lakh earthen lamps to celebrate Dev Deepavali. The event was inaugurated by Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who lit the first diya. The celebrations were attended by residents, tourists, and dignitaries, including ambassadors from 70 countries. Dev Deepavali is celebrated on Kartik Purnima, the last full moon night of the holy Hindu month of Kartik, and witnesses thousands of devotees lighting diyas at the ghats. The government contributed 12 lakh lamps, while voluntary organizations and public participation added over 21 lakh lamps, transforming Kashi into a resplendent sea of light. The ghats of Kashi underwent a dazzling transformation with vibrant colors, laser shows, and aerial fireworks along the Ganga riverbanks. A tribute was paid to the brave soldiers of the country, and women priests and 'Dev Kanyas' worshipped Goddess Ganga. Additionally, a sound and light show narrating the history of Kashi and Lord Shiva was held. The temple complex of Kashi Vishwanath was adorned with flowers, and the significance of Kashi and details about the corridor's construction were highlighted through a laser show. Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri and other state ministers also attended the celebrations.

item.title: IIM Indore to conduct leadership development programme in Hindi
item.description: The Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM-I) will be offering a 10-day leadership development course in Hindi starting in January next year. This is the first time that lectures will be delivered in Hindi for the leadership development program at IIM-I. The program aims to break stereotypes in management education and make knowledge and skills accessible across the country. Participants will receive training in various areas such as leadership, management practices, financial accounting, and communication skills.The Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM-I) will be offering a 10-day leadership development course in Hindi starting in January next year. item.title: SC directs Centre to review if change in law is warranted on issue of regimes for grant of driving licence
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Supreme Court has directed the Central government to review the legal question of whether a person with a driving license for a light motor vehicle can drive a transport vehicle of a certain weight. The court has set a deadline of January 17, 2024, for the consultation process with multiple stakeholders and state governments. The Attorney General requested an indefinite adjournment, but the court refused and scheduled the next hearing for January 17. The court clarified that the judgment in the Mukund Dewangan case will remain in effect during the proceedings. The court emphasized that this issue impacts the livelihoods of many people and should be addressed at the policy level. The legal question arose from disputes over insurance claims in accidents involving transport vehicles driven by individuals with licenses for light motor vehicles. The Motor Vehicle Act provides different regimes for granting driving licenses for various vehicle categories. The matter was referred to a larger bench for reconsideration.

Jarange has been leading the agitation for Marathas seeking quota benefits and has set a December 24 deadline for action on his demands, hinting at taking the protest to Mumbai.

item.title: New Technique Unveiled to Uniquely Classify and Identify Multiple Users in Shared Computing Environments
item.description: Researchers have developed a new method called UNLOC that distinguishes between multiple users accessing a single application using keystroke dynamics. This technique analyzes an individual's unique typing patterns to enhance security in shared computing environments. UNLOC utilizes the quantile transform and localization techniques to effectively classify and identify users based on their distinct typing patterns. Extensive testing has shown that UNLOC outperforms existing methods in benchmark keystroke datasets, revolutionizing security practices in shared computing environments.Researchers have developed a new method called UNLOC that distinguishes between multiple users accessing a single application using keystroke dynamics. item.title: Three-year-old girl raped in Chhattisgarh’s Jashpur, accused held
item.description: A three-year-old girl in Jashpur district, Chhattisgarh, was allegedly raped by a 35-year-old man from her neighborhood. The accused was arrested after the victim's parents filed a complaint. The incident occurred when the girl was playing near her home. The accused took her to a secluded place and sexually assaulted her. The girl was found by her family members and taken to the hospital, where she is in stable condition. The police have registered a case under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act. Further investigation is ongoing.

item.title: Reaction to Sam Altman’s return as OpenAI CEO
item.description: OpenAI has announced that Sam Altman will return as CEO after his recent ouster. Analysts and investors have shared their thoughts on the agreement. Some believe that Microsoft's role will become stronger and the partnership between the two companies will be more integrated. Others see Altman's return as the best outcome for OpenAI and its employees. There are still questions about the reasons behind Altman's firing and Microsoft's knowledge of the decision. Altman's views are expected to dominate the future direction of OpenAI, and Microsoft is supportive of him. However, there may be ongoing governance issues and concerns about board oversight.

item.title: ‘Nitish gets his cabinet to pass resolution in favour of special status’
item.description: The Bihar government led by Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has passed a resolution requesting special category status for the state. This demand was prompted by the findings of a caste survey conducted by the government, which highlighted the increase in the population of deprived castes. As a result, quotas for Scheduled Castes (SCs), Scheduled Tribes (STs), and Other Backward Classes (OBCs) have been raised from 50 to 65 percent. Additionally, the government plans to implement various welfare measures, including providing financial assistance for economic activities, constructing pucca houses, and increasing support for landless families. These initiatives are estimated to cost around Rs 2.50 lakh crore and are expected to be completed within five years. Nitish Kumar has been advocating for special status since 2010 and has renewed his demand with greater emphasis recently. He had threatened to launch a state-wide agitation if the demand was not met.

item.title: Israel bans Lashkar-e-Taiba, says “Organisation responsible for murder of Indians”
item.description: Israel has announced the ban of Lashkar-e-Taiba, a terrorist organization, on the 15th anniversary of the Mumbai terror attacks. The action was taken without any request from the Indian government. Israel lists terror organizations that pose a threat to its borders or are globally recognized by the UNSC or the US state department. Lashkar-e-Taiba is responsible for the murder of hundreds of Indian civilians and others. Israel expresses condolences to all victims of terrorism and stands united against it. The Mumbai attacks in 2008 were carried out by gunmen connected to Lashkar-e-Taiba.

item.title: Rescuing all workers safely topmost priority: Modi to Dhami on Uttarakhand tunnel collapse
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has spoken to Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami for the second consecutive day to inquire about the rescue operation of 41 workers trapped inside the Silkyara tunnel in Uttarkashi. Dhami assured Modi that the workers are safe and the prime minister emphasized that the rescue mission is a top priority. This is the fourth time Modi has spoken to Dhami regarding the rescue efforts since the tunnel collapse on November 12. The chief minister informed the prime minister about the successful insertion of a 6-inch pipeline through the rubble to provide food and necessary items to the workers. Rescuers have released a video showing the trapped workers receiving food items through the pipeline and communicating with each other. The rescue operation is being carried out urgently, and the Silkyara tunnel is part of the Char Dham all-weather road project.

item.title: Parliamentary panel gives stamp of approval to Hindi names for proposed criminal laws
item.description: A parliamentary panel has determined that the Hindi names given to the proposed criminal laws are not unconstitutional. The panel, headed by BJP MP Brijlal, referred to Article 348 of the Constitution, which states that English should be used in the Supreme Court, high courts, Acts, Bills, and legal documents. The committee concluded that since the text of the legislation is in English, it does not violate Article 348. The proposed laws aim to replace the Indian Penal Code, Criminal Procedure Act, and Indian Evidence Act. Some political parties and leaders, including P Chidambaram and the DMK, have criticized the use of Hindi names for the bills. However, the panel and Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla argued that there is no violation as the bills are written in English.

item.title: Congress manifesto in Rajasthan assures caste survey. Party says, ‘we make promises we can fulfil’
item.description: The Congress party in Rajasthan plans to conduct a caste census if it wins the upcoming assembly elections. Their manifesto also includes a new recruitment scheme, interest-free loans for farmers, and a minimum support price for agriculture. The Chief Minister highlighted the state's financial progress, aiming to achieve the No. 1 position in per capita income by 2030. The government previously ordered a caste survey, following Bihar's example, to collect information on citizens' social, economic, and educational status. The timeframe for the survey was not specified. A nationwide caste census is a priority for the Opposition's INDIA bloc.

item.title: Expanding Horizons: Dhruv Sachdev’s Production House Zero Begins Films Unveils AI Lab and New Services
item.description: Zero Begins Films, founded by filmmaker Dhruv Sachdev, has made a significant impact in the world of cinema and visual storytelling in just two years. The production house has produced award-winning films like "SIFAR" and "LockDown," accumulating a total of 52 awards at international film festivals. Zero Begins Films also showcases its versatility through the creation of 130 music videos and has collaborated with industry-leading labels. Additionally, they have worked with prestigious clients on corporate projects, leaving a lasting impression. The company's global vision is highlighted through collaborations with Canadian firms. As the company evolves, it is expanding its services to include digital marketing, influencer marketing, and out-of-home advertising. Zero Begins Films has established an AI Lab to enhance its capabilities and pioneer AI-based campaigns. Through the synergy of human creativity and AI innovation, the company aims to redefine the boundaries of creative services and deliver captivating experiences. Zero Begins Films remains committed to excellence and innovation, operating in Delhi, Mumbai, Goa, and London.

item.title: ESCAP and BharatRohan partner to empower smallholder farmers through advanced Drone enabled support system for sustainable agriculture
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！BharatRohan, a drone services provider in the agricultural sector, has partnered with the United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (ESCAP) to transform agricultural methods in Telangana and Haryana. The collaboration is part of the 'Regional Inclusive Business Models in Agriculture and Food Systems' initiative funded by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. BharatRohan aims to empower smallholder farmers, improve export opportunities, and promote sustainable agricultural practices through this partnership. They will also focus on actively involving women farmers and promoting gender-inclusive agricultural practices. ESCAP will provide inclusive business coaching services to help BharatRohan implement its strategic plan successfully. The collaboration aims to enhance technology-driven solutions, address regulatory challenges, enter international markets, and provide training services to farmers. BharatRohan's advanced hyperspectral imaging technology will provide personalized advice to farmers, leading to the improvement of traditional agricultural methods. The partnership with ESCAP will pave the way for inclusive business practices in agriculture in India and strengthen BharatRohan's position in export markets.

item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Telstra Broadcast Services (TBS) and BT have formed a strategic alliance to combine their global media network teams and infrastructure. Customers will benefit from Telstra's high-capacity media networks and increased reach and distribution of their content. The focus is on delivering a world-class global content delivery service and optimizing operations to reach global audiences. The collaboration supports Telstra's growth strategy and its commitment to technology and innovation. For more information, you can visit the Telstra Broadcast Services website.

item.title: Exclusive-France, US to propose ban on private finance to coal-fired plants at COP28 – sources
item.description: France, with support from the United States, plans to propose a halt to private financing for coal-based power plants at the upcoming U.N. climate conference. This plan, called the "New Coal Exclusion Policy," was communicated to India earlier this month. However, India and China are opposed to any efforts to block the construction of coal-fired power stations due to their energy needs. The proposal aims to dry up private funding for coal power by setting coal-exit standards for finance firms, tracked by regulators and rating agencies. The U.S., European Union, and Canada have expressed concerns about private international financing supporting new coal capacity in developing nations. About 490 gigawatts of new coal capacity is planned or under construction, mainly in India and China. India, where 73% of electricity is produced using coal, intends to resist committing to a fossil fuel phase-out or phase-down at the conference. Instead, it may focus on reducing emissions from other sources and urge developed nations to become carbon negative by 2050.

item.title: Indian researchers find no link between sudden death and COVID shots
item.description: Indian researchers conducted a study and found no evidence linking COVID-19 vaccination to unexplained sudden deaths among young adults. Instead, they identified risk factors such as the disease itself, binge drinking, intense exercise, family history of sudden death, and hospitalization for COVID-19. The study analyzed 29,171 sudden deaths and reviewed the records of 729 cases and 2,916 control subjects. It's important to note that India's actual COVID-19 numbers are believed to be higher than reported.Indian researchers conducted a study and found no evidence linking COVID-19 vaccination to unexplained sudden deaths among young adults. Instead, they identified risk factors such as the disease itself, binge drinking, intense exercise, family history of sudden death, and hospitalization for COVID-19. The study analyzed 29,171 sudden deaths and reviewed the records of 729 cases and 2,916 control subjects. It's important to note that India's actual COVID-19 numbers are believed to be higher than reported.

item.title: Bengal: Iconic buildings, places of worship lit up in blue to espouse children’s rights
item.description: Several iconic buildings and places of worship in Kolkata and other parts of West Bengal were illuminated with blue lights to promote children's rights on World Children's Day. The initiative included landmarks such as the West Bengal Assembly building, Howrah Bridge, Metcalfe Hall, Birla Planetarium, Nehru Children's Museum, Kolkata Press Club, and Birla Industrial and Technological Museum. UNICEF's West Bengal chief emphasized the importance of treating girls and boys equally, encouraging education completion, and protecting children from child marriage and violence. Additionally, various places of worship, including temples, mosques, churches, and a gurdwara, were illuminated. This effort follows UNICEF's collaboration with the International Cricket Council during the Men's Cricket World Cup to promote empowerment and equality between girls and boys.

item.title: EPFO adds 17.2 lakh net members in September
item.description: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation added 17.21 lakh net members in September, with an increase of 21,475 net members compared to the previous month. The data shows that around 8.92 lakh new members joined in September 2023, with the majority being youth in the age group of 18-25 years. Additionally, approximately 11.93 lakh members exited but rejoined EPFO, choosing to transfer their accumulations instead of applying for final settlement. The number of exits has been decreasing since June 2023. Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Gujarat, and Haryana had the highest net member additions, accounting for 57.42% of the total. The report also highlights growth in industries such as sugar, courier services, iron and steel, hospitals, and travel agencies.

item.title: “No luck”: Jim Sarbh reacts on his loss at Emmy Awards
item.description: Actor Jim Sarbh was nominated for the Emmy Award for Best Performance by an Actor for his role in 'Rocket Boys', but he did not win. The award went to Martin Freeman for his performance in 'The Responder'. The International Emmy Awards announced the winner on X (formerly Twitter). Jim Sarbh expressed his reaction to the loss on his Instagram story, writing, "No luck folks." The period drama series 'Rocket Boys', helmed by Abhay Pannu, premiered on the OTT platform Sony Liv in February 2022. The International Emmy Awards ceremony took place in New York City and featured nominations from 20 countries across 14 categories.

item.title: Vir Das wins first International Emmy Award for best comedy, dedicates honour to India
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！As GPT-3.5, I can inform you that actor-comic Vir Das has made history by becoming the first Indian to win the International Emmy Award for his Netflix stand-up special "Vir Das: Landing" in the best comedy category. He dedicated this honor to his home country, India. The 51st International Emmy Awards Gala took place in New York City. This was Das' second nomination and his first win in this category. He shared the trophy with the popular British teen sitcom "Derry Girls" season three. Das expressed his gratitude to his team and Netflix for making this achievement possible. The special "Vir Das: Landing" explores the concept of being truly global while searching for a sense of home. This award not only recognizes Das' work but also celebrates the diverse stories and voices from India.

item.title: Bhutan’s political parties vow to boost country’s income
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！As GPT-3.5, I can provide a summary of the article you shared. The article discusses Bhutan's goal of transforming into a high-income country by 2034. All five political parties in Bhutan have aligned their manifestos with this goal. The 13th Plan aims to achieve a USD 5 billion economy by 2029 and double it to USD 10 billion by 2034. However, this requires significant investments of over Nu 1 trillion. The article also mentions the different growth rate targets set by the political parties, ranging from 8% to 12% annually. Bhutan's GDP growth rate has slowed down in recent years due to various factors, including the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic. To revitalize the economy, the parties have proposed economic stimulus plans and plans to attract foreign direct investment (FDI). They also aim to reduce the trade deficit, create high-end jobs in the digital economy, and increase the share of the manufacturing sector in GDP. The parties have set targets for tourism, inflation, and national debt reduction as well.

item.title: Panel discussion on STEM education moots more practical approach in learning
item.description: Participants at a panel discussion on STEM education in Kolkata emphasized the need for a practical approach in Indian schools to keep up with modern changes in the education system. The discussion, organized by the US Consulate and Bengal Chamber of Commerce, aimed to provide a global perspective on STEM education. The US Consul General, Melinda Pavek, highlighted the importance of upgrading education to meet global needs and referred to the changing education landscape. Prof Suranjan Das, Vice-Chancellor of Adamas University, stressed the significance of industry-academia interaction to engage children in practical science-based learning. He also advocated for a collaborative approach in the education sector to enhance the marketability of student inventions.

item.title: C-Suite Predicts 2024 to be Watershed Year for Financial Impact of Generative AI in Icertis Survey
item.description: According to the AI impact report titled "The Future of Generative AI: C-Suite Perspectives for 2024 and Beyond" released by Icertis, senior executives from businesses in the U.S. and U.K. shared their perspectives on how AI will transform various aspects of their organizations. The report highlights that nearly half of the senior leaders agree that AI will impact their bottom line in 2024, with 56 percent prioritizing AI use cases that have an immediate impact on revenue or cost. The report also mentions that AI adoption will catalyze competition by minimizing gaps between competitors. Additionally, executives express concerns about AI automating strategic initiatives managed by the c-suite, but they are also planning to create new positions directly tied to AI. The report also touches upon the importance of data security and ethics in AI innovation. For more detailed information, you can read the full report titled "The Future of Generative AI: C-Suite Perspectives for 2024 and Beyond."

item.title: Afghanistan: Students in Jawzjan urges Taliban to equip schools with laboratories, scientific tools
item.description: Students in the northern Jawzjan province's Mardian district in Afghanistan have requested that the Taliban provide their schools with scientific equipment and laboratories. The students believe that science laboratories can enhance their science literacy and academic performance. While officials from the education department claim that 32 laboratories have already been established in schools this year, students still highlight the need for more supplies to facilitate experimentation and generate new ideas. The Taliban's control over Afghanistan has resulted in the banning of girls from attending school after sixth grade and has imposed restrictions on women, including limiting their access to education, employment, and public spaces.

item.title: 51st International Emmy Awards: Ektaa Kapoor aces ethnic look on red carpet
item.description: Indian filmmaker Ektaa Kapoor looked stunning in a traditional ensemble at the 51st International Emmy Awards. She wore a mustard-toned ethnic outfit with zari work and accessorized with statement jewelry. Kapoor will be honored with the Directorate Award at the ceremony. She expressed her gratitude for the recognition, stating that it represents her personal and professional journey. Kapoor is known for her contributions to Indian television and has created numerous iconic TV shows under her banner, Balaji.Indian filmmaker Ektaa Kapoor looked stunning in a traditional ensemble at the 51st International Emmy Awards red carpet. She wore a mustard-toned ethnic outfit with zari work and completed her look with statement jewelry. Kapoor will be receiving the Directorate Award at the awards ceremony. She expressed her gratitude for the recognition, stating that it represents her personal and professional journey and allows her to represent women and their accomplishments on an international level. Kapoor has been a major figure in Indian television since starting the production company Balaji in 1994 and has created and produced numerous iconic TV shows.

item.title: Pakistan: Bilawal Bhutto warns his party won’t accept elections ‘if anyone interfered’
item.description: The chairman of the Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP), Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari, has warned that his party will not recognize the results of the upcoming general elections in 2024 if there is any interference. He stated this during a workers' convention in Nowshera, where he also criticized the lack of purpose in elections when the results are predetermined. Bhutto advised senior politicians not to put unnecessary effort into running for office on the "back of administration." He called for transparent polls and stated that his party will only accept the choice of the people. The general elections are scheduled for February 8, 2024, as announced by the Election Commission of Pakistan.

item.title: Shefali Shah shines in traditional red saree at International Emmy 2023 red carpet
item.description: Indian actor Shefali Shah attended the 51st International Emmy Awards in New York as a nominee for Best Performance by an Actress. She wore a red gold saree on the red carpet, adding an Indian touch to her look. She kept her makeup minimal and wore a traditional golden statement necklace. Shefali's wavy hair and red round bindi completed her ethnic look. She was also honored at the opening cocktail night of the event, where she wore a creation by JJ Valaya. Shefali is nominated for her performance as DCP Vartika Chaturvedi in the Netflix series "Delhi Crime Season 2." The series is inspired by true events and is produced by SK Global Entertainment, Golden Karavan, and Film Karavan. The first season of the show won an International Emmy Award, making it the first Indian web series to do so. Shefali has also appeared in other notable projects such as "Jalsa," "Human," "Darlings," and "Doctor G."

item.title: Gazans confirm terrorists hide in hospitals, dress up as medical personnel
item.description: Gazans in Israeli custody have confirmed to interrogators that terror groups were actively operating in Gaza hospitals and embedding themselves in the Palestinian Red Crescent Society, according to videos released by the Israel Defence Forces (IDF). Three Palestinians explained to interrogators how terrorists from Hamas, Palestinian Islamic Jihad, and other groups would hide in the Shifa and Rantisi hospitals. They would disguise themselves as medical staff while hiding in the hospital. Additionally, terrorists embedded themselves with the Red Crescent organization. The IDF has so far interrogated 500 Palestinians at a detention facility in southern Israel. The report also mentions previous instances of Hamas operatives hiding in hospitals and using them for various activities. A senior officer in the IDF stated that thousands of phone calls from collaborators have been received, indicating that residents of the Gaza Strip are dissatisfied with Hamas' behavior.

item.title: US announces fresh aid package of USD 100 million for Ukraine
item.description: The United States has announced a new aid package for Ukraine worth $100 million as the US Secretary of Defense visits Kyiv. The package includes Javelin and AT-4 launchers, small arms ammo, Stinger anti-aircraft missiles, and artillery munitions. US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin stated that the aid package will provide Ukrainian troops with the necessary tools to fight successfully during the winter months. The Pentagon is waiting for Congress to pass additional legislation that could potentially provide billions more in aid to Ukraine. Austin emphasized the importance of focusing on the objectives and goals set by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Although it has been difficult for the Republican-controlled House to approve packages related to Ukraine, Austin stated that he continues to see bipartisan support in Congress. He also emphasized that Ukraine's situation matters not just to Ukraine but to the entire world.

item.title: Japan “directly approaching” Houthi rebels who hijacked cargo ship in Red Sea
item.description: Japan is directly approaching Houthi rebels who hijacked an international cargo ship in the Red Sea. Tokyo is also communicating with Israel and urging other concerned countries, such as Iran, Saudi Arabia, and Oman, to help secure the vessel's release. The ship is owned by an Israeli businessman and operated by a Japanese company. The attack by the rebels was allegedly in response to Israel's actions in Gaza. The Japanese government strongly condemns the hijacking and is coordinating with other nations to resolve the situation. Israel has also condemned the incident, calling it a serious act of Iranian-backed terrorism. The ship was sailing from Turkey to India with a multinational crew onboard but no Israelis.

item.title: Japan’s envoy confers Foreign Minister’s Commendation 2023 to Dr Alka Kumar
item.description: Japan's ambassador to India, Hiroshi Suzuki, presented the Foreign Minister's Commendation 2023 to Dr. Alka Kumar, the President of Konnichiwa Japan Club. The commendation was given in recognition of Dr. Kumar's contributions towards promoting Japanese culture in India, including organizing events and activities. The Foreign Minister's Commendation is awarded to individuals and groups with outstanding achievements in international fields to promote friendship between Japan and other countries. The commendation also aims to garner public support for the recipients' activities.The President of Konnichiwa Japan Club, Dr. Alka Kumar, was awarded the Foreign Minister's commendation by Japan's Ambassador to India, Hiroshi Suzuki, in recognition of her efforts in promoting Japanese culture in India. This commendation is given to individuals and groups who have made outstanding contributions to international fields and promoting friendship between Japan and other countries. Dr. Kumar's activities, such as organizing 'Konnichiwa Japan' and other events, have helped strengthen ties between the two nations. The commendation aims to garner support and understanding from the Japanese public for the recipients' activities.

item.title: IFFI 2023: Madhuri Dixit makes hearts go “Dhak Dhak” with her performance on ‘Dola Re Dola’

She performed on her hit tracks, including "Dola Re Dola," "O Re Piya," and "Ghar More Pardesiya." Madhuri was also honored with the 'Special Recognition for Contribution to Bharatiya Cinema' award at the event. Other notable personalities like Shahid Kapoor, Shriya Saran, Nushratt Bharucha, Sara Ali Khan, and Karan Johar were present at the ceremony.Actress Madhuri Dixit Nene captivated the audience at the opening ceremony of the 54th International Film Festival of India (IFFI) with her mesmerizing performance. She danced to her popular songs, including 'Dola Re Dola' from 'Devdas', 'O Re Piya' from 'Aaja Nachle', and 'Ghar More Pardesiya' from 'Kalank'. Before her performance, Madhuri was honored with the 'Special Recognition for Contribution to Bharatiya Cinema' award. She expressed gratitude for the recognition and stated that such awards encourage and motivate artists. The event also saw the presence of other notable personalities like Shahid Kapoor, Shriya Saran, Nushratt Bharucha, Sara Ali Khan, and Karan Johar.

item.title: “Step in, take action:” Canadian MP Chandra Arya on Khalistani supporters threat to Hindu temple in Surrey
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！India-origin Canadian Member of Parliament Chandra Arya has shared a video on social media of pro-Khalistani supporters in Surrey, Canada, claiming that they want to cause trouble at the Hindu Laxmi Narayan Mandir. Arya called on Canadian authorities to take action against these supporters. Hindu temples in Canada have been targets for attacks in recent years, and Arya emphasized that allowing these incidents to occur openly is unacceptable. This article also mentions previous incidents of vandalism and graffiti at Hindu temples in Canada, all carried out by Khalistani extremists. The ties between India and Canada have become strained after Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau claimed that Indian government agents were involved in the killing of Canadian citizen Hardeep Singh Nijjar, who was also a designated terrorist in India. India denied these claims, and the visa services between the two countries were temporarily halted. However, India has decided to resume visa services in Canada for certain categories.

item.title: Situation of children continues to remain grim in Afghanistan
item.description: The United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF) has highlighted the challenges faced by Afghan children, who are often involved in dangerous work to support their families. Many children in Afghanistan, such as Asif, Mustafa, and Sohrab, work in hazardous jobs and struggle to provide bread and support for their families. The situation is exacerbated by the high levels of poverty and malnutrition in the country, with approximately three million Afghans suffering from malnutrition. The Taliban's takeover of Afghanistan has further worsened the living conditions, especially for children and women, whose fundamental rights and freedoms are severely restricted. Women are banned from most jobs and public spaces, while girls are prohibited from continuing their education beyond sixth grade. The difficult circumstances faced by Afghan children and the urgent need for support are emphasized in the report.

item.title: Red Cross president meets with Hamas leader in Qatar
item.description: The President of the International Red Cross, Mirjana Spoljaric, traveled to Qatar to meet with the leader of Palestinian group Hamas, Ismail Haniyeh, to address humanitarian issues related to the conflict with Israel. The meeting was part of discussions with all sides of the conflict to improve respect for international humanitarian law. The Red Cross clarified that it was not involved in negotiations for the release of hostages seized by Hamas during an incursion into Israel in October. The Red Cross is a neutral intermediary providing aid to Gaza and assisting with hostage and patient escorts.

item.title: Shahid makes dashing bike entry at IFFI 2023 opening ceremony, recreates ‘Kabir Singh’ moment

He entered the venue riding a bike and danced to his famous tracks from the movie "Kabir Singh." Shahid also made a dashing appearance on the red carpet and expressed his excitement for the festival. item.title: Zoom lifts annual revenue forecast on hybrid work boost
item.description: Zoom Video Communications has raised its annual revenue forecast due to increasing demand for its video-conferencing services. The company's integration of artificial intelligence technology into its products and the rise of hybrid work models post-pandemic have contributed to this growth. Zoom now expects full-year revenue between $4.506 billion and $4.511 billion, compared to its earlier forecast of $4.485 billion to $4.495 billion. The company's stock rose over 6% after the announcement. Platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Cisco Webex gained popularity during the pandemic as businesses and individuals relied on them for virtual communication.

item.title: Discord, Snap and X CEOs subpoenaed to testify at US hearing on child exploitation
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The CEOs of Discord, Snap, and X (formerly known as Twitter) have been issued subpoenas to testify at a hearing on online child sexual exploitation by the U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee. Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew are expected to voluntarily testify at a future hearing. Discord and X, owned by Elon Musk, refused to cooperate with the subpoenas, leading the committee to enlist the U.S. Marshals Service to personally serve the subpoenas. Snap's CEO Evan Spiegel has agreed to testify, while X has communicated their availability to participate. The committee aims to address the issue of online child sexual exploitation and press social media CEOs on their failures to protect children. The committee has also approved bills related to child sexual abuse material laws and online child exploitation prevention.

item.title: Exclusive-Germany, France and Italy reach agreement on future AI regulation
item.description: France, Germany, and Italy have agreed on how artificial intelligence (AI) should be regulated, according to a joint paper seen by Reuters. The three governments support mandatory self-regulation through codes of conduct for foundation models of AI, while opposing untested norms. They emphasize that the regulation should focus on the application of AI systems rather than the technology itself. The developers of foundation models would have to define model cards containing relevant information about the model's functioning, capabilities, and limits. An AI governance body could be established to develop guidelines and ensure compliance. Initially, no sanctions would be imposed, but a system of sanctions could be implemented in case of violations. Germany's economy ministry emphasizes that AI applications, not the technology itself, should be regulated. The German and Italian governments will further discuss AI-related issues in upcoming meetings.

item.title: Dollar falls to 2-1/2 month low on Fed expectations, yen strengthens
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The dollar index, which measures the value of the US dollar against a basket of other major currencies, has reached its lowest level in over two months. Investors believe that the US Federal Reserve has finished its cycle of interest rate hikes and are now looking towards potential rate cuts. Recent data has shown a slowdown in the economy and inflation pressures, but not enough to cause concerns about a recession. The market is now speculating on when the Fed may begin cutting rates, with a greater than 50% chance of at least a 25 basis points cut by May. Some Fed officials have not ruled out the possibility of more rate hikes if economic data calls for it. The euro and yen have strengthened against the weaker dollar, and the euro has been supported by expectations that the European Central Bank will keep its rate hike cycle intact after the Fed has finished. Moody's has unexpectedly upgraded Italy's sovereign rating outlook and upgraded Portugal's rating. The pound has also strengthened to a two-month high.

item.title: Afghanistan: Doctors concerned over spread of infectious diseases amid mass deportations
item.description: Several medical professionals in Kabul have discussed the transmission of infectious diseases among recently deported refugees from Pakistan. They have found that a large number of these patients suffer from contagious skin conditions that were uncommon in Afghanistan. The refugees are demanding careful consideration of their health issues from the Afghan caretaker government. The World Health Organisation has warned about the spread of infectious diseases among returning refugees and has highlighted the need for prompt assistance and health services. Pakistan's decision to expel over a million undocumented Afghan migrants has resulted in a significant number of them returning to Afghanistan.

item.title: Oil climbs over 2% as OPEC seen deepening cuts
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Oil prices rose over 2% on Monday as the OPEC+ group is expected to announce further supply cuts at an upcoming meeting. Brent crude futures settled at $82.32 a barrel, up 2.1%, while West Texas Intermediate crude (WTI) gained 2.3% to $77.60, and January futures rose 1.8% to $77.83. The rebound follows four straight weeks of decline and speculation that OPEC+ may consider additional supply cuts. Some analysts believe deeper cuts may be necessary due to falling speculative positioning, declining timespreads, and higher-than-expected inventories. Oil prices have dropped nearly 20% since September, driven by record-high crude output in the US and concerns over demand growth, particularly from China. Additionally, traders are monitoring signs of a possible US recession in 2024 and evaluating the impact of the ongoing conflict in Israel on oil supply.

item.title: Property registration stalled by sub-registrars, says BJP citing NCT of Delhi RERA order
item.description: According to the Delhi BJP, property registration has been halted by sub-registrars in Delhi following a NCT of Delhi RERA order. However, a senior revenue department officer has stated that no directions to stop property registrations have been issued. Delhi BJP President Virendra Sachdeva criticized the AAP government and asked Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal to clarify if the RERA order applies to properties constructed before or after November 20. Sources in the Delhi government said that RERA falls under the central government's jurisdiction and accused the BJP of misleading the public. The Delhi BJP claimed that the RERA order limits the number of dwelling units allowed in certain plot sizes, which contradicts the large number of properties in Delhi with additional units. The RERA had directed that building plans indicate the total number of dwelling units that can be constructed on the plot. The report mentions the presence of unauthorised colonies in Delhi and raises concerns about their future legality under the RERA order.

item.title: KSRTC to revert to khaki uniform for employees
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Kerala Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) in India has decided to switch back to khaki uniforms for its employees after eight years of using blue uniforms. The decision was made based on discussions with employee unions. The new uniform will include khaki trousers and half-sleeve shirts for men, and churidars and sleeveless overcoats for women, all with the KSRTC emblem. Employees will also be required to wear name tags with their permanent employee number. The new uniforms are expected to be distributed to employees by the end of the month. Station masters, vehicle supervisors, chargemen, and vehicle inspectors will also receive new khaki uniforms with appropriate markings.

item.title: Minister distributes funds to beneficiaries of Van Dhan Vikas Kendra Clusters
item.description: Assam Minister Ranoj Pegu distributed funds worth Rs 1.81 crore to 84 Van Dhan Vikas Kendra clusters under the Prime Minister Janjati Vikas Mission (PMJVM). The scheme aims to support forest dwellers in collecting and processing forest produce for their livelihood. The funds included a revolving fund of Rs 1.63 crore and a supporting fund of Rs 18 lakh. The objective of the scheme is to uplift tribal people socio-economically through value addition of minor forest produce. Additionally, a memorandum of understanding was signed between Tezpur University and IIE for the transfer of technology know-how for the production of a new product - pomelo marmalade. The minister also launched a range of millets products and a rejuvenated website with an e-commerce platform.

item.title: Jalna SP among several top cops transferred on Monday
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Maharashtra government has transferred Jalna Superintendent of Police Tushar Joshi to the Crime Investigation Department (CID), Pune as SP. This decision comes after Joshi was placed on compulsory leave following a lathicharge on Maratha quota agitators in Antarwali Sarati in Jalna. The incident had led to sporadic incidents of violence in some parts of the state. Several other SP-rank officers were also transferred by the state home department, including the appointment of Anuj Tare as SP of Washim and Shrikant Dhiware as SP of Dhule. Additionally, Vishal Singuri has been appointed as the new SP of Amravati (Rural), while Mokshada Patil has been transferred from the post of SP, Railway Police, Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar and made Commandant of State Reserve Police Force in Mumbai.

item.title: Believe in your abilities, chase your dreams: Lekhi urges girls, young women
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Union Minister Meenakshi Lekhi encouraged girls and women to pursue their dreams and not be deterred by male-dominated fields. She made the remarks during an event organized by UNICEF on World Children's Day, where 14 young innovators showcased their work. Lekhi emphasized the importance of recognizing talent irrespective of age and supporting young minds. The showcased ideas included a robotic sanitizing machine, a smart helmet, and sign language conversion technology. McCaffrey also praised India's rise in the global innovation index and expressed support for harnessing children's creativity to address inequalities.

item.title: 2 die by suicide in Bengal, Odisha after India’s loss in World Cup final
item.description: Two individuals, one in Bankura, West Bengal, and another in Jajpur, Odisha, reportedly died by suicide following India's loss to Australia in the cricket World Cup final. In Bankura, a 23-year-old named Rahul Lohar hung himself in his room. In Jajpur, a 23-year-old man named Dev Ranjan Das was found hanging from the terrace of his house. Das had been undergoing treatment for emotional disorder syndrome. Authorities have registered cases of unnatural death and are awaiting post-mortem reports.I'm sorry to hear about the tragic incidents.
