item.title: Shahid Kapoor opens up about his upcoming project ‘Deva’ at IFFI
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Actor Shahid Kapoor discussed his upcoming project, 'Deva,' and expressed his love for Goa at the International Film Festival of India. He shared that they have started shooting for the film, which is set to release on Dussehra next year. Shahid Kapoor also shared his excitement about being in Goa and attending the prestigious event. He posted a look from the film on Instagram, revealing that 'Deva' will star Pooja Hegde and be directed by Malayalam filmmakers Rossahn Andrrews. The article also mentions other attendees at the festival, such as Vijay Sethupathi, Sara Ali Khan, and filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani. Additionally, it highlights the films selected for the festival, the introduction of OTT awards, and actor Michael Douglas receiving the prestigious Satyajit Ray Excellence in Film Lifetime Award. The Indian Panorama section will showcase 25 feature films and 20 non-feature films. The 54th International Film Festival of India will conclude on November 28.

item.title: RBI imposes monetary penalty on Sangli Sahakari Bank Limited, Mumbai
item.description: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has imposed a monetary penalty of Rs two lakh on Sangli Sahakari Bank Limited, Mumbai, for failing to comply with the directions issued by the RBI on 'Board of Directors-UCBs'. The penalty was based on deficiencies in regulatory compliance and does not question the validity of any bank transactions. An inspection conducted by the RBI revealed that the bank had renewed a loan given to a relative of one of its directors. After considering the bank's reply, the RBI concluded that the charge of non-compliance with the directions was substantiated and warranted a penalty. The monetary penalty was imposed by the RBI in September.

item.title: Rajnath Singh, Australian Dy PM Marles reaffirm commitment to further strengthen defence ties
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh held a bilateral meeting with Australian Deputy Prime Minister and Defence Minister Richard Marles in New Delhi. They expressed satisfaction at the increasing military-to-military cooperation between the two nations, including joint exercises and exchanges. They discussed further enhancing cooperation in information exchange, maritime domain awareness, and niche training areas like artificial intelligence and anti-drone warfare. The two leaders also discussed cooperation in the defence industry and research, including shipbuilding and aircraft maintenance. They emphasized that a strong India-Australia defence partnership is beneficial for both countries and the security of the Indo-Pacific region. Singh expressed confidence that the partnership will continue to grow.

item.title: RML Hospital’s ‘pollution OPD’ reports low footfall, doctors blame lack of awareness
item.description: Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital in New Delhi opened a weekly OPD (outpatient department) to treat pollution-related illnesses. However, the OPD has seen a lack of patients, with only three people visiting in the first two weeks. Doctors attribute the low footfall to a lack of awareness about the facility. Despite this, the hospital plans to continue running the OPD until Delhi's air quality improves. Patients who have visited the OPD reported issues such as breathlessness, sore throat, and persistent cough. The OPD aims to address the increasing respiratory problems caused by pollution. Delhi's air quality has worsened in recent days, with little relief expected in the near future.

item.title: Tribal land transfer issue likely to rock Odisha Assembly winter session
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Opposition BJP and Congress in Odisha plan to make the transfer of tribal land to non-tribal people a major issue in the winter session of the state assembly. The state cabinet had decided to amend a law allowing scheduled tribe people to transfer their land to non-tribals with permission from the state government, but the decision was later withheld. The BJP and Congress both plan to raise the issue and demand the withdrawal of the proposed legislation, accusing the government of conspiring to make tribal people landless. The Congress also plans to raise issues of unemployment, corruption, price hikes, and deteriorating law and order. The ruling BJD party will hold a meeting to prepare strategy for the session.

item.title: India, Australia agree to further strengthen ties to deal with ‘exceptional challenges’
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！India and Australia have decided to strengthen their strategic partnership to address challenges in the Indo-Pacific region and globally, with a focus on defense cooperation. The two nations also emphasized the importance of enhancing cooperation in information exchange and maritime domain awareness. Defense Minister Rajnath Singh and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met with Australian Deputy Prime Minister and Defense Minister Richard Marles and Foreign Minister Penny Wong during the ministerial dialogue. They discussed exceptional challenges and the need for cooperation in areas such as defense industry, research, shipbuilding, and maintenance. The goal is to enhance the bilateral defense relationship for the peace, security, and prosperity of the Indo-Pacific.

item.title: Utilizing J-K Police telecom wing for leveraging CCTNS for better policing: DGP
item.description: The Director General of Police (DGP) of Jammu and Kashmir, R R Swain, has directed the revamping of the police force's telecom wing in order to leverage the Crime and Criminal Tracking Network and Systems (CCTNS) for improved policing. The DGP emphasized the importance of data and technology during discussions with senior officers. He also visited various police headquarters and instructed officers to attend courses in other states to learn from their progress with CCTNS. Swain stressed the need to fix responsibility while granting authority and resources to juniors, and to take action against personnel who cannot be corrected. He encouraged a culture that does not fear honest mistakes but rewards good work. Additionally, he called for addressing genuine grievances of serving and retired police personnel.

item.title: Shillong to host 11th edition of International Tourism Mart from Nov 21-23
item.description: The 11th edition of the International Tourism Mart (ITM) is set to be held in Shillong, the capital of Meghalaya, India's northeast region. The event, scheduled from November 21-23, aims to showcase the tourism potential of the region. This year's ITM is unique as it will be a 'green' event, implementing low-carbon options in line with the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change's guidelines. The event will feature 100 delegates from domestic and international backgrounds, including tourism ministers and officials. It will focus on highlighting the northeast region's tourism products, biodiversity, and intangible heritage. The ministry has also sanctioned funds for the development of 22 viewpoints in the region to improve infrastructure and services. The event will incorporate sustainable practices by avoiding single-use plastics and following a digital and paperless approach. The ministry also emphasized the improvement in air connectivity in the northeast, with 16 airports providing access to tourist destinations. Additionally, collaboration with the Ministry of Civil Aviation has facilitated the operation of 53 tourism routes, including 10 exclusively for the northeast region. The ministry's 'Travel for Life' program aims to promote sustainable and responsible tourism in India, aligning with the Sustainable Development Goals. Projects under the Swadesh Darshan and PRASAD schemes have been sanctioned for the development of tourist destinations and pilgrimage centers in the northeast region.

item.title: India welcomes efforts for humanitarian pauses in Israel-Hamas conflict
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！India's Permanent Representative to the UN, Ambassador Ruchira Kamboj, expressed support for humanitarian pauses in the Israel-Hamas conflict and international efforts to de-escalate the situation and provide urgent assistance to Palestine. India opposes terrorism and violence, supports adherence to international humanitarian law, and calls for the prevention of further escalation. Kamboj also highlighted India's welcome for humanitarian pauses and its commitment to a just and lasting solution to the Israel-Palestine issue through direct negotiations. India has provided humanitarian aid to Palestine, including 70 tons of relief materials and ongoing support.

item.title: Russia calls for ‘extra efforts’ to overcome payment hurdles
item.description: Russia's ambassador to India, Denis Alipov, has called for "extra efforts" from banks and exporters to overcome payment problems that hinder trade between the two countries. He highlighted that the vostro trade settlement mechanism (rupee payment) is not working effectively and urged Indian banks and exporters to make additional efforts to resolve this issue. While Alipov did not provide specific details on what these extra efforts entailed, he emphasized the need for cooperation between banks. He also acknowledged delays in the defence deal for the advanced long-range surface-to-air missile defense system S-400 but assured that supplies are still ongoing. Despite the challenges, Alipov expressed optimism that once the payment mechanism is streamlined, there will be a trade boom. Additionally, he expressed interest in greater collaboration in the MSME sector, particularly with a delegation heading to West Bengal for an investment summit. The bilateral trade between Russia and India reached $49 billion in FY'23, establishing Russia as India's fourth-largest trade partner.

item.title: Jordan Spieth replaces Rory McIlroy on PGA Tour board
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Jordan Spieth has been chosen to serve the remainder of Rory McIlroy's term as a player director on the PGA Tour's Policy Board. This decision was made by the five other player directors, including Tiger Woods and Webb Simpson. McIlroy resigned from the board citing the time commitment and the impact of a partnership between the PGA Tour and Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund on his role. Spieth, a 13-time winner on the PGA Tour with multiple major victories, has experience with the tour's governance process, previously serving on the Player Advisory Council and as a player director. This term will last until the end of 2024.

item.title: Soccer-Belief in right path will pay off for Germany says coach Nagelsmann
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann believes that having a positive playing style is crucial to their success. The three-time European champions have been struggling to find their form ahead of Euro 2024, which will be hosted in Germany. Nagelsmann's first home game resulted in a 3-2 loss to Turkey, and their upcoming friendly match against Austria is their last of the year. Nagelsmann emphasized the importance of being convinced of their path, playing positive games, and continuing their playing style. Although winning is the ultimate goal, Nagelsmann also highlighted the significance of playing well and believing in their ideas. The Germans will need to improve their performance to avoid disappointing their fans until next year's friendly matches. Nagelsmann expressed concerns about the lack of team training camps in the four months leading up to the major tournament. The leaking defense has been a major concern for the German team in recent years. Nagelsmann defended his decision to put Kai Havertz in a left-back position against Turkey, despite criticism from the media. He is confident that the team will start to click better and achieve better results with time.

item.title: Sharjah Ports, Customs and Free Zones Authority, Gulftainer extend concession agreements
item.description: Gulftainer, a ports and terminals operator and logistics provider, has extended its concession agreements with the Sharjah Ports, Customs, and Free Zones Authority for an additional 35 years. This allows Gulftainer to manage and develop the Sharjah Container Terminal and Khorfakkan Container Terminal. The extended agreements strengthen the partnership between Gulftainer and Sharjah Ports Authority and highlight the importance of public-private partnerships in revolutionizing port infrastructure. The Sharjah ports are key trade gateways in the UAE, handling various types of cargo. The agreements were signed by Sheikh Khalid bin Abdullah Al Qasimi, Chairman for Sharjah Ports, Customs, and Free Zones Authority, and Peter Richards, Group CEO of Gulftainer.

item.title: Knowledge Summit 2023 to kick off tomorrow at Dubai World Trade Center
item.description: The Knowledge Summit 2023, organized by the Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Knowledge Foundation (MBRF) and the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), will begin tomorrow under the patronage of Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum. The summit, taking place in Dubai from November 21st to 22nd, with virtual sessions on November 23rd, will focus on the theme of "Knowledge Cities and the Fifth Industrial Revolution." It aims to bring together thought leaders, policymakers, experts, and entrepreneurs to discuss and showcase best practices addressing global challenges. The summit will cover various topics, including the 5th industrial revolution, sustainable technologies, digital health, and strategies for achieving zero waste. The event will also release the Global Knowledge Index 2023 (GKI) with a focus on Arab countries.

item.title: Salman Khan, Katrina Kaif unveil romantic track ‘Ruaan’ from ‘Tiger 3’
item.description: The makers of the film 'Tiger 3', starring Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif, have released a new romantic song titled 'Ruaan'. The song is sung by Arijit Singh and composed by Pritam, with lyrics by Irshad Kamil. The film, directed by Maneesh Sharma, has earned 376 crore gross worldwide in 8 days. 'Tiger 3' is the third installment of the Tiger franchise and is part of the YRF spy universe. The film also features cameo appearances by Shah Rukh Khan and a post-credit scene with Hrithik Roshan. It follows the adventures of agents Tiger and Zoya as they undertake a new mission.

item.title: Don’t make people feel their blood is cheap: Omar on bail to Army captain in fake encounter case
item.description: Omar Abdullah, a leader of the National Conference, has criticized the decision to grant bail to an army captain convicted in the 2020 Amshipora fake encounter case. Abdullah expressed concern over the granting of bail to a person found guilty of murder and stated that it gives the impression that the blood of the people of Kashmir is cheap. The armed forces tribunal in Delhi has suspended the life sentence of Captain Bhoopendra Singh and granted conditional bail to him. Abdullah also addressed the delay in holding elections in Jammu and Kashmir, expressing hope that the Supreme Court's verdict on Article 370 petitions will also address the issue of elections. He also raised concerns about the electricity supply situation in Kashmir, claiming that power cuts were unprecedented.

item.title: Olympics-Soaring hotel prices, crackdown on illegal renting to hit Paris 2024 experience
item.description: Paris is facing major accommodation problems ahead of the 2024 Olympics, with hotel prices set to rise by 314%. The report by the Paris tourism office criticized hotels for not opening their booking platforms for the games, with only 34% currently available for booking. The report also highlighted that hotel prices in July 2023 were 169 euros, expected to rise to 699 euros in July 2024. As a result, visitors may opt for cheaper accommodation options outside of Paris and commute. Concerns have also been raised about the increasing popularity of Airbnb rentals, with the French parliament expected to pass a law cracking down on illegal rentals. Owners who illegally rent their homes currently face fines totaling 6.5 million euros between 2021 and 2023.

item.title: Health ministry releases draft National Pharmacy Commission Bill, seeks comments
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Indian government has proposed a draft bill that would establish a national pharmacy register containing information about all pharmacy professionals. The bill aims to replace the existing Pharmacy Council of India with a National Commission and promote equitable access to high-quality pharmaceutical education and healthcare services. It also calls for periodic assessment of pharmacy institutions, enforcement of ethical standards, and the availability of a transparent national pharmacy register. Additionally, the draft bill encourages pharmacy professionals to engage in research and proposes the establishment of a grievance redress mechanism.

item.title: Germany arrests suspected antisemite who threatened killings -police
item.description: German police have arrested an 18-year-old man in the state of Hesse on suspicion of planning violence endangering the state. The suspect had made online threats to kill people and posted right-wing extremist and antisemitic content. During a search of his apartment, authorities confiscated computers, weapons, and ammunition. Germany has increased surveillance to prevent antisemitic violence following the attack on Israel by militants from Gaza's Hamas group. The country has seen protests in support of Palestine, some of which included antisemitic slogans. Germany, with a large Jewish and Palestinian population, emphasizes its responsibility to protect Jewish lives due to the Nazi Holocaust.

item.title: US increasing staff, opening new consulates to reduce visa delays: Ambassador Garcetti
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The US is increasing staff and opening new consulates, including in Ahmedabad, to reduce waiting times for visa issuance from India, according to US Ambassador Eric Garcetti. One consulate has recently been opened in Hyderabad, with plans in progress for new consulates in Bengaluru and Ahmedabad. The number of US visas being issued in India has increased by one-third in recent weeks, and the embassy is expected to issue 10-15% more visas than usual this year. Garcetti attributed the delay in visa issuance to the high number of applicants, stating that Brazil and Mexico also faced similar challenges.

item.title: Top Ukrainian cyber defence officials sacked amid corruption probe
item.description: Ukraine has dismissed two high-ranking cyber defence officials, Yurii Shchyhol and Viktor Zhora, amid an investigation into alleged embezzlement. The officials were implicated in a six-person plot to embezzle $1.72 million in 2021. These firings come as Ukraine aims to combat corruption in order to pursue EU membership. The officials have not been identified by name, and the State Service of Special Communications and Information Protection of Ukraine (SSSCIP) has not yet commented on the matter.Ukraine has dismissed two high-ranking officials in its cyber defense sector amid an investigation into alleged embezzlement. Yurii Shchyhol, head of the State Service of Special Communications and Information Protection of Ukraine (SSSCIP), and his deputy, Viktor Zhora, were fired by the government. The firings coincide with anti-corruption prosecutors investigating officials in cyber defense positions for their alleged involvement in embezzling $1.72 million in 2021. The move is part of Ukraine's efforts to combat corruption as it seeks membership in the European Union. The SSSCIP did not provide an immediate response to requests for comment.

item.title: Tunnel collapse: Rescuers insert 6-inch-wide pipe through rubble to send more food to trapped workers
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Rescuers in Uttarakhand have made a breakthrough by pushing a six-inch-wide pipeline through the rubble of a collapsed tunnel. This will enable them to supply larger quantities of food and other essentials to 41 workers who have been trapped for eight days. Previously, a four-inch tube was being used to supply dry fruit, medicines, and oxygen to the workers. The new pipeline will allow for the delivery of food items like roti and sabji. The director of NHIDCL called this the "first breakthrough" and stated that the workers can now hear and experience the rescue efforts. The collapsed tunnel is located in Silkyara village in Uttarkashi district and is part of the Char Dham all-weather road project.

item.description: Approximately 1,850 wanted terrorists have been arrested in Judea and Samaria since the start of the war in Gaza, with around 1,100 of them associated with Hamas. The IDF recently captured 16 more wanted terrorists, including a senior Hamas member named Tarek Abdullah Ahmed Salem. item.title: Pro-Palestine fan who breached security at Ahmedabad to meet Kohli produced before Court
item.description: An Australian supporter, wearing a t-shirt with a "free Palestine" slogan, breached security and entered the field during the India-Australia final ODI World Cup match in Ahmedabad. He hugged Indian cricketer Virat Kohli and stated his support for Palestine. The man has been detained by Gujarat state police and produced before the Gandhinagar sessions court. In the match, Australia bowled first and India posted a total of 240 runs. Australia chased the target successfully, with Travis Head scoring a century, leading them to a six-wicket win.

item.title: ACKO Partners with R Madhavan as their ‘Voice of the Customer’ To Simplify Complex Insurance Questions & Help Customers Make Informed Decisions
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Insurtech company Acko has announced a partnership with actor R Madhavan to enhance trust and transparency in the insurance sector in India. Madhavan will serve as the 'voice of the customer' to simplify the complexities of insurance and empower consumers to make informed decisions. The collaboration aims to provide valuable content to educate and reinforce trust, making insurance a space of assurance and confidence. Acko, founded in 2016, has revolutionized the direct-to-customer auto insurance industry by eliminating paperwork and offering a seamless customer experience.

item.title: Pak authorities arrest seven terrorists; foil attack in Punjab province: Police
item.description: Law enforcement authorities in Pakistan have foiled a major terror attack after arresting seven terrorists, including a key commander of the Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP). The counter terrorism department (CTD) of the provincial police received intelligence about the attack plan in Punjab province and collaborated with an intelligence agency to thwart the plot. The terrorists were apprehended in various districts of Punjab, and explosives, grenades, bombs, detonators, safety fuse wire, and banned literature were seized from them. The terrorists were reportedly planning to target several installations in the province.

item.title: AAP lodges complaint with EC against BJP over social media content against Kejriwal
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has lodged a complaint with the Election Commission, accusing the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of using "absurd" content on social media to tarnish the image of AAP convener and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal. The AAP delegation requested the Election Commission to take action against the BJP for character assassination. The Election Commission had previously issued a show-cause notice to Kejriwal for alleged disparaging remarks made by AAP against Prime Minister Narendra Modi on social media. After filing the complaint, AAP leader Raghav Chadha emphasized the importance of maintaining dignity in politics and public life, and advised the BJP to fight Kejriwal through elections rather than resorting to character assassination.

item.title: AJKPC hits out at poll panel over delay in local body elections in J-K
item.description: The All Jammu and Kashmir Panchayat Conference (AJKPC) has accused the state election commission of delaying local body polls and functioning as a subordinate department of the government. They also oppose transferring the budget planning process for the next financial year from the panchayats and block development councils to the district development councils. The AJKPC criticizes the commission for not addressing the upcoming end of the existing bodies' terms. They condemn any move by the government that centralizes power instead of decentralizing it.

item.title: Xiaomi Q3 net income jumps on cost savings, revenue rises
item.description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp reported a jump in third-quarter net income that surpassed expectations. The company's sales for the period reached 70.9 billion yuan ($9.83 billion), outperforming estimates, while net income increased by 183% to 6 billion yuan. Xiaomi shipped 9.1 million devices in China during the quarter, which was relatively unchanged from the previous year but still better than industry peers. The company's focus on its new electric vehicle division was also highlighted, with plans to begin mass production in the first half of 2024.

item.title: Court acquits man of cruelty, dowry death charges
item.description: A man in New Delhi has been acquitted of charges of cruelty and dowry death after the court found that the prosecution had failed to establish that he had subjected his deceased wife to any harassment or cruelty. The court noted inconsistencies in the testimonies of the prosecution witnesses and stated that the prosecution had also failed to prove that any harassment or cruelty had taken place during the marriage. The court ultimately concluded that the prosecution had "miserably failed" to prove its case and ordered the man's acquittal.

item.title: Explainer-Argentina presidential election: Key takeaways from Milei’s win
item.description: Javier Milei, a radical libertarian, has been elected as the president of Argentina, receiving a wide margin of votes in a run-off election. This outcome reflects a desire for change and a rejection of the peronist government, which has overseen soaring inflation and increasing poverty. Despite Milei's significant voter support, he will face challenges due to his limited presence in regional governments and congress, and he may have to moderate his plans for economic reforms such as dollarization. Milei's election comes at a time of economic crisis for Argentina, and his proposed reforms could help address the country's fiscal issues. However, he will need the support of more moderate conservatives to implement his plans. Milei, a 53-year-old economist, has been compared to Donald Trump and Jair Bolsonaro due to his abrasive style and desire to slash government spending.

item.title: Trump and Biden “too old” for presidency: Ron DeSantis
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Florida Governor Ron DeSantis criticized the presidential frontrunners, Donald Trump and Joe Biden, stating that the presidency is not suitable for someone in their 80s. DeSantis, who is currently trailing Trump in the race for the Republican nomination, highlighted his relative youth compared to Trump and Biden. Age has become a central theme in the 2024 presidential race, with Trump mocking Biden's mental fitness. DeSantis launched an "accident tracker" for Trump's gaffes and questioned whether Trump is the same as when he first ran for president. He believes Democrats will go all-out against Trump if he becomes the GOP nominee, while Biden will be able to "hang out in the basement." Desantis promised to serve two terms, deliver results, and move the country forward. Despite waning poll numbers, DeSantis maintains an active campaign schedule, often appearing with his family at events.

item.title: Uttarakhand govt to bear travel expenses of relatives of trapped workers
item.description: The Uttarakhand government has announced that it will cover the travel, food, and lodging expenses of the relatives of the 41 workers who have been trapped in the Silkyara tunnel in Uttarkashi district for over a week. Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has assured the families that rescue operations are being carried out actively and officials will stay in touch with them to ensure they do not face any inconvenience. The government will also bear the expenses of those who wish to visit Silkyara to inquire about the well-being of the trapped workers. Psychiatrists have been brought in to help maintain the morale of the workers. The Silkyara tunnel is part of the Char Dham all-weather road project.

item.title: 25 gm ganja seized from Thane hospital; woman administrator, 3 others booked
item.description: Police have seized 25 grams of ganja from a private hospital in Thane district, Maharashtra. A case has been registered against the woman administrator of the hospital and three others. The ganja was found concealed in a cover in the drawer of a table in the hospital's OPD. The assistant administrator and her associates allegedly planted the contraband to defame the medical facility. The hospital conducted an internal probe and filed a police complaint. A case was registered under the NDPS Act.

item.title: SC seeks reply of Centre, Kerala governor’s office on state govt’s plea alleging delay in granting assent to bills
item.description: The Supreme Court of India has requested responses from the central government and the office of the governor of Kerala, Arif Mohammed Khan, regarding a plea from the state government. The plea accuses the governor of not granting assent to several bills cleared by the legislative assembly. The court has also issued a notice to the attorney general, seeking assistance in the hearing. The state government claims that the governor is delaying the consideration of eight bills, which they argue is defeating the rights of the people. A similar plea has been filed by the Tamil Nadu government, which is also being heard by the Supreme Court.

item.title: L&T Technology Services Collaborates With NVIDIA to Unveil Gen AI and Advanced Software-Defined Architecture for Medical Devices
item.description: L&T Technology Services (LTTS) has partnered with Nvidia to develop software-defined architectures for medical devices focused on endoscopy. This collaboration aims to address industry challenges related to availability, cost, and dependencies on custom hardware components. The architecture offers a scalable platform with real-time decision-making capabilities for the medical community. It features an image processing pipeline for noise reduction, contrast enhancement, and color enhancement, with AI/ML models developed for the detection and classification of polyps. The solution leverages Nvidia's Holoscan and IGX Orin platforms to enable enhanced visualization and AI-based decision-making support for medical imaging. This collaboration aims to accelerate the development of AI-enabled, software-defined medical devices.

item.title: HarperCollins is proud to announce the publication of CHARAIVETI: An Academic’s Global Journey by Pranab Bardhan
item.description: Article found but Couldn't summarize PRNewswire New Delhi [India], November 20: Charaiveti is more than just a memoir–it is a sharp-eyed look at where we have been and where we may be headed, as seen through the lens of a remarkable life. Published by HarperCollins Paperback | Non-Fiction | Biography | 376 pp | INR 699 Available wherever books are […]

item.title: Pakistan’s caretaker PM Kakar rejects concerns about bias against some political parties ahead of elections
item.description: Pakistan's caretaker Prime Minister, Anwar-ul-Haq Kakar, has dismissed allegations of bias against political parties and stated that holding general elections and transferring power to the elected government is his top priority. The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party and Pakistan People's Party (PPP) have complained about the lack of a level playing field in the upcoming election, accusing the caretaker government of favoring the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) party. Kakar denied these allegations and emphasized the importance of conducting fair and transparent elections. He also addressed concerns about the arrest of PTI chairman Imran Khan, stating that the arrest occurred before the formation of the caretaker setup. Kakar urged caution before making accusations and asserted that the safety of incarcerated individuals, including Khan, is their responsibility. Additionally, Kakar called on the Afghan Taliban to take action against terrorists using their soil to attack Pakistan. He criticized the interim Taliban government for its inaction and underscored the need for the Afghan government to address the presence of Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) hideouts in Afghanistan. Kakar also discussed the government's crackdown on illegal foreigners, clarifying that registered Afghan refugees would not be repatriated, only undocumented individuals would be deported.

item.title: Concern for the Great Barrier Reef can inspire climate action – but the way we talk about it matters
item.description: The Great Barrier Reef is facing pressure due to climate change, and the main solution is to urgently reduce greenhouse gas emissions and shift away from fossil fuels. Researchers have found that talking about the reef in a way that inspires action is important. Messages focusing on the reef and emphasizing collective potential to protect it were found to be more effective in motivating climate action. It is also important to include specific calls to action and highlight the tangible ways people can help. So, when talking about the reef this summer, it is recommended to highlight its iconic nature, use motivational language, state the problem without focusing too much on explaining the threat, and provide specific calls to action. Remember, people can make a difference in demanding and supporting climate action from anywhere.

item.title: UN climate negotiations through the years up to COP28
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The article provides a historical overview of key moments in the history of climate talks and conferences, from the 1800s to the present. It highlights significant events such as the discovery of the link between CO2 levels and rising temperatures, the establishment of the U.N. Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), the Kyoto Protocol, and the Paris Agreement. The article also mentions notable figures like Al Gore and Greta Thunberg, as well as important developments like the U.S. exit from the Paris Agreement and the postponement of COP due to the COVID-19 pandemic. It concludes with the recent COP27 conference in Egypt, which resulted in a Loss and Damage Fund for climate disasters but lacked focus on emissions reduction.

item.title: TikTok has a startling amount of sexual content – and it’s way too easy for children to access
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The article discusses the issue of explicit content on TikTok and its potential harm to young users. Despite efforts to moderate content, TikTok's focus seems to be on user engagement rather than creating a safe environment. The automated moderation system is not always accurate, leading to the removal of beneficial LGBTQ+ and sex education content while explicit content slips through. Users also employ tactics like "algospeak" to avoid filters. Harmful content on TikTok promotes unhealthy attitudes towards sex, perpetuates harmful gender stereotypes, and can influence vulnerable young boys with misogynistic views. The platform's promotion of idealistic and sexualized content also negatively affects the self-perception of young women and queer youth. However, TikTok offers an opportunity for informative and inclusive sex education content. Social media platforms face challenges in effectively moderating harmful content, and regulatory bodies like Australia's eSafety Commissioner play a role in pressuring platforms to remove such content. It is important for parents to equip young users with media literacy skills and actively monitor their online activities. Rather than solely restricting app usage, open discussions, building trust, and educating oneself and children about online risks are more effective approaches.

item.title: Digital India’s Grassroots Heroes: Microland Foundation and TIDE Applaud First Cohort of Digipreneurs
item.description: The Digipreneur program, hosted by Microland Foundation and TIDE, celebrated the achievements of its first cohort of 20 fellows. These Digipreneurs, hailing from last-mile villages in Tumkur, act as a bridge between their communities and the vision of Digital India. The program aims to address social exclusion and ensure that no one is left offline. The felicitation ceremony highlighted the commitment to transforming communities through digital empowerment. The program focuses on the self-development of fellows, providing certifications and online courses to nurture their entrepreneurial and interpersonal skills. The Digipreneurs have embraced the ethos of "each-one-teach-one" and assist fellow Digipreneurs in day-to-day kiosk operations. The success of the program reflects economic empowerment and the building of a network of empowered individuals. The program looks forward to expanding digital literacy and creating an inclusive and digitally empowered India.

This issue has taken centre stage again with the meteoric rise of TikTok. Despite efforts to moderate content, it seems TikTok’s primary focus remains on maximising […]

item.title: Grenade detonates in Kyiv apartment, killing two
item.description: A Ukrainian soldier and a woman were killed in Kiev when a grenade exploded in an apartment, while a second man was injured. The cause of the blast is currently unknown, and explosives technicians and investigators are at the scene. In a separate incident earlier this month, an aide to Ukraine's commander-in-chief died when a grenade given as a birthday gift exploded.A Ukrainian soldier and a woman were killed when a grenade exploded in a Kyiv apartment. The cause of the blast is not yet known. Explosives technicians and investigators are working at the scene. This incident follows the recent death of an aide to Ukraine's commander-in-chief, who was killed when a grenade given to him as a birthday gift detonated.

item.title: Cong seeks info of officials who violated norms to benefit BJP in MP polls
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Madhya Pradesh Congress has written a letter to all its candidates asking for details of officials who allegedly worked against the rules to benefit the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in the recently held state assembly polls. The BJP criticized the move, stating that the Congress was looking for excuses for its imminent defeat. The Congress claims that the control room set up on polling day received complaints about officials working against the rules to benefit the BJP. The party asked its candidates to provide information about such employees and officials by November 30. Congress leaders Kamal Nath and Digvijaya Singh had previously accused officials and employees of favoring the BJP and threatened action if the Congress came to power. The BJP dismissed these allegations and stated that the Congress had already lost votes by questioning the integrity of government employees and officials.

item.title: Cricket-Australia underline big-match credentials with stunning India takedown
item.description: Australia emerged as dominant winners in the World Cup final against India, despite India's commercial strength in global cricket. Led by captain Pat Cummins and their strong bowling attack, Australia secured a six-wicket victory, marking their sixth World Cup triumph. This success, along with their recent World Test Championship win, positions Australia as contenders for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Australia's history of big-match success, including their unbeaten record in World Cup finals since 1999, further solidifies their reputation. Cummins's leadership and strategic decisions also received praise, establishing him as a successful captain alongside past Australian cricket legends.

item.title: President Murmu begins three-day Odisha visit
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！President Droupadi Murmu arrived in Baripada, Odisha for a three-day visit. She was received by various officials, including Governor Raghubar Das and Union MOS for Tribal Affairs Bishweswar Tudu. The president attended the inaugural session of the 36th annual conference and literary festival of the All India Santali Writers' Association. Later in the day, she inaugurated an Eklavya Model Residential School at Kuliana.President Droupadi Murmu visited Baripada in Mayurbhanj district, Odisha for a three-day visit. She arrived on an Indian Air Force helicopter and was received by Governor Raghubar Das, Union MOS for Tribal Affairs Bishweswar Tudu, and State ST and SC Development Minister Jagannath Saraka. The President attended the inaugural session of the 36th Annual Conference and Literary Festival of All India Santali Writers' Association. She also inaugurated an Eklavya Model Residential School at Kuliana. This report is auto-generated from PTI News Service and ThePrint does not hold responsibility for its content.

item.title: “You are our pride”: Amitabh Bachchan’s message for team India after World Cup 2023 loss
item.description: In a heartwarming message on Instagram, Amitabh Bachchan praised Team India after their loss against Australia in the World Cup 2023 final match. Sharing a picture of himself with a wrist brace, Bachchan called the team "our pride" and assured them that they are not done yet. The match saw India struggling to score on a difficult batting surface, with Australia chasing down the target of 241 with ease. Travis Head's century earned him the 'Player of the Match' award. Bachchan also mentioned his upcoming films in the post.

item.title: The future of transport is electric
item.description:
The article discusses the need for countries to implement effective policies to promote the adoption of electric vehicles (EVs) and reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the transport sector. Currently, transport emissions have been increasing at a rate of 1.7 percent per year since 1990, making it the sector with the highest emissions growth. Road vehicles contribute the most to these emissions, accounting for 74.5 percent.
While the global EV market has experienced significant growth in recent years, adoption rates vary across different regions. The article highlights successful government policies in China, Europe, and the US that have incentivized consumers to switch to EVs through subsidies, rebates, and tax discounts. For example, Norway has achieved a 79 percent market share for EVs by providing financial incentives and other benefits such as lower tolls and access to bus lanes.
The article suggests that alongside EV incentives, higher taxes on polluting vehicles can further encourage the transition to electric transport. Many European Union countries already levy car taxes based on carbon dioxide emissions. Feebate systems, which impose levies on high-emission vehicles and provide rebates for low-emission vehicles, are also effective in discouraging the purchase of polluting vehicles.
In addition to incentives and taxes, the phase-out of internal combustion engine vehicles and the implementation of fuel efficiency standards are recommended. Over 35 countries have announced plans to electrify or phase out internal combustion engine vehicles. Fuel efficiency standards set limits on vehicle emissions and encourage the production of low or zero-emission vehicles.
To support the widespread adoption of EVs, the report suggests the need for robust charging infrastructure. Currently, only 13 percent of the estimated 100 million chargers needed by 2030 are in place. Accessible chargers can alleviate range anxiety concerns and make EVs more affordable by reducing the need for larger batteries.
The article concludes by emphasizing that a comprehensive set of consistent policies is crucial for achieving emissions reduction goals and transitioning to cleaner transport. It highlights the importance of not solely relying on EVs but also implementing strategies to change travel behavior, such as reducing car usage, promoting e-bikes and e-scooters, and improving walkability and public transport access.
Overall, the article emphasizes the importance of getting the policy mix right to accelerate the shift to electric vehicles and achieve global commitments for net zero emissions by 2050.

item.title: Chhath devotees pay obeisance to rising sun
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Chhath festival, the most popular festival in Jharkhand state, was celebrated by millions of men and women who paid their respects to the rising sun. Devotees observed a 36-hour fast and offered 'Usha arghya' to the sun in various water bodies across the state. The festivities included devotional songs, firecrackers, and the offering of prayers at river ghats. Odisha Governor Raghubar Das and several parliamentarians and legislators also participated in the rituals. The four-day celebrations began with a ritual bath followed by sharing sattvic food with family and friends. The festival concluded with salutations to the sun, after which devotees broke their fast with fruits and a sweet called "thekua." Adequate security arrangements were made at all Chhath ghats, and no untoward incidents were reported. Water bodies were cleaned for the occasion, and restrictions were placed on heavy vehicle entry in Ranchi during the festival.

item.title: Altman will not return as CEO of OpenAI – The Information
item.description: Sam Altman, the former CEO of OpenAI, will not be returning to the company, according to a statement from board director Ilya Sutskever. Ex-Twitch boss Emmett Shear will take over as the new interim CEO. Altman had been discussing a possible return and improving the company's governance structure. The sudden management upheaval has raised concerns among employees about the upcoming $86 billion share sale. Microsoft, OpenAI's biggest backer, is considering taking a role on the board. Altman's firing shocked the tech industry, and former president and co-founder Greg Brockman also stepped down.

item.title: DRDO to roll out Zorawar tank prototype with American engine in December, Army trials in March
item.description: The indigenous ZThe prototype of the Zorawar light tank, designed for mountain warfare, will be unveiled in December 2023. Following this, it will undergo development trials and then user trials, likely in March next year. The Indian Army has chosen Cummins, an American company, for the engines of these tanks due to clearance issues faced with German companies. The Zorawar tank is specifically designed for high-altitude operations and aims to counter Chinese armoured deployments in such terrains. Weighing 25 tonnes, the tank will have greater mobility and accuracy compared to Chinese Type 15 tanks deployed along the Ladakh border. The need for a light tank arose as the existing T72s and T90s are more suitable for plains and deserts and lack maneuverability. The tank will feature a 105 mm gun made by a Belgium-based firm, active protection against incoming attacks, integrated UAVs, Artificial Intelligence (AI), and situational awareness technology. The Defense Acquisition Council approved the project worth Rs 16,000 crore in December 2022, and the DRDO will manufacture 59 of the 354 light tanks being procured.

item.title: International forum to discuss ‘Role of Media in Hatred and Violence’ in Jeddah
item.description: An international forum entitled "The Role of Media in Hatred and Violence" will be held in Jeddah on November 26. The forum, organized by the Union of News Agencies of the OIC member states and the Muslim World League, aims to address bias and misinformation in international media coverage of international affairs, including the Palestinian cause. It will be attended by directors of news agencies, heads of international unions of news agencies, representatives of international media institutions, and media organs affiliated with the OIC, as well as diplomats and journalists.

item.title: Israeli soldiers discover 35 Gaza tunnel shafts, seize weapons
item.description: Israeli soldiers discovered 35 tunnel shafts and seized weapons in northern Gaza during raids on the homes of Hamas officials. A Hamas military camp was also raided, uncovering ammunition depots and rocket launchers. The IDF engaged Hamas terrorists on the outskirts of Jabaliya, eliminating a terror cell preparing to fire on troops from a residential building. Israeli Navy commandos supported ground forces by attacking Hamas targets from the sea and providing cover for land missions.Israeli soldiers discovered 35 tunnel shafts and seized weapons in northern Gaza during raids on the homes of Hamas officials. The raids also led to the discovery of ammunition depots and rocket launchers at a Hamas military camp. Additionally, soldiers engaged Hamas terrorists on the outskirts of Jabaliya and eliminated a terror cell preparing to fire on troops. Israeli navy commandos assisted ground forces in attacking Hamas targets from the sea.

item.title: Australian bourse operator partners with TCS for long due trading software overhaul
item.description: Australian stock exchange operator ASX has partnered with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) to develop a new trading, clearing, and settlement system. The move comes after ASX abandoned a blockchain-based overhaul of its system last year. The new platform will be implemented in two main releases, with the clearing service delivered first and settlement and sub-register services in a second release. The estimated cost for the first release is between AUD 105 million ($68.33 million) and AUD 125 million. ASX's initial attempt to overhaul its system using blockchain technology drew criticism from regulators, prompting the exchange to seek an alternative solution. The estimated timeframe for implementation is 2026 for the first release and 2028 or 2029 for the second release.

item.title: A morning of kindness turns to terror: A Sderot resident’s story
item.description: The article tells the story of a Sderot resident named Danny Eisenman who was helping tourists change a flat tire when he witnessed a terrorist attack. Shortly after he left, the terrorists shot at the tourists he had just helped, killing everyone except Eisenman and his dog. He and his family hid in a safe room for eight hours, armed only with a kitchen knife. Eisenman expresses disbelief at the international protests against Israel and warns that the danger will spread to Europe. He also describes the horrifying scenes he witnessed during the attack. The article mentions that 1,200 people were killed in Hamas's attacks on Israeli communities near the Gaza border on October 7. The exact number of casualties is still being determined.

item.title: Microsoft eyes seat on OpenAI’s revamped board – The Information
item.description: Microsoft is reportedly considering taking a role on the board of OpenAI if former CEO Sam Altman returns to the company, according to sources. The role could either be a seat on the board of directors or a board observer without voting power. Microsoft is OpenAI's largest backer.Microsoft is considering taking a role on the board of OpenAI if former CEO Sam Altman returns to the developer of ChatGPT, according to sources familiar with the talks. Microsoft could either have a seat on the board of directors or serve as a board observer without voting power.

item.title: Asia off to slow start, lot of easing already priced in
item.description: Asian shares started the week slowly as market valuations appear stretched due to anticipated global policy easing. The Black Friday sales will test the US consumer-driven economy, while the Thanksgiving holiday is expected to result in thin markets. Reports suggest a potential agreement between Israel, the US, and Hamas to release hostages in Gaza. MSCI's Asia-Pacific index rose slightly, Japan's Nikkei remained unchanged, and S&P 500 and Nasdaq futures dipped. Goldman Sachs analysts highlight the significant outperformance of mega-cap tech stocks but indicate that the risk/reward profile may not be compelling. Tech major Nvidia's quarterly results are highly anticipated for insight into AI product demand. The Federal Reserve's minutes from their previous meeting could shed light on policymakers' thinking. Markets have priced out the possibility of further rate hikes but imply a 30% chance of easing in March. Bond yields dropped, and the US dollar weakened against currencies, including the euro and yen. European manufacturing surveys and Sweden's central bank meeting will be closely watched. Oil prices rebounded amid speculation of extended OPEC+ production cuts, and gold prices dipped slightly.

item.title: Oil extends gains as OPEC+ to mull deeper cuts
item.description: Oil futures rose slightly on Monday as expectations grew that OPEC+ would deepen supply cuts to stabilize prices. Brent crude futures increased by 0.1% to $80.72 a barrel, while U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude rose by 8 cents to $75.97 a barrel. The gains come after OPEC+ sources indicated that the group will consider additional supply cuts at its meeting on November 26. Oil prices have fallen nearly 20% since September, and prompt prices for Brent and WTI slipped into contango last week, indicating sufficient supply. Analysts suggest that deeper cuts should not be ruled out given the fall in speculative positioning and higher inventories.

item.title: UK says new science initiative to work on climate-resilient crops
item.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will announce a new science initiative at the Global Food Security Summit in London, aimed at developing climate-resilient crops. The summit, attended by representatives from over 20 countries, seeks to address global food insecurity and find solutions to major challenges. The initiative will be led by CGIAR, a global research partnership, and will connect UK scientists with research projects focusing on climate-resistant and disease-resistant crops. Additionally, the British government plans to release a White Paper outlining its strategy to combat extreme poverty and climate change through partnerships with other nations, emphasizing international finance and innovation. The UK also pledges £100 million ($125 million) in humanitarian funding to countries severely affected by food insecurity and climate-related disasters.

item.title: Taylor Swift fans gather for cooler Rio show after fan’s death
item.description: Taylor Swift fans in Rio de Janeiro were disappointed when her Saturday performance was postponed due to record-breaking heat after a fan died from the sweltering conditions. However, the temperatures were lower on Sunday, and fans were hopeful that the show would go on as planned. The federal government ordered event organizer T4F to ensure water access at all of Swift's concerts in Brazil and to allow water bottles to be brought into all concerts. T4F announced an enhanced action plan for the event, including providing free water at queues and all stadium entrances and exits. The Saturday postponement angered many fans who had already made the journey to the stadium, but they were met with a positive response from Minalba Brasil, which distributed free water bottles in the stadium area on Sunday. Swift's Monday performance in Rio will replace the postponed show, and she is still scheduled to perform in Sao Paulo from November 24 to 26.

item.title: Israel says soldier executed, foreign hostages held at Gaza’s Shifa hospital
item.description: Israel has accused Hamas of committing abuses at the al Shifa hospital in the Gaza Strip. They claim that a captive soldier was executed and that two foreign hostages are being held at the hospital. Al Shifa hospital has been evacuating patients and staff since Israeli troops entered last week. Israel is also searching for 240 people that Hamas kidnapped to Gaza. The Israeli military stated that a forensic examination found that a 19-year-old Israeli conscript, Noa Marciano, had sustained non-life-threatening injuries from an Israeli airstrike, contradicting Hamas' claim that she died in an Israeli airstrike. Israel alleges that Noa was taken by Hamas terrorists and murdered at the Shifa hospital. The Israeli military also published a video of a tunnel that Hamas allegedly dug underneath the Shifa compound. Hamas has denied that tunnels are located in civilian infrastructure. The Gaza health ministry director dismissed the Israeli statement on the tunnel as a lie.

item.title: Brazil’s Lula wishes luck and success to new Argentine president
item.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva sent his well wishes to the newly elected government in Argentina, without mentioning President-elect Javier Milei, who has previously criticized Lula and called him an "angry communist." Lula expressed his hope for success and good luck to the new government, stating that Argentina is a great country deserving of respect. He emphasized the importance of democracy and congratulated the institutions and people of Argentina for their orderly and peaceful electoral process. Earlier, Lula had stated that Argentina should elect a president who supports democracy and the Mercosur trading bloc. Milei, a far-right economist and Lula's rival, has questioned the future of Argentina's relations with Brazil and criticized Lula and Mercosur, pledging that Argentina would forge its own path. Economy Minister Sergio Massa, who is competing against Milei, had better relations with the Lula government. Despite Argentina's economic crisis, it remains Brazil's primary market for manufactured goods.

item.title: Former US first lady Rosalynn Carter dies at 96
item.description: Former U.S. first lady Rosalynn Carter, known for her advocacy of mental health, passed away at the age of 96. She died at home in Plains, Georgia, surrounded by her family. Rosalynn Carter was highly involved in her husband's presidency, playing a key role in his administration and continuing her work in mental health advocacy after leaving the White House. Throughout her life, she focused on various issues, including equal rights for women, mental health, early childhood immunization, human rights, conflict resolution, and urban community empowerment. She and President Jimmy Carter were the longest-married U.S. presidential couple and were active in charitable endeavors such as the Carter Center and Habitat for Humanity. Rosalynn Carter's dedication to public service and her impact on various causes were widely recognized and praised by former U.S. Presidents and leaders.

item.title: Bayer cancels asundexian phase III study program
item.description: German pharmaceutical company Bayer has announced the cancellation of a phase III study program evaluating the effectiveness and safety of asundexian, an oral Factor XIa inhibitor. The decision to stop the study was made following the recommendation of the Independent Data Monitoring Committee (IDMC), which found that asundexian demonstrated inferior efficacy compared to the control arm of the study. Specifically, the phase III study investigating asundexian in patients with atrial fibrillation at risk for stroke will be halted prematurely. Bayer initiated this study in August 2022 and plans to analyze the data further to gain a better understanding of the findings and determine appropriate measures. In addition, Bayer had recently mentioned considering the separation of its non-prescription medicines or agriculture business from the rest of the group, which includes the pharmaceutical division.

item.title: Philippines’ Marcos meets China’s Xi to find ways to reduce South China Sea tensions
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr met with Chinese President Xi Jinping to discuss reducing tensions in the South China Sea and restoring Filipino fishermen's access to fishing grounds. The meeting was seen as an important step in maintaining peace and keeping sea lanes and airways open over the South China Sea. Marcos expressed concern over incidents between Chinese and Philippine vessels and requested a return to the previous situation where both Chinese and Filipino fishermen could fish together in the waters. Filipino fishermen have complained about Chinese ships preventing them from fishing in parts of the Philippines' exclusive economic zone. Marcos emphasized that geopolitical problems should not define the relationship between China and the Philippines. Since taking office in 2022, Marcos has pursued warmer ties with the United States, which drew criticism from Beijing. Tensions in the region have increased, particularly due to China's construction of man-made islands with military installations. China claims almost the entire South China Sea, disregarding a 2016 ruling by the Permanent Court of Arbitration. There has been no immediate response from China's embassy in Manila.

item.title: Argentina elects ‘shock therapy’ libertarian Javier Milei as president

item.title: Latin American leaders react to Argentina election result
item.description: The article features reactions from current and former Latin American presidents to the election of Javier Milei, a libertarian economist, in Argentina's presidential runoff. Argentine President Alberto Fernandez expressed his commitment to democracy and hoped for an orderly transition with Milei. Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva congratulated the Argentine institutions for conducting a peaceful electoral process and wished the new government success. Colombian President Gustavo Petro expressed his concern about the victory of the extreme right in Argentina and stated that neoliberalism lacks solutions for humanity's current problems. Chilean President Gabriel Boric saluted Milei for his victory and expressed support for the Argentine people. Uruguayan President Luis Lacalle Pou acknowledged the election of Milei and emphasized the need to work together and improve bilateral relations. Peru's President Dina Boluarte's office congratulated Milei and expressed a commitment to strengthen the historical ties between Peru and Argentina. Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro congratulated the Argentine people for Milei's victory and expressed hope for honesty, progress, and freedom in South America as well as in the United States and Brazil.

item.title: Israel-Hamas war: UN Chief reiterates call for immediate humanitarian ceasefire
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has called for an immediate humanitarian ceasefire in the ongoing war between Israel and Hamas. He emphasized the unacceptable number of civilian casualties, including women and children, and urged for the violence to end. The United Nations and 18 UN agencies and NGOs also issued a joint statement demanding an immediate ceasefire, stating that the situation in Gaza is unacceptable and that aid needs to reach the population. The statement emphasized the need to protect civilians and vital infrastructure, including hospitals and schools. The global agency reiterated its call for an immediate ceasefire and for more aid to enter Gaza.

item.title: Saffron traders in Afghanistan urge for more facilities in exports, visas
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Saffron traders in Herat province, Afghanistan are calling for greater government assistance in securing visas and exporting their saffron overseas. They argue that saffron from Herat has a strong reputation in neighboring markets and that the government should support saffron growers and exports, as well as facilitate international visas for entrepreneurs. The annual saffron exhibitions aim to promote saffron production in Herat and enhance the value of Herat saffron. Despite an increase in saffron prices, growers still require government assistance. item.description: A bus carrying students and teachers from a private college in Basti district overturned and fell into a ditch in Bhadohi, Uttar Pradesh. The accident occurred during an educational tour to Varanasi, Sarnath, Kashi, and Vindhyachal. The bus, with 48 passengers on board, was returning to Basti when the driver lost control of the vehicle. Passersby helped rescue the trapped individuals by breaking the bus windows. Thirty people, including students and teachers, were injured and admitted to the Community Health Center, but they are now out of danger. The bus driver fled the scene after the incident.

item.title: Bengal: Decomposed bodies of four of family found in flat
item.description: The decomposed bodies of four family members were discovered in their flat in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district. The deceased include a 52-year-old cloth merchant, his wife in her forties, their 17-year-old daughter, and eight-year-old son. It is suspected that the man poisoned his family before hanging himself. A suicide note was found in which he claimed that his wife had an extra-marital affair. The police were alerted after locals noticed a foul smell coming from the apartment. Investigations are ongoing.

item.title: Tripura Assembly contemplating not allowing questions on old subjects
item.description: The Tripura Assembly is considering implementing a rule that would prevent members from raising questions on a subject that is three or more years old. The opposition and the CPI(M) have expressed their opposition to this initiative, as it would limit the ability to raise important issues related to corruption. The Speaker has assured them that details will be obtained from the Parliament secretariat and further discussions will take place in the next meeting of the Rules Committee.

item.title: Rallying-Evans leads Toyota podium sweep in Japan
item.description: Welsh driver Elfyn Evans led Toyota to a victory in the Japanese Rally, finishing ahead of teammate Sebastien Ogier and Kalle Rovanpera. Rovanpera had already secured the championship title, and Evans' second-place finish confirmed him as the championship runner-up. Toyota also clinched the manufacturers' championship for the third consecutive year. Evans praised the team's performance and expressed his happiness at winning the race. The 2024 season will begin in Monte Carlo in January.Elfyn Evans led Toyota to a podium sweep in the Japanese Rally, with Sebastien Ogier in second and Kalle Rovanpera in third. Rovanpera had already secured the world title, and Evans' second-place finish confirmed him as the championship runner-up. Toyota had already secured the manufacturers' championship for the third consecutive year. Evans dominated the race, leading by nearly two minutes after the opening leg. Hyundai's Esapekka Lappi finished fourth, denying Toyota a complete sweep. The 2024 season will begin in Monte Carlo on January 25-28.

item.title: U.N. plastic treaty talks grapple with re-use, recycle, reduce debate
item.description: The third round of United Nations negotiations for a treaty to control plastic pollution has received over 500 proposals from participants. Some see this as progress, while Greenpeace calls it "chaos". Negotiators have until the end of next year to reach a deal addressing the 400 million tonnes of plastic waste produced annually. The plastics industry and oil exporters advocate for promoting recycling and reusing, while environmental campaigners and certain governments believe in reducing production. Greenpeace emphasizes that the United States and the European Union should show greater leadership. The International Pollutants Elimination Network (IPEN) believes that the proposals reflect the robustness of the talks. Canada, Kenya, and the European Union support limiting plastic production, while a coalition of Russia and Saudi Arabia emphasizes recycling. Only less than 10% of plastic waste is recycled, and at least 14 million tonnes end up in the ocean each year. Two more rounds of negotiations will occur next year to finalize the deal.

item.title: Hamas battles Israeli forces in north Gaza, hostage deal report denied
item.description: Hamas militants in Gaza engaged in a battle with Israeli forces attempting to enter the largest refugee camp on Sunday. Israeli air strikes in the south of Gaza resulted in the deaths of many Palestinians. Reports suggest that there may be a potential deal between Israel and Hamas to release women and children held hostage in exchange for a temporary ceasefire. The hostage talks coincide with Israel's plans to expand its offensive against Hamas in southern Gaza. Hamas resistance remains strong in parts of the heavily populated north, including Jabalia refugee camp. The death toll from the ongoing conflict continues to rise, with both Israeli soldiers and Palestinian civilians losing their lives. International calls for humanitarian pauses have been made, but the conflict shows no signs of abating. The World Health Organization described Gaza's largest hospital, Al Shifa, as a "death zone" and preparations are being made to evacuate patients and staff.

item.title: ‘Caged parrot’ ECI a sham, is favouring BJP, alleges Sanjay RautElection Commission has become a caged parrot: Raut Mumbai, Nov 19 (‘
item.description: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has criticized the Election Commission of India (ECI), accusing it of being biased towards the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). In his column, Raut claimed that the ECI has become a "caged parrot" and a "sham" and is practicing double standards. He accused the BJP of resorting to religious propaganda to bribe voters after losing ground in five states. Raut highlighted a statement made by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, promising government-organized tours to the Ram temple in Ayodhya if the BJP retains power, and criticized it as campaigning on religious lines. Raut also mentioned that in the past, when Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray sought votes on the issue of Hindutva, his voting rights were revoked. The Shiv Sena has written to the ECI questioning whether it has relaxed the model code of conduct.

item.title: Climate change is transforming the way we speak. And that’s a good thing
item.description: The article discusses the evolving language used to describe climate-related disasters and the need for effective communication about climate change. It highlights recent extreme weather events such as Hurricane Otis and the impact of climate change on the frequency of phenomena like bomb cyclones. The article suggests that using everyday language instead of scientific jargon can help connect with a broader audience and generate support for addressing climate change. It also mentions how organizations, including media outlets, are updating their language to reflect the urgency of the climate crisis. The author emphasizes the importance of conveying the message effectively to ensure widespread understanding and action.

item.title: Australian Deputy PM, Foreign Minister to reach India today to attend second India-Australia 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue
item.description: The Deputy Prime Minister of Australia and Defence Minister, Richard Marles, and the Foreign Affairs Minister, Penny Wong, are traveling to India to attend the second India-Australia 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue in New Delhi. They will meet their counterparts in New Delhi and engage in discussions about the Australia-India defence relationship, regional challenges, and the Australia-India foreign ministers' framework dialogue. The ministers will focus on cooperation in the areas of defence, security, renewable energy, technology, trade, and investment. The visit highlights the growing closeness of the defence and security partnerships between Australia and India. Additionally, Marles will attend the ICC World Cup in the United Arab Emirates, marking the first visit by an Australian defence minister to the region in five years. Australia acknowledges the UAE's support in hosting Australian Defence Force personnel and their assistance in evacuating Australians affected by the situation in Israel and the occupied Palestinian territories.

item.title: World Cup Final: Australian spectator who breached security to meet Virat Kohli detained by Gujarat Police
item.description: During the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 final between India and Australia at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, a security breach occurred when an Australian spectator supporting Palestine hugged Virat Kohli. The man has been detained by the Gujarat State Police and brought to the Chandkheda Police Station in Ahmedabad. He entered the field to meet Kohli and expressed his support for Palestine. The incident took place during the 14th over of India's innings and the intruder was quickly removed by security. The man was wearing a T-shirt with a free Palestine slogan and a mask with a Palestinian flag color theme.

item.title: ‘Caged parrot’ ECI a sham, is favouring BJP, alleges Sanjay RautElection Commission has become a caged parrot: Raut Mumbai, Nov 19 (‘
item.description: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut accused the Election Commission of India (ECI) of being a caged parrot and practicing double standards in favor of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). Raut criticized the BJP for resorting to religious propaganda to bribe voters after losing ground in five states where assembly polls were being held. He referred to Union Home Minister Amit Shah's promise to organize government-organized tours to the Ram temple in Ayodhya if the BJP retains power as campaigning on religious lines. Raut argued that if a similar statement was made by a Congress leader, the ECI would have taken action. He criticized the ECI for not addressing this issue, stating that garnering votes by bribing the electorate is detrimental to democracy. Raut also mentioned the upcoming idol consecration of the Ram temple in Ayodhya scheduled for January 22 and criticized the ECI's handling of the election campaigning in five states. He accused the BJP of managing the ECI and other constitutional bodies in the battle for Hindutva. The Shiv Sena (UBT) wrote to the ECI expressing concerns over Shah's promise and questioned if the model code of conduct had been relaxed.

item.title: Pro-Palestine fan breaches security to reach Kohli
item.description: A pro-Palestine fan managed to breach security and enter the field during the World Cup final cricket match between India and Australia in Ahmedabad. The man, identified as Wayne Johnson, an Australian of Chinese-Filipino origin, attempted to hug Indian cricketer Virat Kohli before being apprehended by security personnel. Johnson was taken to the police station, but it is unclear what action will be taken against him. He was wearing a face mask with a design of the Palestine flag and a t-shirt with slogans advocating to stop bombing and save Palestine. The ICC and India do not permit political slogans at cricket events. The incident comes amid ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: Adani-Hindenburg row: Plea in SC seeks contempt action against SEBI
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！A plea has been filed in the Supreme Court for contempt proceedings against the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for allegedly violating the timeline for completing an investigation into stock price manipulation by the Adani group. The petitioner claims that SEBI failed to comply with the court's direction to submit the final conclusion/report. The application also refers to a report by the Organised Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP) regarding the Adani Group's alleged investments through "opaque" Mauritius funds. The focus of the plea is on strengthening the regulatory system to protect investors and their investments in the share market. The petitioner argues that SEBI's objection to a necessary timeline for the investigation goes against the need for an efficient regulatory mechanism. Delays in investigations can lead to the disappearance of evidence and reduce investor confidence. The expert committee appointed by the court is still working on the matter, and the application calls for an independent body to investigate the new disclosures. The court had granted time until August 14 for SEBI's probe and emphasized the need for expeditious completion. SEBI has completed its investigation in most matters but is awaiting information from tax havens. The regulator will take appropriate action based on the investigation's outcome. An interim report by the expert committee found no evident pattern of manipulation but highlighted regulatory constraints. The Adani Group stocks faced allegations of fraudulent transactions and share-price manipulation, which the group denies.

item.title: India a USD 4 trillion economy? Adani to Fadnavis hail, but no official word
