Rao compares the development under his government with the Congress' 50-year rule and promises further enhancements if re-elected. Additionally, he mentions the refusal to implement a central government order and the absence of irrigation water tax in Telangana.

item.title: Punjab-born Irish man eyes Guinness record for double ‘Earth Walk’
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！73-year-old Vinod Bajaj, originally from Punjab and based in Ireland, is attempting to break the Guinness World Record for the "greatest cumulative distance walked solo on foot." He has completed two earth walks, totaling over 80,000 kilometers, equivalent to double the circumference of the earth. Bajaj's second walk took him 1,114 days, 382 fewer than his first walk. Despite concerns from his wife about his health, Bajaj plans to continue walking, but with reduced distance and duration. He began his walking journey in 2016 with the goal of losing weight and getting fitter. Bajaj's application for the world record is currently being assessed by Guinness. His next goal is to cover 100,000 kilometers. Bajaj advises walking enthusiasts to walk continuously for at least 30 minutes, set daily goals, have appropriate clothing and footwear, and listen to their bodies.

item.title: Cold weather claims 5 lives in Nepal’s earthquake-hit Jajarkot district
item.description: Five elderly people, including two women, have died in Nepal's earthquake-hit Jajarkot district due to harsh cold weather. The individuals had taken refuge in separate tents as their homes were destroyed by the recent earthquake. Over 34,000 families in Jajarkot are still living in makeshift tents after the district was hit by a 6.4 magnitude earthquake on November 3, resulting in numerous casualties and displacements. The most vulnerable groups in these conditions are children, new mothers, patients with chronic illnesses, and the elderly population.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi visits Congress war room to oversee preparations for Rajasthan elections
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Congress leader Rahul Gandhi visited the Congress war room in Jaipur to oversee preparations for the assembly elections. However, Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot and his former deputy Sachin Pilot were not present.Congress leader Rahul Gandhi visited the Congress war room in Jaipur to oversee preparations for the Assembly elections. He motivated the team present there during his half-hour visit. Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot and former deputy Sachin Pilot were not present.

item.title: Karnataka HC orders removal of encroachments around archeological site in Nagamangala
item.description: The High Court of Karnataka has ordered the Deputy Commissioner of Mandya to take action against unauthorized constructions around the Saumyakeshava temple in Nagamangala. The court directed the Deputy Commissioner to issue a show-cause notice in newspapers within two weeks and remove the illegal encroachments within four weeks. A total of 1,566 constructions were found near the archaeological site, and it will now be determined which ones are illegal. A public interest litigation was filed in 2015, alleging that a Jama Masjid was built within 120 meters of the protected temple, in violation of the Ancient Monuments and Archaeological Sites and Remains Act. Despite previous notices from the Archaeological Survey of India, the construction continued without proper approvals.

item.title: Silkyara Tunnel collapse: BRO making road to top of hill to start vertical drilling
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Efforts are underway to build an access road at the top of the hill above Silkyara tunnel in Uttarkashi, Uttarakhand, to initiate vertical drilling and reach 41 workers trapped for seven days. Larger diameter pipes have been inserted through the debris to provide food and essentials to the trapped workers. The Border Roads Organisation (BRO) is working on building the access road. Senior officials, including those from the Prime Minister's Office, are stationed at the site. A five-plan strategy has been devised for rescue operations. Different agencies and senior officers are involved in the rescue operation. The Uttarakhand government has assigned a nodal officer for coordination.

item.title: Ocean of Blue: All roads lead to Motera
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The city of Ahmedabad is abuzz with excitement as the World Cup cricket final approaches. Fans wearing India jerseys and carrying flags are making their way to the Narendra Modi stadium, creating a traffic jam near the venue. The stadium, with a capacity of 132,000, is expected to be packed to its maximum. Streets leading to the stadium are lined with sellers offering counterfeit India jerseys. Many fans have come from different parts of India and even from abroad to witness the match. The event has also attracted dignitaries, politicians, businessmen, and Bollywood personalities who have arrived on charter flights. Hotel prices have skyrocketed, forcing some fans to sleep at the railway station due to high accommodation costs. The atmosphere in Ahmedabad is electric, with people eagerly waiting for the game and hoping for an Indian victory.

item.title: Ahead of 2024, Modi govt looks to expand reach of scheme for urban poor
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs in India plans to expand the scope of the Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Urban Livelihood Mission (DAY-NULM) to include more occupational groups among the urban poor. Targeted groups may include domestic workers, rickshaw drivers, waste pickers, gardeners, and construction workers. The DAY-NULM, launched in 2013, aims to reduce poverty and vulnerability by promoting self-help groups, skill development, self-employment training, and homeless shelters. The ministry is considering a shift towards entrepreneurship development, market linkages, standardizing norms for identifying the urban poor, and providing social benefits to all NULM beneficiaries. This move follows the success of the PM Street Vendor's AtmaNirbhar Nidhi scheme, which provided loans to street vendors affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. Although nearly 8.7 lakh self-help groups have been formed under DAY-NULM, experts suggest targeting a wider range of occupational groups and adopting income-generating schemes to address the challenges faced by the urban poor. Creating self-help groups in urban areas is more challenging due to the transient nature of migrant workers. The ministry is planning to focus on entrepreneurship development in the next phase of the mission, aiming to empower individuals with business knowledge and assistance.

item.title: Air pollution levels in Delhi down but need to remain vigilant: Gopal Rai
item.description: The air quality in Delhi has shown improvement in the past two days, according to Environment Minister Gopal Rai. However, he urges people to remain vigilant and adhere to pollution control measures. The progress made before Diwali was compromised by people bursting firecrackers. The improvement in air quality is attributed to favorable atmospheric conditions. The city's Air Quality Index (AQI) stood at 290, indicating a 'poor' level of air quality. The Centre has lifted certain restrictions due to the decline in air pollution levels. However, other restrictions, including a ban on non-essential construction and certain vehicles, will continue. The air quality predictions for the upcoming days suggest no significant deterioration.

item.title: Major water bodies in Jharkhand decorated with lights for Chhath puja
item.description: Water bodies in Jharkhand, including ponds, dams, and reservoirs, have been cleaned and decorated with lights for the Chhath Puja festival, which is dedicated to the worship of the sun god. Additional security forces and NDRF teams have been deployed in vulnerable water bodies to ensure a safe celebration. Drones, CCTV cameras, and motorcycle squads will also be monitoring the events. Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren visited major water bodies in Ranchi to review preparations, emphasizing cleanliness and safety. All Chhath ghats in Ranchi have been secured, and barricades and danger zone markings have been set up. Entry of heavy vehicles into the city has been restricted during certain hours.

item.title: Kia proved a new carmaker can come to India & succeed. But Tesla can’t — yet
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Indian Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal visited the Tesla factory in Fremont and media reports suggest that Tesla is in advanced negotiations with the Indian government to establish a presence in India. The government is considering offering customs duty reductions for electric vehicles (EVs) as part of its efforts to attract Tesla. Previously, India had high import duties on cars, but now it aims to adopt a model similar to Apple's. However, some manufacturers are concerned about the government's plans, arguing that any duty reduction should be limited to components and for a specific time frame. Despite the potential benefits for EV adoption in India, there are doubts about whether Tesla's dealership-free model will resonate with Indian consumers. Other carmakers are also catching up with Tesla, and a duty reduction on electric cars would benefit not only Tesla but also BMW and other German carmakers.

item.title: “May this Festival of Chhath bring great joy…”: Singapore envoy wishes Team India success ahead of WC final against Australia
item.description: Singapore's High Commissioner to India, Simon Wong, expressed his well wishes to Team India ahead of the World Cup 2023 final against Australia. He posted his message on social media, praying for success and joy for all, especially Team India. The article also explains the significance of the Chhath festival, primarily celebrated in states like Bihar, Jharkhand, and Uttar Pradesh. During the festival, people fast, bathe in rivers, and offer prayers to thank the Sun God for blessings. The fasting period involves consuming only pure foods and maintaining cleanliness. The report highlights India's journey to the final of the tournament, with an unbeaten record in the league phase and a comprehensive victory over New Zealand in the semifinal. The Indian team scored 397/4, led by contributions from Rohit Sharma, Shubman Gill, Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer, and KL Rahul. Mohammed Shami's outstanding performance secured a seven-wicket haul, sealing India's place in the final. India aims to win their third title and avenge their previous loss to Australia.

item.title: Viral videos: DMRC chief appeals to people to not engage in objectionable activities in Delhi Metro
item.description: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) chief, Vikas Kumar, has urged people to avoid engaging in objectionable activities after several controversial videos went viral on social media. These videos depict individuals dancing and couples being intimate inside metro trains and stations. Kumar stated that surprise checks are being conducted by designated squads to curb such incidents. He emphasized the need for citizens to report any such activities to authorities since security personnel cannot be present everywhere. While the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) guards the metro premises, DMRC squad members also monitor for violations such as men entering women's coaches. Kumar reassured that the DMRC is actively working to prevent such incidents, although the circulation of these videos has occasionally brought unwarranted criticism to the otherwise reputable Delhi Metro brand. The DMRC has been raising awareness about this issue through social media campaigns and posters displayed at metro stations.

item.title: Two injured in separate bear attacks in J-K’s Kishtwar
item.description: Two people were seriously injured after being attacked by black bears outside their homes in separate incidents in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district. The victims, Ghulam Hassain Chohan and Bhabhi Chand, were returning home from their fields when the attacks occurred. The bears fled after the incidents, and the injured were taken to the district hospital. Chand was later referred to a government medical college for specialized treatment. The wildlife department has visited the affected villages and laid traps to capture the bears.

item.title: 5 drug peddlers from Manipur, associate held in Guwahati
item.description: The Guwahati Police in India has reportedly busted an inter-state drug cartel, resulting in the arrest of five peddlers, including two women from Manipur. The police seized heroin worth approximately Rs 2.5 crore during the operation. An additional individual, believed to be associated with the peddlers, was also apprehended. The arrests were made in separate operations conducted across different locations in Guwahati. The suspects were found in possession of soap boxes containing suspected heroin weighing around 280 grams. Further investigations and legal actions are underway.

item.title: Anupam Kher sends best wishes to team India for World Cup 2023 final
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Veteran actor Anupam Kher expresses his confidence in Team India's performance in the World Cup 2023 final match against Australia. He shares his best wishes for the team and believes that India will win 100%. Kher conveys his enthusiasm through poetry, highlighting the need for passion and self-confidence to achieve victory. He mentions that he will watch the match and believes that India will win, considering the spirit and enthusiasm within the country. India reached the final after a comprehensive 70-run victory over New Zealand, with notable contributions from Rohit Sharma, Shubman Gill, Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer, KL Rahul, and Mohammed Shami. Australia reached the final by defeating South Africa in a close match.

item.title: Momentum high for India-EU FTA, have never seen such political will, says Lithuanian envoy
item.description: Lithuania's Ambassador to India, Diana Mickevičienė, has praised India as the largest democracy in the world and a key player in upholding the rules-based order. She emphasized the importance of engaging with India, particularly in the Indo-Pacific region. Mickevičienė highlighted the cultural ties between Lithuania and India, stating that the Lithuanian language has strong similarities to Sanskrit. She also mentioned that Lithuanian universities have a significant focus on studying India and Sanskrit. The ambassador expressed optimism about negotiating a free trade agreement between the European Union and India, emphasizing the high momentum and political will on both sides. She also commended India's efforts to strengthen cooperation with the EU in areas such as trade and technology.

item.title: Your hair loss is not solely about genes. Air pollution is turning you bald as well
item.description: The article discusses the various factors contributing to premature hair loss in both men and women, with a focus on male pattern baldness. It highlights genetic factors, air pollution, stress, nutritional deficiencies, and the excessive use of hair products as potential causes of hair loss. The article emphasizes the importance of scalp care and provides tips such as regular cleansing, wearing protective headgear, maintaining a nutrient-rich diet, improving indoor air quality, and avoiding heavily polluted areas. It concludes by emphasizing the need for consistent implementation of these practices to minimize the impact of pollutants and reduce the risk of hair loss.

item.title: Road accident in northeast Delhi, auto driver killed
item.description: A 30-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was killed and another person was seriously injured when their auto was hit by an unknown vehicle near the Welcome metro station in northeast Delhi. The deceased has been identified as Akram, while the injured person is yet to be identified. The police are scanning CCTV footage of the area to find the offending vehicle, and an FIR has been registered.A 30-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was killed and another person was seriously injured after an unknown vehicle crashed into their auto near the Welcome Metro Station in Northeast Delhi. The deceased has been identified as Akram, while the injured person's identity is still unknown. CCTV footage is being reviewed to identify the responsible vehicle, and a First Information Report (FIR) has been registered.

item.title: Driven out of Pakistan, Afghans to lose their homes, and businesses yet again
item.description: Thousands of Afghan refugees in Pakistan are being forced to leave the country, facing the loss of their businesses, assets, and savings. The Pakistani government claims it needs to protect its state and accuses many Afghans of involvement in criminal and terrorist activities. Despite possessing valid papers, even those with documentation are planned to be sent back after December 31. The situation has led to uncertainty and despair among the Afghan community in Pakistan. The returnees face challenges in transferring their assets as the Pakistani government has imposed restrictions on cash and property transfers to Afghanistan. Many Afghans are selling their possessions and properties at reduced rates, while some attempt to bribe officials or use illegal channels to send money to their homeland or relatives abroad. The issue has sparked discussions between Afghan and Pakistani officials. Both documented and undocumented refugees are struggling to recover their debts and assets. The Pakistani government maintains that all illegal immigrants must leave, with no legal cover for their businesses, assets, or properties.

item.title: Road crash in Rajasthan leaves 5 policemen dead

The deceased policemen have been identified as ASI Ramchandra and constables Kumbharam, Suresh Meena, Thanaram, and Mahendra. Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot expressed his condolences for the loss of lives and wished for the speedy recovery of the injured.

item.title: Michael B Jordan all set to direct ‘Creed 4’
item.description: American actor Michael B. Jordan will direct the fourth installment of the "Creed" franchise, according to franchise producer Irwin Winkler. Jordan made his directorial debut with "Creed 3," in which he also starred. MGM has not commented on "Creed 4." Jordan originally starred in the 2015 film "Creed," followed by a sequel in 2018 and a third film in 2023. In the first two films, Sylvester Stallone reprised his role as Rocky Balboa, mentoring Adonis Creed. Jordan and Amazon are also in talks to expand the "Creed" boxing world with a film and TV universe. Plans for "Creed 4" are delayed due to a strike, but pre-production is expected to begin in about a year.

item.title: Pak’s Chakwal seminary horror: Victims reveal gruesome details of abuse
item.description: Students from a seminary in Pakistan's Chakwal district have come forward with allegations of sexual assault and torture by two teachers. The victims claim that the teachers used intimidation tactics, including marking their hands with knives as a form of threat. The accused teachers have been expelled and arrested by the police, and examinations conducted by doctors have revealed signs of assault in at least eight students. The caretaker Chief Minister has taken notice of the incident and directed the police to submit a detailed report. The seminary's principal and administrative in-charge have been detained, while one of the accused teachers denies the allegations.

item.title: Taylor Swift postpones her Rio concert, here is why
item.description: American singer-songwriter Taylor Swift has postponed her concert in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, due to the extreme heat wave in the city. The safety and well-being of her fans, fellow performers, and crew is her top priority. The concert has been rescheduled to Monday, November 20. Swift expressed her sorrow over the death of a fan at her previous concert in Rio and extended her condolences to the fan's family and friends. The 23-year-old fan was taken to the hospital after feeling ill at the concert and unfortunately passed away. The mayor of Rio de Janeiro has ordered action to be taken to prevent similar incidents in the future.

item.title: Afghanistan: Special women’s exhibition faces challenges amid restrictions
item.description: The inaugural "Khadijah Al-Kubra" national and international exhibition for women in Kabul, Afghanistan, aimed at empowering entrepreneurial women, is facing obstacles and low turnout due to economic hardships. Limited attendance by women only hinders sales, with some participants considering closing booths due to the lack of visitors. The exhibition, organized by the Taliban administration's Ministry of Industry and Commerce in collaboration with the Women's Chamber of Commerce and Industries, aims to support children and mothers in Kabul. However, economic difficulties and Taliban-imposed restrictions limit women's participation. The World Bank has previously reported a decline in women's role in trade in Afghanistan due to changes in systems and restrictions on women's work and education.

item.title: Director confirms most patients, staff have evacuated Gaza’s Shifa Hospital
item.description: Most patients and staff have been evacuated from Shifa Hospital in Gaza, according to the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF). The IDF released a recording of a conversation with the hospital's director, who confirmed that only the sickest patients remain. The IDF also stated that they have provided food and water to the hospital. The recording refutes claims that the IDF demanded the hospital's evacuation. Shifa Hospital is Gaza's largest medical center and has a history of being used by Hamas for nefarious activities.

item.title: Three in four Palestinians support Hamas’ massacre: Survey
item.description: According to a survey conducted by the Arab World for Research and Development (AWRAD), over three-quarters of Palestinians have a positive view of Hamas following its October 7 terrorist attacks in Israel. The poll, which surveyed 668 Palestinian adults in the southern Gaza Strip, Judea, and Samaria, found that 48.2% of respondents characterized Hamas's role as "very positive," while 27.8% viewed it as "somewhat positive." Almost 80% regarded the role of Hamas's military wing, the Al-Qassam Brigade, as positive. The survey also found that 59.3% of Palestinians "extremely" supported the attacks, while only 12.7% expressed disapproval. Additionally, 98% of respondents held negative views of the United States.

item.title: Israel-Hamas war: Death toll from Oct 7 music festival massacre rises to 350
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The death toll from a Hamas attack at the Nova Music Festival in Tel Aviv has been raised from 260 to 350. The increase was based on data from Israel's National Insurance Institute, which found that more victims were shot and burned in their cars while trying to flee than initially thought. Additionally, 40 attendees were taken hostage in Gaza. In total, 1,200 people were killed in the attack and around 240 are confirmed to be held hostage. Authorities have identified 870 victims, but others remain unaccounted for. Archaeologists have been enlisted to help find the remains of the victims.

item.title: Biden stands firm against ceasefire, condemns West Bank violence in op-ed
item.description: US President Joe Biden has dismissed calls for a ceasefire in Gaza, stating that it will not bring about peace. In an op-ed published in The Washington Post, Biden argued that as long as Hamas continues its destructive ideology, a ceasefire is not a solution. He called for Israel to respect humanitarian law and minimize civilian casualties, advising against being misled by hurt and rage. Biden reiterated his support for a two-state solution and suggested governance under the Palestinian Authority while working towards that goal. He also condemned extremist violence against Palestinians in the West Bank and warned that the US is prepared to issue visa bans against the perpetrators. The article also mentions concerns about Israel violating the visa waiver program, and the Biden administration's proposed package for security assistance for conflicts in Ukraine and Israel. Biden ended by denouncing increasing antisemitism and islamophobia related to the conflict between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu faces battles on multiple fronts amid mounting calls to free hostages
item.description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is facing pressure to secure the release of hostages held by Hamas. Families and supporters of the hostages marched from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem, demanding action from the government. Public opinion is turning against Netanyahu, with polls indicating a decline in support for him and his coalition. Opposition leader Yair Lapid has called for Netanyahu's resignation due to a loss of public trust. Negotiations for a ceasefire and hostage release face challenges due to contentious issues, and the Israeli government's attempts to ease conditions in Gaza have drawn criticism from within Netanyahu's coalition. Families blame Netanyahu for failing to anticipate an attack by Hamas and prioritize judicial reform over security preparations. Criticism of Netanyahu's lack of empathy and failure to take responsibility for security lapses has also grown. Many hope for a new government once the war concludes and the hostages are returned.

item.title: Save the Children issues warning on disease outbreaks among children returning from Pakistan
item.description: Save the Children, a humanitarian organization, has raised concerns about a surge in diseases among returning migrants from Pakistan. In the last month alone, they recorded over 3,000 cases of acute respiratory infections and 1,200 cases of diarrhea among migrant children. The organization highlighted overcrowded cargo trucks, dust exposure, and makeshift shelters as contributors to respiratory infections. With 80% of returnees being children and women, many are facing harsh conditions without sufficient shelter, resources, and food. The World Health Organization has also expressed apprehensions about disease spread, including polio, among returnees, stressing the need for $10 million to provide healthcare services. Concerns have been raised about potential disease outbreaks, including childhood paralysis, as hundreds of thousands have already returned to Afghanistan.

item.title: Pakistan: Kidnapped policeman found dead in Lakki mountains

Despite a search operation by the police, his body was found with bullet wounds and taken for an autopsy. Efforts are ongoing to locate and apprehend the terrorists responsible. In a separate incident, three individuals, including a woman and a minor girl, were killed in a road accident, while two others were injured. The injured were transported to a hospital for medical attention. The names of the deceased and injured have not been confirmed.

item.title: Soccer-Centurion Mane celebrates with two goals in Senegal win
item.description: Senegal, South Africa, and Tanzania all emerged victorious in their respective World Cup qualifying matches. Senegal's Sadio Mane celebrated his 100th cap for the national team by scoring two goals in their 4-0 win over South Sudan. South Africa defeated Benin 2-1 at home, while Tanzania secured a 1-0 away victory against Niger. The winners of the nine qualifying groups will advance to the 2026 finals, hosted by Canada, Mexico, and the United States. Meanwhile, Algeria, Egypt, and Nigeria face challenging away games in their upcoming qualifiers.

item.title: Soccer-France annihilate 10-man Gibraltar 14-0 in record win
item.description: France achieved their largest ever victory with a 14-0 win against Gibraltar in a Euro 2024 Group B qualifier. Kylian Mbappe scored a hat-trick and Warren Zaire-Emery scored on his debut. France were 7-0 up by halftime, with multiple players contributing to the scoreline. Gibraltar were reduced to 10 men in the 18th minute, and France's biggest win to date, a 10-0 victory over Azerbaijan in 1995, seemed possible. The record was broken with goals from Adrien Rabiot, Kingsley Coman, Ousmane Dembele, and Olivier Giroud.

item.title: Soccer-Dutch qualify for Euro 2024 finals as they edge Ireland
item.description: The Netherlands secured their spot at the European Championship with a 1-0 victory over Ireland. Striker Wout Weghorst scored an early goal, running straight towards the net and finding the roof of the goal. The Dutch finished second in Group B, six points behind France who topped the group. Greece finished in third place, but could not catch up to the Netherlands. The Dutch team will conclude their campaign with a match against Gibraltar.The Netherlands secured a spot in next year's European Championship by defeating Ireland 1-0. Wout Weghorst's early goal sealed the victory for the Dutch, who finished second in Group B. Despite the win, the Netherlands finished six points behind group winners France, who maintained a perfect record in their seven group matches. The Dutch will conclude their campaign with a match against Gibraltar on Tuesday.

item.title: Soccer-Romania secure Euro 2024 spot with comeback win over Israel
item.description: In a group I qualifying clash on Saturday, Romania secured a spot in Euro 2024 by defeating Israel 2-1 in Hungary. The match was closely contested, with Israel taking an early lead through Eran Zahavi's header. However, Romania quickly equalized through George Puscas, who headed in a rebound. The winning goal came from Ianis Hagi, who scored with a low shot from a tight angle. Tensions rose as Romania's Valentin Mihaila received a red card late in the match. With this loss, Israel will move into the playoffs for another chance to qualify for next year's finals in Germany.

item.title: Soccer-Dutch qualify for Euro 2024 with 1-0 win over Ireland in Amsterdam
item.description: The Netherlands secured a spot in Euro 2024 by defeating Ireland 1-0 in their final Group B match. Wout Weghorst scored the only goal of the game after just 12 minutes. The Dutch finish in second place in the group with 15 points, six behind group winners France. Despite missing several key players due to injury, the Dutch outplayed Ireland throughout the match but were unable to extend their lead. Ireland had a chance to equalize, but the goal was ruled out for offside. This may be manager Stephen Kenny's final competitive match, as Ireland will play a friendly against New Zealand next.

item.title: Ousted OpenAI CEO Altman planning new AI venture-sources
item.description: Former CEO of OpenAI, Sam Altman, is reportedly working on a new artificial intelligence venture following his ousting from the company. Sources indicate that Greg Brockman, the former president of OpenAI who left after Altman's firing, is expected to join the new effort. Altman and former Apple design chief Jony Ive have also been discussing the development of a new AI hardware device. Altman's departure from OpenAI was due to a breakdown of communication, according to an internal company memo. Some researchers at OpenAI, including Szymon Sidor, have quit the company, but it is unclear if they will join Altman's new venture.

item.title: Taylor Swift postpones Rio de Janeiro show due to heat after fan’s death
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Taylor Swift postponed her concert in Rio de Janeiro due to scorching heat, following the death of a fan who fell ill at the concert venue. Ana Clara Benevides, 23, became unwell during the show and later died in the hospital. The cause of her death is currently unknown and under investigation. The extreme temperatures in Rio prompted Swift to prioritize the safety and well-being of her fans, performers, and crew. On Friday, several fans fell ill during the concert, leading Swift to interrupt the performance and request water for them. The government has ordered concert organizers to guarantee water access at all of Swift's concerts in Brazil, and new measures have been put in place to provide free drinking water during shows with high heat exposure. The concert scheduled for Saturday was postponed to Monday.

item.title: Biden says Palestinian Authority should ultimately govern Gaza and West Bank
item.description: US President Joe Biden stated in an opinion article that the Palestinian Authority should ultimately govern the Gaza Strip and the West Bank. He emphasized the need to work towards a two-state solution and called for no forcible displacement of Palestinians, no reoccupation, blockade, or reduction in territory. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu disagreed with Biden's plan, stating that the Palestinian Authority is not currently capable of accepting responsibility for Gaza. Biden also mentioned the US's preparedness to issue visa bans against extremists attacking civilians in the West Bank. Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas called on Biden to pressure Israel to stop violence against Palestinians. The West Bank has experienced escalating violence for over a year, drawing international concern.

item.title: Hollywood actor Michael Douglas to address masterclass during IFFI in Panaji
item.description: Hollywood actor Michael Douglas will be addressing a master class at the upcoming International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa. The festival will be held from November 20-28, and Douglas will be attending between November 27 and 29 to receive the Satyajit Ray Lifetime Achievement Award. The 54th edition of IFFI will feature major packages of international cinema, with a significant increase in submissions compared to last year. The festival will screen a total of 198 international films, including 15 from the international competition section and 7 from the best debut director category. Additionally, there will be 103 films in the "Cinema of the World" section, showcasing diverse aesthetics and narratives from around the globe. Michael Douglas is an acclaimed American actor and film producer, having won multiple awards throughout his career.

item.title: IDF expands operations in Jabalia and Zeitoun
item.description: The IDF has announced that its forces have expanded their offensive activity in the Gaza Strip. The 36th Division launched an attack in the Zeitoun region, targeting the Hamas "Zeitoun" battalion, while the 162nd Armored Division attacked the Jabalia region, a significant terrorist stronghold. The IDF encountered numerous terrorists during these operations and aimed to clear the neighborhoods of terrorists and destroy their infrastructure.The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) have announced that their offensive operations in the Gaza Strip are expanding. The 36th Division and the 162nd Armored Division launched attacks in the Zeitoun and Jabalia regions, respectively. The Zeitoun neighborhood is a significant operational area for Hamas, where its "Zeitoun" battalion operates. The IDF forces are working to clear the neighborhoods on the outskirts of Zeitoun, removing terrorists and damaging their infrastructure. In the Jabalia region, the command and control center of Hamas' Northern Gaza Strip Brigade is located, making it one of the most significant terrorist strongholds in the area. This report was auto-generated from the ANI news service.

item.title: UAE President directs treatment for 1,000 Palestinian cancer patients in UAE hospitals
item.description: UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan has directed the provision of medical care for 1,000 Palestinian cancer patients from the Gaza Strip. The patients will receive treatment and healthcare in UAE hospitals. This initiative is part of the UAE's ongoing efforts to support the Palestinian people and mitigate the humanitarian situation in Gaza. The president has also directed that 1,000 Palestinian children requiring medical care be hosted in the UAE, along with their families. They will receive comprehensive healthcare services until their full recovery and return. Additionally, a fully equipped field hospital will be set up in the Gaza Strip to address the humanitarian needs of those affected by the conflict.

item.title: “Some men take pride in being openly disgusting”: Singer Chinmayi Sripaada reacts to Mansoor Ali Khan’s derogatory remark on Trisha
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Singer Chinmayi Sripaada reacted to actor Mansoor Ali Khan's derogatory remarks about his co-star Trisha Krishnan. Chinmayi also mentioned incidents involving Mansoor and other actors where offensive comments went unchallenged. She expressed her disappointment that no action was taken and criticized the current mindset that allows such behavior to continue. Trisha also condemned Mansoor's comments, calling them sexist, disrespectful, and repulsive. Mansoor had made inappropriate remarks about Trisha in a video interview, stating that he expected a bedroom scene with her in their film and bragging about doing rape scenes before. The article concludes by mentioning that the film 'Leo' also stars Sanjay Dutt, Trisha Krishnan, and Arjun Sarja, and it marks a reunion between Vijay and director Lokesh Kanagaraj after the film 'Master.'

item.title: Released from juvenile home a month ago, 17-yr-old kills another teen in Delhi; apprehended
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！On Friday evening, a 17-year-old boy named Akash was allegedly stabbed to death by a teenager who had been released from a juvenile home just a month ago. The incident took place in the Aman Vihar area of New Delhi. The accused teenager was apprehended in Sonipat, Haryana, and brought back to Delhi. The motive behind the killing is believed to be an act of revenge, as the victim and his friend had previously assaulted the accused. The accused has a history of criminal cases, including robbery, cheating, and assault, and had been sent to a juvenile home in the past.

item.title: Missing man found dead inside pit in Ghaziabad
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The body of a missing man, Satyendra, was discovered in a forest pit in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh. Satyendra had gone to collect money on Friday but did not return home. The police found his body based on information provided by passers-by. The Assistant Commissioner of Police stated that it appears to be a case of monetary dispute, and an FIR has been filed against unknown assailants. The body has been sent for post-mortem, and the report is awaited.A missing man's body was discovered in a pit in a forest area in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh. The victim, Satyendra, had gone to collect money from someone but never returned home. His body was found based on information provided by passers-by the following day. The police suspect it to be a case of a monetary dispute and have filed an FIR against unknown assailants. The body has been sent for post-mortem, and further details are awaited.

item.title: Five policemen arrested for stealing seized liquor, table fans
item.description: Five policemen, including an assistant sub-inspector, have been arrested for allegedly stealing seized liquor bottles and table fans worth Rs 1.97 lakh from a police station in Gujarat's Mahisagar district. The items had been stored in the women's lock-up at the Bakor police station in Khanpur taluka. The theft was discovered during a cleaning operation ahead of an inspection visit by senior officers. CCTV footage showed the assistant sub-inspector orchestrating the theft and turning off the cameras. He, along with three other policemen, was arrested under charges of theft. One more person who allegedly helped them is still at large.

item.title: More than 2 dozen girls hurt as helium balloons explode outside temple in Mehsana district
item.description: At least 25 girls, aged between 10 and 15 years, were injured in Mehsana district of Gujarat, India, during a religious event. The incident occurred outside a temple when the girls were holding helium balloons as part of the ceremony. The balloons exploded after coming into contact with sparks from firecrackers, causing burn injuries to the girls. They were taken to nearby hospitals for treatment. A video of the incident shows each girl holding a bunch of small balloons, which were intended to be released into the air. While 10 girls have been discharged after receiving primary treatment, 15 are still undergoing treatment at the hospital.

item.title: Development of sustainable jet fuels much-needed step to decarbonise economy: President Murmu
item.description: The President of India, Droupadi Murmu, stated at a conference in New Delhi that developing sustainable jet fuels and adopting new propulsion technologies such as electric, hydrogen, and hybrid on a large scale are essential steps in decarbonizing the economy. She emphasized that decarbonizing aero-propulsion is necessary due to the threat of climate change and global warming. Murmu highlighted the challenge of finding non-fossil sustainable resources to replace traditional fuels, as they have high density. She also discussed the transformative phase of the aerospace sector, the need to cultivate skilled human resources, and India's achievements in space missions. The article is from PTI News Service.

item.title: Aditya Pancholi snapped in Ahmedabad ahead of World Cup final
item.description: Actor Aditya Pancholi is excited to watch the IND vs AUS World Cup final live. India will be playing against Australia in Ahmedabad, aiming to reverse the result of the 2003 final that India lost. India stormed into the finals after a comprehensive victory over New Zealand, while Australia reached the final by defeating South Africa. The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has announced a list of celebrities who will perform ahead of the final match, including an air show by the Surya Kiran acrobatic team of the Indian Air Force and performances by singers and music composers. A special laser and light show will also be performed during the match.

item.title: 3 minors apprehended for pelting stones in Haryana’s Nuh
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Three minors were apprehended in connection with a stone pelting incident in Nuh, India, where eight women were injured. One nine-year-old was released on bail, while two 12-year-olds were sent to a correctional home. The incident occurred when unidentified persons allegedly hurled stones at the women from a mosque and madrasa. Police are thoroughly investigating the case and have registered an FIR against unidentified persons. The minors were apprehended based on CCTV footage, and further investigation is ongoing. The incident has been strongly condemned by the Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP), who are calling for strict action against the culprits.

item.title: IGP Jammu visits army’s Delta Force headquarters, reviews security measures
item.description: The Inspector General of Police in Jammu Zone, Anand Jain, visited the Delta Force headquarters in the Chenab Valley. He was briefed on the counter-terrorism grid in the region and discussed security measures, including highway security. The General Officer Commanding of the Delta Force also provided information about the functions of the counter-terrorism grid in the districts of Doda, Kishtwar, and Ramban. Additionally, Jain chaired a meeting to review the security and crime situation and emphasized enhanced cooperation between police and other security forces to combat terrorism and drug abuse. Jain also inquired about the condition of the injured individuals from a recent bus accident in Doda.

item.title: World Cup finals: Sonia Gandhi wishes good luck to Indian team
item.description: Congress leader Sonia Gandhi sent her best wishes to the Indian cricket team ahead of the World Cup finals against Australia. Gandhi praised the team's performance and teamwork during the tournament and expressed confidence in their abilities to become champions. She also highlighted the valuable lessons of unity, hard work, determination, and self-belief that the team's journey has exemplified. Gandhi mentioned India's previous World Cup victories in 1983 and 2011, which filled the nation with pride and joy.Congress leader Sonia Gandhi sent her best wishes to the Indian cricket team ahead of the World Cup finals against Australia. She congratulated the team for their performance and teamwork throughout the tournament and expressed her confidence in their ability to become champions. Gandhi also highlighted the inspiring journey of the team and the valuable lessons it offers beyond the cricket field, such as unity, hard work, determination, and self-belief. She mentioned the previous occasions when India won the World Cup in 1983 and 2011, stating that they brought honor and joy to the nation.

item.title: Afghanistan: Concerns grow over detentions of women, civil society activists under Taliban regime
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！Amnesty International and women's rights advocates have condemned the continued detention of women's rights activists in Afghanistan. They warn that these restrictions can lead to sexual harassment and crimes against humanity. The recent detention of Parisa Azadeh, a women's rights activist, has raised deep concern, with several activists claiming that the Taliban administration is marginalizing women in the country. The human rights organization emphasizes that the persistent restrictions and unlawful suppression of Afghan girls and women could result in crimes against humanity and sexual harassment. Afghanistan's representative at the United Nations, Nasir Ahmad Faiq, believes that the detention of Parisa Azadeh goes against Islamic and international laws. Women's rights activists argue that the Taliban administration has been suppressing women's protests to instill fear and marginalize them. Several women's rights activists, including Nida Parwani, Julia Parsi, and Manizha Seddiqi, have been detained under the Taliban government's control for over a month. Over the past two years, the Taliban has issued more than 50 restrictive orders on the lives of Afghan women and girls, leading human rights activists to see it as a form of gender apartheid.

item.title: “Leave behind politics of division, hate”: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari calls for shift towards “new politics”
item.description: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, chairman of the Pakistan People's Party (PPP), has called for a shift towards "new politics" in order to address the challenges faced by Pakistan. He criticized the divisive and abusive nature of traditional politics and emphasized the importance of unity and addressing contemporary issues. Zardari also commented on the upcoming general elections and expressed confidence in the PPP's victory. He took a jab at the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) without mentioning their name, referring to their recent alliances. Zardari highlighted the issues of inflation, poverty, and unemployment in the country and stated that the PPP's slogan and manifesto remain focused on addressing these challenges. The party plans to start its election campaign soon, and Zardari is optimistic about their prospects.

item.title: “People like him bring a bad name…”: Trisha Krishnan slams Mansoor Ali Khan for his derogatory remark

Trisha responded to the video, calling Mansoor's comments sexist, disrespectful, misogynistic, repulsive, and in bad taste. She also stated that she will ensure she never shares screen space with him again. 'Leo' is directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj and also stars Sanjay Dutt and Arjun Sarja.

item.title: “We will walk to Gaza”: Mother of hostage during protest march outside Netanyahu’s office
item.description: The family members of Israeli hostages held by the Hamas terror group gathered outside Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office in Jerusalem, demanding immediate action to bring their loved ones home. Around 30,000 people, including thousands of Israelis, joined the multi-day march from Tel Aviv to the PM's office. The mother of one hostage expressed her pain, saying that although her body ached from the long march, nothing hurt like her heart. The families sought a meeting with government ministers to discuss plans for the hostages' return, as many felt abandoned by the government. The families were grateful for the support they received from the public during the march. After the protest, they were scheduled to meet with War Cabinet Minister Benny Gantz and Cabinet Observer Minister Gadi Eisenkot. The families had not received a response from other War Cabinet ministers regarding their request for a meeting.

item.title: Under Cong govt, Rajasthan became number one in corruption, crime against women: Adityanath
item.description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath criticized the Congress government in Rajasthan, claiming that the state has witnessed a rise in corruption, crime against women, cybercrime, and cow smuggling. Adityanath addressed public meetings in support of BJP candidates in Jalore, Barmer, and Balotra. He accused the Congress government of allowing criminals to thrive in various sectors and highlighted issues like high electricity rates, petrol and diesel prices, leakage of exam papers, and unemployment leading to suicides in Rajasthan. Adityanath emphasized the need for a BJP-led government in the state to address these problems.

item.title: 42 booked in Jalandhar-Chintpurni highway compensation distribution scam: Punjab Vigilance
item.description: 您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Punjab Vigilance Bureau has registered a case against 42 individuals for embezzling Rs 64 crore in the Jalandhar-Chintpurni highway compensation scam. A Special Investigation Team (SIT) discovered that records were missing from the office of the sub-divisional magistrate and tehsildar of Hoshiarpur during their investigation. The former SDM, Anand Sagar Sharma, fraudulently altered the draft plan prepared by Louis Berger company and released compensation illegally to his acquaintances who had purchased land in the new road alignment. Out of the 42 people implicated, eight have been arrested. It was found that Sharma manipulated the highway alignment in five villages, changing the nature of land from agricultural to residential and commercial through false reports prepared by his subordinate. He then disbursed compensation at residential rates instead of agricultural rates, benefitting those involved in the scam. The SDM shared confidential information with his associates, who subsequently contacted the original landowners and purchased the land in collaboration with revenue officials.

item.title: Ghaziabad authorities raze 26 illegal shops built by gangster
item.description: The Ghaziabad Development Authority has demolished 26 illegally constructed shops in the Loni area of Ghaziabad. The shops were built by an alleged land mafia and gangster named Mehboob Ali using money earned through unfair means. The market value of the demolished shops is estimated to be around Rs 14 crore. Ali had acquired properties from innocent people using fake documents, and all his illegal properties have been seized.您的免费额度不够使用这个模型啦，请点击右上角登录继续使用！The Ghaziabad Development Authority in Uttar Pradesh demolished 26 illegally constructed shops in the Loni area.
