item.title: Afghanistan: Refugees in Torkham region appeal for relocation to their homes
item.description: Refugees who have returned to Afghanistan and are currently residing in the Torkham crossing region are urging the government to speed up the registration and assistance distribution processes so they can return to their homes quickly. They have also requested help from the Taliban before winter arrives. Meanwhile, the Afghan Red Crescent Society acknowledges that food assistance alone cannot solve the difficulties faced by these returnees and will focus more on helping migrants in isolated parts of the country. Since the Pakistani government set a deadline, more Afghan immigrants have been returning through the Torkham border, with approximately 500 families using this route daily. Around 55,000 people have entered the country through the Torkham border within the past month and a half, and many of these families have completed the necessary registration and biometric procedures.

item.title: 70% of antibiotic fixed-dose combination drugs sold in India unapproved or banned, finds study
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.A recent analysis has revealed that government efforts to remove unapproved and banned antibiotic fixed-dose combination (FDC) drugs in India have been largely ineffective. The study found that in 2020, the majority of antibiotic formulations sold in India were either unapproved or banned. FDC drugs are combinations of two or more active pharmaceutical ingredients in a single drug. While the total number of antibiotic FDC formulations on the market decreased from 574 in 2008 to 395 in 2020, around 70.4% of these formulations were unapproved or banned. Antibiotic resistance is a global concern, making it crucial to address this issue. The study suggests that regular surveys of the market and strengthened enforcement are necessary. Despite regulatory initiatives taken since 2007, hundreds of unapproved antibiotic FDC formulations have remained in the Indian market. Additionally, a considerable portion of antibiotic FDCs sold in India in 2020 were not recommended by the World Health Organization (WHO). The slow progress in removing irrational FDC drugs is attributed to weak and inefficient regulatory enforcement.

item.title: Chinese President Xi Jinping arrives in San Francisco for talks with Biden
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping arrived in San Francisco for a China-US summit and the 30th APEC Economic Leaders' meeting. US President Joe Biden is set to meet with Jinping in the San Francisco Bay area, aiming to improve relations between the two countries. The meeting is viewed as a positive sign after months of friction, although it is not expected to significantly soften the overall relationship. The leaders hope to develop a framework for managing competitive relations to avoid surprises and clear up misperceptions. Biden's top priority is to restore stability in the Washington-Beijing relationship amidst rising global tensions. They will discuss various issues, including military communication, conflicts in Israel and Ukraine, climate change, countering narcotics trafficking, human rights, and military escalation in the South China Sea and Taiwan. The talks will be expansive and spread out over multiple sessions. The US has pressured China to play a more constructive role in the Israel-Hamas and Russia-Ukraine conflicts and take a more active role on the world stage.

item.title: US House passes GOP funding bill to avoid government shutdown
item.description: The House of Representatives has passed a bill to prevent a government shutdown before the holiday season, with broad bipartisan support. The bill will now move on to the Senate for consideration. Initially, the House extended government funding until November 17, but due to another impending deadline, leaders agreed on a short-term extension called a continuing resolution (CR). Speaker Mike Johnson, who recently assumed the position, achieved a win by gaining majority support from his GOP Conference for the CR. The bill sets separate deadlines for funding different sectors of the government, with January 19 and February 2 as the target dates. Some conservative members had concerns about the bill's lack of spending cuts and conservative policy riders. However, both the Senate leadership and the White House have indicated their approval, aiming to avoid a shutdown. President Joe Biden is prepared to sign the bill if it passes in the Senate.

item.title: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf chief Imran Khan’s physical remand rejected
item.description: An accountability court in Rawalpindi has rejected the request for the physical remand of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) chief and former Prime Minister Imran Khan in two cases. The cases, known as the Toshakhana and Al-Qadir Trust cases, are related to allegations of corruption and submitting fake details of Toshakhana gifts to the Election Commission of Pakistan. Imran Khan has filed a petition with the Islamabad High Court seeking the suspension of the trial court's verdict. The National Accountability Bureau (NAB) has initiated an investigation against Imran Khan, his wife, and others for alleged land gain in the name of Al Qadir University Trust, causing a reported loss of 190 million pounds to the national exchequer.

item.title: US labels Palestinian Islamic Jihad leader a ‘Global Terrorist’, sanctions imposed on key Hamas officials
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The US State Department has designated Akram al-Ajouri, the leader of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad's militant wing, as a specially designated global terrorist. The US Treasury Department has also imposed sanctions on key Hamas officials and the mechanisms by which Iran supports Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad. These actions are in response to the October 7 Hamas attack against Israel and aim to restrict access to resources and funding. The Treasury Department has also sanctioned individuals and organizations associated with Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad, including a money exchange company used to transfer funds to Hamas.

item.title: Time to tell Xi Jinping to turn back: Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi ahead of US-China talks
item.description: US lawmaker Raja Krishnamoorthi believes that China's economic decline has given the United States an advantage in negotiations. Ahead of the upcoming summit between US President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping, Krishnamoorthi urges Biden to tell Xi to change course. He highlights the need for China to keep its promises, compete fairly, end genocide, and halt economic and military aggression. Krishnamoorthi emphasizes the importance of being clear-eyed, confident, and strong in dealing with China. He acknowledges the possibility that Xi may not change his policies, but expresses hope that their resolve will only strengthen. Krishnamoorthi states that the competition between the US and the Chinese Communist Party is not a game, but a contest over values, economic models, and global visions. He asserts that the US can protect itself by aggressively using trade tools, such as enforcing the Uyghur Forced Labor Prevention Act and avoiding investments in companies under human rights sanctions. Krishnamoorthi accuses the CCP of engaging in a military buildup and threatening Taiwan, and dismisses their claims over the South China Sea as illegal.

item.title: Washington DC: Demonstrators from across country ‘March for Israel’
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Over 290,000 demonstrators gathered in Washington, DC for the "March for Israel," denouncing antisemitism and calling for the release of Israeli hostages. Israeli President Isaac Herzog addressed the crowd via live video feed, emphasizing unity in supporting those held by Hamas and the right of every Jew to live safely. The event, considered the largest pro-Israel gathering in the US since October 7, prompted unprecedented security measures designated as a "Level 1" event by the Department of Homeland Security. The march was organized by the Jewish Federations of North America and the Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations to demonstrate American support for Israel amid escalating tensions between Israel and Hamas. Israel's Ambassador to the US, Michael Herzog, asked the crowd to raise their voice as Israel continues its operation in Gaza, highlighting the spread of antisemitism worldwide. Protests advocating for a ceasefire have also taken place in the vicinity of the Capitol.

item.title: US: Republican Senator challenges labour leader to fistfight during congressional hearing
item.description: A heated exchange occurred during a Senate committee hearing between Republican Senator Markwayne Mullin and Teamsters President Sean O'Brien. The confrontation began when Mullin threatened O'Brien after referring to a tweet where O'Brien challenged him. Mullin, a former MMA fighter, stood up from his chair and approached O'Brien, prompting committee Chairman Bernie Sanders to intervene and urge them to sit down. Despite Sanders' efforts, the argument continued, with both individuals exchanging insults. The confrontation stems from a history of clashes between O'Brien and Mullin, dating back to a committee hearing in March.

item.title: Biden likely to discuss Ukraine and Israel wars with Xi Jinping, will urge China for containment
item.description: US President Joe Biden is preparing for a summit with Chinese President Xi Jinping. The ongoing conflicts in Ukraine and between Israel and Hamas will be discussed during the meetings. The US aims to persuade China to use its influence with Russia and Iran to contain these conflicts. Biden's meeting with Xi is significant as he seeks to enhance ties with China and avoid additional crises. The US seeks to restore military communication with China and manage the risk of miscalculation or miscommunication. Biden also wants to shape China's role in the Middle East, particularly in relation to Iran. The outcome of the summit will determine the success of Biden's efforts to enlist China's support in managing global conflicts. Both leaders will face diplomatic challenges during this critical summit.

item.title: Former Indian defence secretary joins as advisor to USISPF Board
item.description: Former Indian Defence Secretary Ajay Kumar has joined as an advisor to the Board at the US-India Strategic and Partnership Forum. Kumar brings over three decades of expertise in defence and emerging technology. He played a pivotal role in boosting technology cooperation, strengthening the defence framework, and enhancing the defence and space ecosystem in India. Kumar is credited with transforming the defence industry ecosystem under the AtmaNirbhar Bharat initiative and implementing the corporatisation of the Ordnance Factories Board and the iDEX Programme. He has also served in various capacities in the Electronics and Information Technology sector.

item.title: Piyush Goyal attends ministerial-level talks on ‘Clean Economy and Fair Economy’ in San Francisco
item.description: The Indo-Pacific Economic Framework (IPEF) ministers, including Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal, held talks on "Clean Economy and Fair Economy" in San Francisco. They also signed an agreement on the resilient chain under the IPEF, aiming to strengthen relations and reduce dependence on China after the Covid-19 pandemic. While other members were unable to strike a substantial trade deal, India has stayed away from the trade talks but kept its options open. Minister Goyal engaged in bilateral meetings and participated in the Investors Round Table, promoting India as an attractive investment destination. He also visited the Tesla Factory Unit and met with Singapore's Minister for Trade and Industry. One of the key focuses of the visit will be the "India-USA Innovation Handshake Initiative," aiming to connect startup ecosystems and promote innovation and job growth. Goyal is expected to interact with technology, entrepreneurship, and academic communities in Silicon Valley to discuss investment opportunities in India.

item.title: Mexico: First openly non-binary magistrate and LGBTQ activist found dead
item.description: Ociel Baena Saucedo, Mexico's first openly non-binary magistrate and an LGBTQ activist, was found dead in their home in Aguascalientes. The body of Baena's partner was also discovered in the same residence. While the cause of death remains unknown, authorities have indicated no immediate signs of foul play. Preliminary findings suggest that there was no third person involved and no traces of blood outside the crime scene. Baena's non-binary identity has prompted a gender perspective in the investigation, although there is no mention of the deaths potentially being linked to a hate crime. Baena served in the Electoral Tribunal of Aguascalientes and was recognized as the first non-binary magistrate in Latin America, advocating for LGBTQ rights. Despite progress in marriage equality, LGBTQ+ activists and gender minorities still face violence and discrimination in Mexico. The tragic loss of Baena adds to the challenges faced by the LGBTQ+ community in the country.

item.title: Pakistan: Nawaz Sharif initiates ‘Quetta mission’ to garner support from ‘electables’
item.description: PML-N leader Nawaz Sharif is visiting Balochistan to build strategic alliances ahead of the February 8 general elections in Pakistan. He has received an invitation from the 'Sardars of Balochistan' to visit Quetta. The PML-N is reportedly aiming to secure at least 25 sardars/electables from Balochistan, where electables play a crucial role in elections. The PPP is also actively seeking support from electables in Balochistan. PML-N President Shehbaz Sharif's son, Hamza Shehbaz, emphasizes the need for collaboration among parties to navigate the country through crises. He also considers it a positive sign if there is support from the establishment and stresses the importance of cordial relations.

item.title: India reiterates call for revitalisation of General Assembly at UN summit
item.description: Indian Counsellor Pratik Mathur highlighted the importance of revitalizing the role of the General Assembly during a statement at the UN Summit. He expressed concern over thematic issues primarily being discussed in the Security Council, which undermines the authority of the General Assembly. Mathur emphasized the critical role of the General Assembly in setting the global agenda and restoring the centrality of the United Nations in addressing transnational issues. He also acknowledged that some blame lies with the General Assembly and its member states for allowing its relevance to be diluted. Mathur's call for revitalizing the General Assembly's role is seen as crucial in shaping the global agenda. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has also previously stated that the resistance to reforming the UN's structure may render it "anachronistic." India has consistently raised the issue of global system reforms on the global stage.

item.title: “Your plan is not working”: Braverman lashes out at UK PM Sunak day after her sacking
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. She expressed her disappointment on social media, stating that she had accepted the role under certain conditions and firm assurances. Braverman cited four key policy priorities that Sunak failed to deliver on, including reducing overall legal migration and protecting single-sex spaces in schools. She accused Sunak of never intending to keep his promises and called his leadership style into question. Braverman also criticized Sunak's response to extremism and antisemitism, labeling it weak and lacking in leadership qualities. She highlighted her achievements as Home Secretary, such as recruiting new police officers and enacting various laws. Braverman concluded by urging Sunak to change course urgently, as his plan is not working and the Conservative party is experiencing record election defeats.

item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Goyal expressed his regret at not being able to meet Musk and praised the presence of Indian professionals and auto component suppliers in Tesla's supply chain. Musk thanked Goyal for visiting Tesla and apologized for not being able to meet in person, looking forward to a future meeting. Goyal stated that Tesla is on its way to double its component imports from India and expressed pride in seeing Indian engineers and finance professionals contributing to Tesla's journey. Musk previously announced plans to visit India next year and expressed gratitude to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his support in making significant investments in India.

item.title: 20 people injured in clash in UP’s Bhadohi
item.description: A clash between two groups over a land dispute in the Gopiganj area of Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi district resulted in at least 20 people getting injured. The groups attacked each other using sticks, bricks, and sharp-edged weapons, causing a heavy traffic jam on the national highway for over an hour. The police managed to bring the situation under control and made 18 arrests, including five women. The clash occurred in Chandrapur village between the groups led by Bangali Yadav and Ram Chandra Yadav. A thorough investigation is underway.

The girl's father had filed a police complaint against the accused, who had been previously arrested but later released on bail. The accused has now been booked on charges of abetment of suicide, and efforts are underway to apprehend him.Hmm, I am not sure. item.title: Two arrested, two juveniles detained for Delhi man’s murder
item.description: Two men have been arrested and two juveniles have been detained for allegedly murdering a 19-year-old in Delhi's Nangloi area. The victim, identified as Tarun, was stabbed during a dispute over money while drinking with the accused. The police have recovered a motorcycle and are conducting further investigations.Two men have been arrested and two juveniles detained in connection with the murder of a 19-year-old in Delhi's Nangloi area. The victim, identified as Tarun, was stabbed and taken to the hospital where he later died. The police launched an investigation and apprehended Azad and Prakash, while two juveniles were also detained. The accused allegedly had a dispute over money with the victim and stabbed him during an argument. The police recovered a motorcycle and are conducting further investigations.

item.title: ‘Red diary’ contains ‘black deeds’ of Congress MLAs: BJP’s Rajendra Rathore
item.description: The leader of the opposition in the Rajasthan assembly, Rajendra Rathore, criticized the Congress party over a 'red diary' that former minister Rajendra Gudha displayed in the house. The diary allegedly contains financial misdeeds of the Congress government, including illegal transactions by Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot. Pictures of the diary's pages have circulated on social media, with the Congress claiming that they were created by the BJP IT cell. Rathore stated that the diary contains evidence of infighting within the Congress and warned that further revelations would expose the black deeds of the land mafias during the Congress rule. The Congress dismissed Rathore's allegations and said the issue of the red diary was created by the BJP ahead of the assembly elections.

item.title: Pedestrians accounted for maximum road accident fatalities in Delhi in 2022, data shows
item.description: Pedestrians accounted for 43% of road accident fatalities in Delhi in 2022, followed by motorcyclists at 38%, according to the police. In the same year, 629 pedestrians were killed and 1,777 were injured in road accidents in the national capital. The percentage of pedestrians injured in accidents fell to 34.16% compared to the previous year. The majority of road accident victims were men, accounting for 91% of deaths and 86% of injuries. The age group most affected by fatalities was 40-years-and-above for both men and women. The Delhi Traffic Police has implemented various measures to tackle road accidents, including addressing reckless and drunk driving, enforcing traffic laws, analyzing real-time data, improving driver education and training, utilizing technology, and collaborating with stakeholders. Motorcycle riders accounted for 37.78% of fatalities and 43.49% of injuries. The proportion of cyclists injured in road accidents has been gradually decreasing over the past 15 years. The police identified engineering issues as a major cause of accidents, such as improper road curvature and lack of standard speed calming measures. Increasing average speeds also led to higher crash risks and severity of consequences. The police highlighted the importance of correct helmet use and wearing seat-belts to reduce the risk of fatal and serious injuries. Child restraints were also mentioned as a measure to reduce deaths.

item.title: PM Modi holds 10km roadshow in Ranchi
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Prime Minister Narendra Modi conducted a 45-minute roadshow in Ranchi, the capital of Jharkhand, as part of his two-day visit to the state. Thousands of people gathered along the 10-kilometer route from the airport to the Raj Bhavan to welcome the Prime Minister. The roadshow took place under tight security and involved flower petals being showered on Modi's vehicle at designated spots. The visit coincided with the birth anniversary of tribal icon Birsa Munda and Jharkhand's statehood day. During the visit, Modi inaugurated a scheme worth Rs 24,000 crore for the welfare of the tribal community and flagged off the Vikasit Bharat Sankalp Yatra. He also launched projects worth Rs 7,200 crore and released the 15th installment of the PM-KISAN scheme. Additionally, the Prime Minister visited the Bhagwan Birsa Munda Memorial Park-cum-Freedom Fighter Museum and paid floral tributes to Birsa Munda at his birthplace in Ulihatu village.

item.title: Man awarded 20-year jail term for raping minor daughter
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.A man in Odisha, India has been sentenced to 20 years in jail for raping his minor daughter in 2018. The court also imposed a fine of Rs 10,000 on the convict, C Siba Patra. If he fails to pay the fine, he will face an additional year in jail. The court further ordered the District Legal Services Authority to provide Rs 4 lakh as compensation to the victim. The court decided not to release the offender under the Probation of Offenders Act, considering the serious nature of the crime and the lack of remorse shown by the accused during the trial. The incident occurred in April 2018 at a slum in Bhubaneswar, and the FIR was filed the following day.

item.title: UAE: RAK Ruler receives Danish Ambassador
item.description: Sheikh Saud bin Saqr Al Qasimi, the Ruler of Ras Al Khaimah, met with Denmark's Ambassador to the UAE, Anders Bjorn Hansen, to discuss mutual interests and ways to strengthen ties between the two countries. The Ruler praised the ambassador's efforts in promoting relations, and the ambassador expressed gratitude for the warm welcome and highlighted the strong ties between the two nations.Sheikh Saud bin Saqr Al Qasimi, the Ruler of Ras Al Khaimah in the United Arab Emirates (UAE), welcomed Denmark's Ambassador to the UAE, Anders Bjorn Hansen. During their meeting, they discussed various topics of mutual interest and explored ways to strengthen ties between the UAE and Denmark. Sheikh Saud commended the ambassador for his efforts in promoting the relationship between the two countries. Ambassador Hansen expressed his gratitude for the warm welcome and praised the strong bonds between the UAE and Denmark.

item.title: UAE’s climate diplomacy initiatives propel global action towards COP28 objectives
item.description:
Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is actively engaged in climate diplomacy to promote global collaboration and support for climate action. As the first country in the region to sign and ratify the Paris Agreement, as well as the first in the Middle East and North Africa to commit to climate neutrality by 2050, the UAE places great importance on international partnerships for sustainability and climate.
The Anwar Gargash Diplomatic Academy (AGDA) has launched a capacity building program in collaboration with the Office for the UAE Special Envoy for Climate Change. The program aims to enhance knowledge and skills related to climate change and climate action for senior government officials, corporate executives, diplomats, negotiators, and advisors. It covers topics such as regional climate priorities, climate diplomacy, energy transition, and the UAE's net-zero strategic initiative.
The AGDA, together with Mubadala and ADNOC, has also established the Centre for Climate Diplomacy. This center focuses on climate research and aims to cooperate with academic institutions and research centers in the Middle East. Its goals include establishing a regional climate research center and forming partnerships with public and private sectors to support climate neutrality efforts.
In parallel, the Hamdan Bin Mohammed Smart University (HBMSU) and the United Nations Institute for Training and Research (UNITAR) have launched an Executive Diploma on Climate Change Diplomacy and Sustainability. This program equips participants with knowledge and skills necessary for addressing sustainability, climate change, and climate negotiations.
The Arab Youth Centre, in partnership with various organizations including the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, AGDA, Abu Dhabi School of Government (ADSG), and UNITAR, has initiated the 'Young Arab Diplomatic Leaders' program. This program provides specialized training to prepare young Arabs for diplomatic roles in climate affairs. It includes sessions, workshops, and meetings with prominent diplomats, covering topics like future foresight, cross-cultural communication, climate change governance, negotiation techniques, and advanced climate diplomacy.
Additionally, the Arab Youth Centre, in partnership with the Delegation of the European Union to the United Arab Emirates, has launched the "Negotiation Skills Bootcamp – Cohort52" as part of the 'Young Arab Diplomatic Leaders' program. This boot camp aims to enhance the negotiation skills of youth in diplomatic and non-diplomatic sectors, enabling them to effectively engage in international discussions and represent the Arab community in climate-related forums aligned with COP28.
Overall, the UAE is actively involved in various initiatives and partnerships to promote climate diplomacy, research, capacity building, and youth engagement, in line with its commitment to global climate action.

item.title: Israel confirms death of hostage who appeared in video
item.description: Israeli hostage Cpl. Noa Marciano, who was abducted by Hamas, has been confirmed dead by the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF). Hamas released a video claiming that Marciano was killed in an airstrike, but experts suggest her injuries are more consistent with bullet wounds or injuries from a fall. It was also revealed that a pregnant hostage likely gave birth in captivity. In a separate incident, a video was aired showing the kidnapped Israeli-Russian academic Elizabeth Tsurkov, who was abducted by an Iranian-backed Iraqi militia. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu hinted at the possibility of a hostage deal with Hamas. So far, the IDF has managed to free one hostage, Pvt. Ori Megidish. Approximately 240 Israelis and foreigners are still held hostage by Hamas.

item.title: Pedestrians most vulnerable to road accident fatalities in Delhi, data shows
item.description: According to the data provided, pedestrians accounted for 43% of road accident fatalities in Delhi in 2022, followed by motorcyclists at 38%. In that year, 629 pedestrians were killed and 1,777 were injured in road accidents. The majority of road accident death victims were men, accounting for 91% of the fatalities. The Delhi Traffic Police has implemented various measures to tackle road accidents, including addressing reckless and drunk driving, enhancing driver education and training programs, and utilizing modern technology. Motorcyclists accounted for 37.78% of the fatalities and 43.49% of the injuries among road accident victims in Delhi in 2022. The proportion of cyclists injured in road accidents has been gradually decreasing over the past 15 years. Engineering issues, such as improper road curvature and lack of standard speed calming measures, are among the major causes of these accidents. Wearing seat belts and using child restraints can significantly reduce the risk of death and injuries in road accidents.

item.title: People making money out of terror ecosystem will face law: J-K Police chief
item.description: Jammu and Kashmir Police chief R R Swain has stated that strict action will be taken against individuals who are profiting from the terror ecosystem. He also emphasized that talking to Pakistani terror handlers will be considered a crime. Swain mentioned that while security forces will provide counseling and assistance to misguided youths who wish to return to the mainstream, those who refuse and are involved in terrorism for conviction or financial gain will face legal consequences. He also suggested that attacking the properties of individuals who have made money from the terror ecosystem could be a solution.

item.title: Agent of Pakistan’s intelligence agency among 3 booked by UP ATS over suspicious bank transactions
item.description: The Uttar Pradesh Anti Terrorist Squad has registered a case against three individuals, including an unidentified agent from Pakistan's intelligence agency, for suspicious bank transactions amounting to approximately 70 lakh rupees. The FIR was filed in Lucknow on November 10, under the charge of conspiracy to wage war against the Indian government. The ATS is investigating the connection between the two individuals and the Pakistani intelligence agency, as they were receiving funds through online banking. The transactions were discovered in an account at Canara Bank, operated by one of the individuals involved. Further investigations are ongoing.

item.title: UAE: Airbus, Mubadala sign agreement to mentor new generation of Emirati aerospace engineers
item.description: Airbus and Mubadala Investment Company have signed an agreement to provide internship opportunities for Emirati senior university students in engineering. Over the next three years, 12 Emirati engineering students will be hosted at the Airbus headquarters in Toulouse, France, where they will perform their internships under the supervision of Airbus experts and specialists. This initiative aims to bolster the UAE's knowledge-based economy and provide an exceptional opportunity for Emirati students. Both companies are committed to nurturing and developing young talent to support the growth and progress of the aviation and aerospace sectors in the region.

item.title: Emirates to build new USD 950 million engineering facility
item.description: Emirates, the world's largest international airline, has announced a $950 million investment to build a new engineering facility in Dubai. The facility, spread over 1 million square meters, will be the largest and most advanced of its kind operated by any airline. It will support Emirates' aircraft fleet and operating requirements until the 2040s and also offer commercial aviation engineering services to other airline operators. The construction is expected to begin in 2024 and be completed in 2027, with provisions for further expansion. The facility will incorporate sustainability measures, such as the use of green building materials and solar panels.

item.title: Researchers give more insight into how our brains perceive
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.A new study published in Nature Neuroscience explores visual masking, a phenomenon where individuals do not consciously detect one image if another image is shown in rapid succession. The study showed that this optical illusion also occurs in mice and identified a specific region of the brain involved in the illusion. The research suggests that the visual cortex or higher areas of the cortex downstream of it are responsible for conscious perception. This finding aligns with the belief that the cortex is the seat of conscious perception in mammals.

item.title: Study finds risk of high lung cancer cases among naval veterans connected to asbestos
item.description: According to a study conducted by the University of Adelaide and Oxford University, asbestos exposure led to a higher prevalence of asbestos-related lung cancers among British and Australian navy personnel compared to other armed forces. The study analyzed data from 30,085 British and Australian troops who served in the 1950s and 1960s, when asbestos-containing materials were present on naval vessels. The researchers found that the lung cancer rate was higher in naval personnel, and although smoking remains the primary cause of lung cancer, the excess cases in the navy could not be explained by a higher smoking rate. The study concluded that onboard asbestos exposure was likely the main cause of the increased lung cancer rate. Additionally, asbestosis deaths were observed among sailors, further strengthening the link. The researchers estimated that approximately 27% of lung cancers among Australian seamen and 12% among British seamen were related to onboard asbestos exposure. The study highlights the ongoing risk of asbestos exposure to workers, despite bans and regulatory controls. The researchers suggest that the effects of asbestos exposure may be underestimated unless lung cancer is considered alongside mesothelioma and asbestosis. They emphasize the need for strict control measures to protect workers from asbestos and other harmful airborne dusts.

item.title: “Strong and united team is going to deliver”: Rishi Sunak in first meeting with new cabinet
item.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak addressed his newly reshuffled cabinet, emphasizing the importance of delivering on promises and building a better future for upcoming generations. Sunak discussed reforms in education, healthcare, and climate change. He highlighted the upcoming week as crucial, with inflation numbers, the autumn statement, and a Supreme Court ruling on the government's Rwanda plan. Sunak expressed confidence in the energetic and enthusiastic team and called for action. The cabinet reshuffle saw the sacking of Home Secretary Suella Braverman and the appointment of former Prime Minister David Cameron as Secretary of State for Foreign, Commonwealth, and Development Affairs. Other appointments included James Cleverly as the new Home Secretary and Laura Trott as Chief Secretary of Treasury Secretary.

item.title: Leading the Way on World Diabetes Day 2023 BeatO enters into Physical Clinics Collaborations
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Beato, a digital health platform focusing on diabetes control and treatment, has announced plans to launch physical clinics in collaboration with leading doctors across India. The move aims to establish Beato as a leading "phygital" diabetes care provider, combining physical and digital aspects of healthcare. The first five clinics will be launched in Delhi/NCR on World Diabetes Day, with plans to expand to other cities over the next six months. The clinics will offer a range of services, including investigation and diagnostic services, to provide comprehensive care to patients. Beato also plans to collaborate with network practices for research and education campaigns. The company has already made a significant impact with its app, which empowers over two million diabetes users, and aims to further deepen its capabilities with physical touchpoints. Beato has achieved positive clinical outcomes, including a reduction in HbA1c levels and hypoglycemic episodes. The company aims to establish over 100 clinic touchpoints nationwide to set new standards for accessible and affordable diabetes management.

item.title: Bipasha Basu drops cute video of her “water baby” Devi
item.description: Bipasha Basu, an actor, shared a video of her daughter Devi from their family vacation in the Maldives. Devi is seen wearing a yellow bikini, looking out the window and watching the sea. Bipasha also posted a video of Devi wearing sunglasses. The family is celebrating Devi's first birthday during their vacation, and Bipasha shared moments from the trip on Instagram. She expressed gratitude for her daughter and wished everyone a happy Diwali. Bipasha and her husband Karan Singh Grover welcomed Devi in November 2022, six years after their marriage.

item.title: ADB approves USD 100 mn loan to improve urban services, tourism facilities in Tripura
item.description: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has approved a $100 million loan for the Indian state of Tripura to enhance urban services and tourism infrastructure. The project will upgrade water supply systems, stormwater drains, and urban roads, with a focus on improving accessibility for vulnerable groups. It will also build the capacity of urban local bodies and support the state government in updating building regulations and incorporating green building principles. The tourism aspect of the project aims to improve key destinations, develop a 10-year tourism business plan, and update Tripura's tourism policy. ADB's involvement reflects its commitment to eradicating extreme poverty and promoting prosperity, inclusivity, resilience, and sustainability in Asia and the Pacific.

item.title: India records 18 new COVID-19 cases
item.description: India reported 18 new cases of COVID-19, bringing the total number of cases to 4.5 crore. There are currently 155 active cases, and the death toll stands at 5,33,295. Over 4.4 crore people have recovered from the virus, resulting in a national recovery rate of 98.81%. The case fatality rate is 1.19%. The country has administered 220.67 crore doses of the COVID-19 vaccine. This information is based on data from the Union Health Ministry.India recorded 18 new COVID-19 infections and currently has 155 active cases, according to data from the Union Health Ministry. The country's total case tally is 450,014,82 with a death toll of 533,295. The number of recoveries stands at 444,680,32, resulting in a national recovery rate of 98.81%. The case fatality rate is 1.19%. The ministry's data also shows that 220.67 crore doses of the COVID-19 vaccine have been administered in India.

item.title: Sukhu holds review meetings in Shimla days after being discharged from AIIMS Delhi
item.description: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu held review meetings after being discharged from AIIMS Delhi. He requested a status report on the establishment of e-charging stations within ten days. Sukhu was admitted to the hospital in Shimla on October 25 due to abdominal pain and a stomach infection. The state government plans to set up 107 e-charging stations, with 53 at petrol pumps and 54 through the transport department. Sukhu also reviewed the project for six proposed green corridors and discussed replacing diesel buses with e-buses. The government aims to prioritize e-vehicles for environmental conservation and provide self-employment opportunities. A website for e-taxi registration is being developed, and the HRTC was encouraged to recover losses.

item.title: Congress making false promises in poll-bound states: Jai Ram Thakur
item.description: Congress has been accused by the leader of the opposition in Himachal Pradesh, Jai Ram Thakur, of not fulfilling its election promises and making false commitments. Thakur called on Congress to focus on the welfare of the people and resume development projects. He highlighted that promises such as monthly payments to women, job creation, and free electricity have not been kept. Thakur also stated that development in the state has stopped since Congress came into power, causing difficulties for the people.

item.title: Delhi building fire: Lack of water, onlookers, electricity wires give firefighters major challenges in rescue op
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.A major fire broke out in a five-story building in east Delhi, resulting in the death of a 40-year-old woman named Anita. The Delhi Fire Service rescued 25 people from the building. The firefighting operation faced various challenges, including a lack of water source at the location, low-hanging electricity wires, onlookers obstructing rescue operations, and narrow streets. The fire is believed to have started due to a short circuit in the parking area on the ground floor. The incident is under investigation by the police, who have registered a case.

item.title: IMD forecasts rain in coastal Odisha as low pressure area forms in Bay of Bengal
item.description: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a forecast of heavy rainfall and strong winds in the coastal areas of Odisha due to the formation of a low pressure area in the Bay of Bengal. The low pressure area is expected to intensify into a depression and move towards the west-central Bay of Bengal on November 15, before potentially becoming a deep depression off the coast of Andhra Pradesh on November 16. The system is then projected to move northeastwards and reach the northwest Bay of Bengal off the coast of Odisha on November 17. Fishermen are advised to avoid venturing into the sea from November 15 to 17. The IMD predicts light to moderate rainfall on November 15, with the intensity increasing in the following days and the possibility of isolated very heavy rainfall on November 16.

item.title: Election for Odisha Assembly deputy speaker to be held on Nov 21
item.description: The election for the post of Deputy Speaker of the Odisha Assembly will be held on November 21, coinciding with the commencement of the winter session. The post has been vacant since the resignation of Rajani Kant Singh on November 8. The assembly session will continue until December 30.The election for the post of Deputy Speaker of the Odisha Assembly will take place on November 21, the same day the winter session of the house begins. The post has been vacant since the resignation of Rajani Kant Singh on November 8. The winter session will continue until December 30. Singh, a BJD MLA from Angul, stated that he will focus on strengthening the party in the district after his resignation.

item.title: RINL hopes asset monetisation may garner Rs 3000-4000cr
item.description: Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Ltd (RINL), a steel company, has stated that if it can raise between Rs 3000-4000 crore through the monetization of its forged wheel plant and land, as well as ongoing efficiency measures, it will be able to increase production and turn around from losses. The Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) handles the monetization process as RINL is a divestment candidate. RINL had invested Rs 2000 crore in the wheel plant, which has the capacity to produce one lakh forged train wheels per year. RINL’s CEO, Atul Bhatt, said that if monetization occurs this fiscal year, it will help RINL come back to cash profit through increased production. RINL posted a loss of around Rs 3000 crore in 2022-23 due to factors such as a glut in the steel market, the export tax on steel, and a lack of captive raw material security. Bhatt highlighted a cost disadvantage of Rs 6000 per tonne due to buying iron ore from the open market and an unsustainable debt of around Rs 23000 crore. The monetization plan aims to reduce debt and improve the working capital situation. Bhatt also mentioned measures such as increasing oxygen capacity and switching the import of coking coal. RINL’s substantial land bank is considered attractive as it eliminates the need for prospective buyers to invest in developing new land parcels. The land parcels are currently under the direct ownership of the union government.

item.title: Egypt broaches idea of tapping Indian financial markets
item.description: Egypt's finance ministry has discussed the possibility of entering Indian financial markets with India's ambassador to Egypt. The two sides talked about using national currencies for settlement payments. Egypt is looking to diversify funding sources and enter new financial markets to address its severe foreign currency shortage. In June, India proposed engaging in barter trade with Egypt, potentially extending a credit line worth several billion dollars. In recent months, Egypt has issued panda bonds and sold Japanese samurai bonds to attract foreign investment.

item.title: Study emphasises necessity of addressing risk of post-net zero global warming
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.A new study published in Frontiers in Science raises doubts about the effectiveness of achieving "net-zero" emissions in halting global warming. Net-zero emissions refers to the point at which the amount of carbon dioxide released into the atmosphere is equal to the amount removed from it. The study argues that there is uncertainty surrounding the estimates that global warming will stop at net-zero, suggesting that there is a chance global warming could continue and intensify after reaching this point. The article emphasizes the need for urgent action to address this risk. The study provides a comprehensive analysis of the factors influencing global temperatures and highlights the need to limit initial disturbances to the planet in order to mitigate climate risks. The research identifies several processes that could contribute to significant warming after reaching net-zero emissions. The melting of polar ice, for example, leads to increased absorption of solar energy, which further drives up temperatures. The study concludes that political obstacles, rather than technological or physical ones, are currently hindering climate action. It argues for collaborative efforts among climate experts to better understand the impact of various processes and improve warming predictions.

Siddaramaiah emphasized that Nehru laid a solid foundation for India's progress in various sectors.

item.title: U.N. prosecutor confirms death of Rwanda genocide fugitive
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Aloys Ndimbati, a genocide suspect wanted by the UN war crimes court for Rwanda, has been confirmed dead, according to the prosecutor. This leaves only two remaining fugitives from the Rwanda tribunal. In the past three years, the International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals has arrested two suspects and confirmed the deaths of four others, including Ndimbati. Ndimbati, a Rwandan public official during the 1994 genocide, faced multiple genocide charges for his alleged involvement in organizing and directing the killings of thousands of Tutsis. The exact circumstances of his death in 1997 have not been determined, but evidence suggests he did not leave the Gatore area of Rwanda and was never seen or heard from again.

item.title: Viksit Bharat Sankalp Yatra to be launched by PM in J’khand aims at ensuring saturation of schemes

The program will include the use of Information, Education, and Communication (IEC) vans to cover a large area of the country and inform people about the schemes. Additionally, Modi will initiate a 24,000-crore scheme for the holistic development of particularly vulnerable tribal groups and release the 15th installment of the PM-Kisan scheme. The campaign will last for two months and involves visits to rural and urban locations across the country. Movies in regional languages will be screened in the vans to attract people, and an app will be developed to gather people's reactions. The first phase of the campaign will start on November 15.

The case, known as 'ciphergate,' arose when Khan waved a letter during a public rally, alleging a conspiracy to overthrow the PTI government. item.title: Coal ministry plans 1,404 million tonne production by 2027
item.description: The Union Ministry of Coal in India has announced plans to produce 1,404 million tonnes (MT) of coal by 2027 and 1,577 MT by 2030. The ministry has taken note of the additional coal requirement for supplying to an additional 80 gigawatts of thermal capacity to be added by 2030. The production plan includes opening new mines, expanding mine capacity, and production from captive or commercial mines. The ministry also stated that coal stocks have started building up, with 20 MT at thermal power plants and 41.59 MT at mines. The Ministries of Coal, Power, and Railways are working together to ensure smooth coal supplies. Additionally, the Ministry of Coal is preparing for the launch of the 8th round of auctions for Commercial Coal Mines to make India self-reliant in coal.

item.title: Arjun Kapoor watches ‘Tiger 3’ amid reports of feud with Salman Khan
item.description: Actor Arjun Kapoor was spotted watching Salman Khan's latest film 'Tiger 3' in Mumbai. Despite reports of a strained relationship between the two actors, Arjun seemed to be enjoying the film with director Siddharth Anand. 'Tiger 3' has emerged as Salman Khan's biggest opener film, earning Rs 43 crore in Hindi on its release day. The film is the third installment of the 'Tiger' franchise and also features Katrina Kaif and Emraan Hashmi. It includes cameo appearances by Shah Rukh Khan and a post-credit scene with Hrithik Roshan.

item.title: ‘Not much has changed for Pak Hindu migrants in Rajasthan five years after poll promises in 2018’
item.description: Thousands of Pakistani Hindu migrants living in Jodhpur, Rajasthan, are awaiting citizenship and better living conditions, with their hopes unfulfilled by the ruling Congress party. The migrants, who do not have Indian citizenship, rely on political parties to address their issues. Despite promises made by both the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and Congress, little has changed for the migrants who face daily struggles for basic amenities. They are requesting land to live on rather than free land, and some are even willing to pay for permanent housing. Presently, 30,000 people across Rajasthan, including Jodhpur, are still waiting for Indian citizenship. The BJP government had launched a special housing project for Pakistani Hindu migrants, but so far, it only has a name and no further progress.

item.title: J’khand: 3 members of family die of suffocation after fire breaks out
item.description: A major fire broke out in a market in Dhanbad district, Jharkhand, causing the death of three family members. The victims, including a six-year-old girl, died from asphyxiation after allegedly inhaling toxic gases. The fire started in a cosmetic shop and spread to the upper floor where the shop owner lived with his family. The cause of the fire is still under investigation, but it is suspected to be due to a short circuit or burning of earthen lamps for Diwali celebrations. The fire also affected six other nearby shops, resulting in the destruction of goods worth several lakhs.

item.title: Nehru’s progressive ideas advanced India’s social, economic development: Cong
item.description: The Congress leadership paid tribute to India's first prime minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, on his birth anniversary. Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge, former party chief Sonia Gandhi, and AICC Treasurer Ajay Maken visited Nehru's memorial at Shanti Van and praised him as the prime architect of modern India. They emphasized the importance of preserving and defending India's constitution and democratic institutions, which were part of Nehru's enduring legacy. AICC General Secretary Jairam Ramesh also highlighted Nehru's contributions in shaping 20th-century India and denounced attempts to distort his legacy. The article also mentions Nehru's involvement in a cricket match to raise funds for flood relief.

item.title: Direct seeding, burying straw deep — how stubble burning can be managed without phasing out paddy
item.description: The Haryana government is offering incentives to farmers for adopting water-saving techniques and diversifying their crops. Under the scheme 'Mera Pani, Meri Virasat', farmers who sow crops other than paddy receive a payment of Rs 7,000 per acre, while those practicing direct sowing of rice receive Rs 4,000 per acre. These initiatives aim to reduce water consumption and promote less water-intensive crops in the states of Haryana and Punjab. The Supreme Court has suggested phasing out paddy cultivation in these regions to address pollution caused by stubble burning. However, farmers argue that paddy cultivation plays a crucial role in their livelihoods and that alternatives are not as financially rewarding or reliable. Agricultural experts propose strategies such as using short-duration paddy varieties, adopting direct seeding techniques, advancing procurement dates, and burying stubble through deep ploughing to mitigate the issues associated with paddy cultivation and stubble burning.

item.title: “May your passion for sitar continue to grow…,” PM Modi tells Singapore Deputy PM
item.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has wished Singapore Deputy Prime Minister Lawrence Wong success in his endeavor to learn the sitar, a plucked stringed instrument. PM Modi highlighted the rich musical history of India and expressed hope that Wong's passion for the sitar would inspire others. Wong, who is a guitar enthusiast, had shared a video of himself learning to play the sitar on Diwali. The Singapore deputy PM also extended Diwali wishes to people in Tamil. The Singapore Consulate-General in Chennai also wished people on Diwali, and Ayodhya set a new Guinness World Record for lighting over 22.23 lakh 'diyas' (earthen lamps) during 'Deepotsav 2023'.

item.title: Aluva rape, murder case: Kerala court sentences convict to death
item.description: In the Aluva child rape and murder case, a court in Kerala has sentenced Ashwaq Alam to death. He was found guilty of raping and killing a 5-year-old girl from Bihar. The sentence was given on November 14, which is celebrated as Children's Day in India and also marks the 11th anniversary of the POCSO Act. The victim's parents were present in court during the sentencing. The prosecution argued that this case falls under the rarest-of-rare category and requested the death penalty. Alam claimed in court that he was the only one caught in the case while others were let go. The court found him guilty of all 16 offenses in the charge sheet, five of which are punishable by death. The crime took place on July 28 when the girl was abducted, raped, and strangulated, after which her body was dumped in a marshy area behind a local market.

item.title: ASEAN Defence Ministers’ Meeting Plus: Rajnath to visit Indonesia
item.description: Indian Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will travel to Indonesia to attend a meeting of the ASEAN and its dialogue partners, where regional security scenarios will be discussed. Singh is expected to present India's views on addressing major security challenges at the ASEAN Defence Ministers' Meeting Plus (ADMM-Plus). ADMM-Plus includes 10 ASEAN countries and eight dialogue partners, including India, China, and the United States. Singh will also hold bilateral meetings with participating countries' defence ministers to discuss defence cooperation. India has been a dialogue partner of ASEAN since 1992, and ADMM-Plus meetings have been held annually since 2017.

item.title: Cummins open to Australia ODI captaincy extension, to put his name in IPL auction

Cummins stated that he will discuss his future with the coach and selector, but there is no set end date for his captaincy. item.title: Animal: New song ‘Papa Meri Jaan’ shows Anil-Ranbir’s father-son relationship

The third track of the film, titled "Papa Meri Jaan," sung by Sonu Nigam, highlights the bond between the characters played by Anil Kapoor and Ranbir Kapoor. The song is available in multiple languages, including Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Kannada, and Malayalam. item.title: Global EV sales stay strong, China hits record despite end of subsidies
item.description: China reported record monthly electric-vehicle (EV) sales in October, despite the end of subsidies. The country ended an 11-year subsidy scheme for EV purchases in 2022 but some local authorities continue to offer aid, tax rebates, and subsidies to attract investments and consumers. EV sales in China increased by 29% year-to-date in September, contributing to the global EV market's 34% growth in the same period. Rho Motion, a market research firm, predicts that 2023 will be another strong year for EV sales in China. In European markets, EV sales grew by 26%, although the cutting of subsidies has affected demand, particularly in Germany. The North American market saw a significant increase of 78% in EV sales this year, with Tesla leading the demand. However, Tesla's market share slipped to its lowest point at about 50% during the third quarter.

item.title: Amazon to sell shopping ads on Snapchat – spokesperson

Customers will be able to shop through Amazon's Snapchat ads and complete their purchases without leaving the app. The new experience will also provide users with real-time pricing, delivery estimates, and product details. This partnership is part of Amazon's effort to expand its product offerings through social media applications. The deal is expected to benefit both Amazon and Snapchat, with Amazon gaining access to Snapchat's user base and Snapchat benefiting from the return of advertisers to its platform.

item.title: King Charles celebrates 75th birthday by launching new food project
item.description: Britain's King Charles celebrates his 75th birthday by launching the 'Coronation Food Project', a scheme aimed at tackling food poverty and reducing waste. The project aims to bridge the gap between food need and food waste by rescuing surplus food and distributing it to those in need. The king and his wife, Queen Camilla, will visit a surplus food distribution center and meet with major British supermarkets to discuss how the project can help redistribute food that would otherwise go to waste. The project highlights that 14 million people in Britain face food insecurity, and there has been a 38% increase in people using food banks for the first time in the year leading up to March 2023. Alongside his birthday celebrations, the king will also host an event to honor the work of nurses and midwives as part of the National Health Service's 75th anniversary.

item.title: Ukrainian politician suspected of treason says he has been detained
item.description: Ukrainian lawmaker Oleksandr Dubinsky has been detained for 60 days by a Kyiv court after being suspected of treason and spreading misinformation about Ukraine's political leadership. Dubinsky, who is on a US sanctions list, denies the accusations. The Ukrainian Security Service (SBU) claims that Dubinsky is a member of a criminal organization financed by Russia's military intelligence. The organization allegedly worked to discredit Ukraine internationally in order to strain diplomatic relations with the US and hinder Ukraine's accession to the European Union and NATO. Dubinsky was expelled from the ruling party in 2021 due to alleged election meddling but continued to work in parliament. In January 2021, the US imposed sanctions on several Ukrainian individuals, including Dubinsky, for their involvement in election interference and association with a pro-Russian Ukrainian lawmaker linked to efforts to gather damaging information on President Joe Biden and his son.

item.title: Heavy machinery brought in to pull out Indian workers from collapsed tunnel
item.description: Excavators have started drilling with heavy machinery to fix a wide steel pipe in order to rescue nearly 40 Indian workers who are trapped inside a collapsed tunnel in the state of Uttarakhand. The tunnel, part of a Hindu pilgrimage route, collapsed on Sunday morning. The trapped workers have been provided with food, water, and oxygen, and efforts are underway to safely extricate them. The cause of the accident is being investigated. The region is prone to natural disasters such as landslides, earthquakes, and floods. The construction of the tunnel is part of a larger project to connect four important Hindu pilgrimage sites.

item.title: India’s Tata Technologies’ IPO to open on Nov. 22
item.description: Tata Technologies is set to launch its initial public offering (IPO) on November 22. The IPO will consist of an offer for sale of 60.9 million shares, representing 15% of the company's paid-up capital. This is lower than the 23.6% indicated in the draft prospectus. Tata Motors will sell an 11.4% stake, while private equity firm Alpha TC Holdings will sell a 2.4% stake, and Tata Capital Growth Fund I will dispose of a 1.2% shareholding. The IPO is expected to close on November 24. Previously, Tata Motors announced the sale of a 9% stake in Tata Technologies to a fund of U.S. private equity firm TPG, valuing the company at nearly $2 billion. The stake sale value has been corrected to 9% from 9.9%.

item.title: Terrorists attack private company’s vehicles, Pak Army soldier among 2 dead: ISPR

The military's media wing, Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR), stated that a sanitization operation is being carried out in the area to eliminate the presence of terrorists. Security forces conducted an intelligence-based operation in the Bara area of Khyber district, leading to the death of a terrorist. Since the breakdown of talks with the banned militant group Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) last year, the group has intensified its attacks, targeting the KP police and areas bordering Afghanistan. Security forces have increased operations against terrorists in response to the rise in terrorist activity since the TTP announced the termination of a ceasefire with Pakistan.

Hagari stated that Hamas hides in hospitals and the IDF is working to evacuate patients to safer hospitals. He emphasized that the war is against Hamas, not the people of Gaza. Hagari also shared footage showing the alleged Hamas terror activities in the hospital basement. IDF teams are investigating the evidence, and Hagari asserted that other Gaza hospitals are being used by terrorists. Lt Gen Herzi Halevi, IDF Chief of Staff, pledged to take robust action to address rocket attacks by Hezbollah and allied factions.

These efforts have led to transformative changes in India, including financial inclusion, building houses, promoting education for girls, and fostering digital innovation. The government has also focused on creating new universities and colleges, contributing to the socioeconomic revolution. The evolving India-UK relationship is being reframed to unlock the unrealized potential between the two nations. EAM Jaishankar's visit to the UK aims to strengthen the growing bilateral partnership and explore new convergences. India and the UK are also in negotiations for a Free Trade Agreement.

item.title: Hope to find a landing point that works for both of us: Jaishankar on India-UK FTA
item.description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has emphasized that a free trade agreement (FTA) is a key focus of the India-UK relationship and expressed hope for a mutually beneficial outcome in negotiations. Speaking at a special Diwali reception in London, Jaishankar highlighted the positive impact of the bilateral relationship and urged the Indian diaspora in the UK to promote the story of India's development. He also mentioned the ongoing negotiations for an enhanced trade partnership and the potential for an FTA to strengthen ties between both countries. Jaishankar is currently on a five-day official visit to the UK to review bilateral ties. The India-UK comprehensive strategic partnership was launched in 2021, and negotiations for an FTA have been underway since January last year.

Many of those being deported are Pashtun, who had integrated into local Pashtun communities. The departure of these individuals has disrupted their lives and affected the communities that had embraced them. The Hazara community in Balochistan, which saw an increase in numbers after the Taliban's takeover of Kabul, is also facing a crisis as undocumented Hazaras have left for Afghanistan. This has exacerbated concerns among those who had fled oppression by the Afghan Taliban. The economic ramifications are being felt in Quetta, where some refugees played a vital role in the city's economy as laborers and consumers. Their departure has led to an economic downturn. The introduction of a passport requirement for crossing into Afghanistan has also disrupted businesses and family connections in Chaman, leading to protests. The social impact of the deportations is significant, as many Afghans had been part of the society for years, marrying and developing community ties. The deportations may strain cross-border kinships, diminish cultural and social contributions, and potentially destabilize local economies. Baloch nationalist parties, who were previously opposed to Afghan refugees, have remained silent on the issue this time. There are allegations that a large number of Afghans have been issued Pakistani identity cards, and there is speculation that these cards will be blocked and cancelled in the next phase, which could inadvertently affect Pakistani citizens in Balochistan. A careful and humane approach is necessary to prevent further disruption to the lives of both Afghan refugees and Balochistan's citizens.

item.title: Syria allows UN to keep delivering aid from Turkey
item.description: Syria has granted the United Nations (UN) permission to continue delivering aid to opposition-held areas in the country's northwest for another three months. Initially, after an earthquake caused significant casualties in Turkey and Syria, the UN was allowed to provide aid through Turkish border crossings for a period of three months, which has now been extended for a third time until February 13th. The UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs highlighted the importance of this cross-border operation, as it reaches around 2.5 million people monthly with critical assistance and protection services. Syria's mission to the UN confirmed the extension of the UN's use of the Bab al-Salam and Al Ra'ee crossings. The UN had also been using the Bab al-Hawa crossing since 2014, but authorization from the UN Security Council expired in mid-July. However, shortly after, the Syrian government allowed the UN to continue using Bab al-Hawa for an additional six months. In total, over 4,200 trucks carrying UN aid have utilized these border crossings so far this year.

Gaza health ministry spokesperson Ashraf Al-Qidra stated that there are still around 650 patients in need of evacuation. Israel claims that the hospital is being used as a headquarters by Hamas fighters, an accusation denied by Hamas. President Joe Biden expressed his hope for less intrusive action at the hospital and stressed the need to protect it. The conflict between Israel and Hamas has resulted in thousands of deaths and the displacement of two-thirds of Gaza's population. Fighting has also occurred at Al Quds hospital, causing it to cease functioning. Israel alleges that terrorists were shot from the hospital entrance in return fire. The conflict has raised concerns about its potential spread beyond Gaza, with clashes on the Israeli-Lebanese border and the United States launching airstrikes on Iran-linked militia targets in Syria.

item.title: Brazil aims to expand rail system with funds from prior contracts
item.description: The Brazilian government plans to expand its railway network with a 40 billion reais ($8 billion) fund, funded by removing discounts given to rail companies under previous government contracts. The discounts were given to iron ore miner Vale and logistics companies Rumo and MRS in 2022 under the government of former President Jair Bolsonaro. These contracts did not go through the normal public bidding process, and the companies were allowed to make an advance payment deducting unamortized assets from their owed concession payments. The government claims that the companies owe an additional 40 billion reais ($8.1 billion) in unpaid concession payments. While Rumo has agreed to pay, Vale and MRS are still disputing the matter in court. Once the court's decision is made, the government plans to arrange any payments with the companies. The funds will be used to finance the construction of new railways and extend existing ones, with the goal of increasing rail freight transportation from 17% to 40% of Brazil's total freight, including iron ore.

item.title: Biden, China’s Xi will discuss communication, competition at APEC summit

The White House stated that the leaders will discuss strengthening communication and managing competition between the two countries. Biden believes that face-to-face diplomacy is crucial for managing the complex relationship, according to White House National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan. The meeting aims to curb tensions and cover various global issues, including the Israel-Hamas conflict, Russia's invasion of Ukraine, North Korea's ties with Russia, Taiwan, the Indo-Pacific, human rights, fentanyl, artificial intelligence, and trade and economic relations.

Jaishankar also had discussions with UK Defence Secretary Grant Shapps to enhance defense and security cooperation. The Make in India initiative was highlighted as an opportunity for collaboration with British partners. They also exchanged views on global security challenges. Jaishankar greeted newly appointed UK Foreign Secretary David Cameron and expressed appreciation for the growing bilateral partnership between India and the UK. The visit aimed to give new impetus to friendly ties between the two countries. India and the UK are currently negotiating a Free Trade Agreement.

item.title: Google’s expert in US antitrust trial defends billions paid to device makers
item.description: An expert witness called by Google in the ongoing antitrust trial testified that the company's multi-billion dollar payments to Apple and other parties are normal competitive behavior and not an abuse of monopoly. Kevin Murphy, a professor at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, argued that Apple and others played Google and Microsoft off against each other to secure large payments. The government has accused Google of paying billions to ensure its search is the default on smartphones and browsers, alleging it as an abuse of monopoly. Murphy also stated that these payments often result in benefits to users, such as cheaper phones or better data plans. He added that while Microsoft had the majority of preinstalled browser defaults, its Bing search engine only received 15% of search queries. The trial is expected to conclude this week.

ICBC did not immediately comment on the incident. The attack raises concerns about the resilience of the $26 trillion Treasury market and may attract regulatory scrutiny. LockBit has emerged as the world's leading ransomware threat, targeting numerous organizations globally. item.title: More than 40 calls received in 48 hours about injured and distressed animals due to Diwali firecrackers, says official
item.description: Over the past 48 hours, authorities in Mumbai have received over 40 calls regarding injured or displaced animals as a result of firecrackers being burst during Diwali. The animals affected include cats, dogs, birds, and reptiles. Despite the Bombay High Court's directive to only burst firecrackers between 8pm and 10pm, air quality has worsened. Animal rescue teams from various organizations are on alert, expecting an increase in cases of distressed animals that may continue for weeks after the festival. So far, six birds, two snakes, and a turtle with burn injuries have been rescued. Citizens can report wildlife distress to the forest department helpline and domestic animal distress to the BMC helpline.

item.title: Rising temperatures, longer monsoon drive Bangladesh’s worst dengue outbreak
item.description: Bangladesh is experiencing its worst-ever outbreak of dengue fever, with a death toll of 1,476 and over 291,000 infected. Experts attribute the severe outbreak to rising temperatures and a longer monsoon season caused by climate change, which create ideal breeding conditions for the dengue-spreading mosquito. This year's death toll is more than five times that of 2022 and the highest since authorities began tracking the disease in 2000. The Aedes mosquito, which spreads dengue, is adapting to the changing climate patterns, leading to the disease's spread in all 64 districts of the country. Vector surveillance is now needed year-round to monitor the disease's spread. There is no specific vaccine or drug for dengue, but early detection and proper medical care can reduce deaths to less than 1% of those infected. Hospitals in Bangladesh are struggling to cope with the influx of patients and a shortage of intravenous fluids.

The report countered negative sentiment around Chinese demand and increased demand growth forecasts for this year. Last week, the US Energy Information Administration lowered its projection for crude oil production and predicted a decrease in demand. Additionally, weak economic data from China raised fears of faltering demand. However, analysts believe that oil prices may have reached a bottom and expect Saudi Arabia and Russia to continue their voluntary supply cuts into next year, limiting downside potential. The next OPEC+ meeting is scheduled for November 26.

item.title: Mexico’s Ebrard to stay in ruling party, avoiding split
item.description: Former Mexican foreign minister Marcelo Ebrard has announced that he will remain with the ruling leftist National Regeneration Movement (Morena) and will not seek the presidency in 2024 with an opposition party. Ebrard had previously rejected the results of Morena's presidential primaries and had not ruled out the possibility of seeking the presidency with the center-left opposition Citizens' Movement (MC) party. However, he has now reached an understanding with Morena's presidential candidate, former Mexico City mayor Claudia Sheinbaum. Ebrard stated that he would continue to pursue the presidency in the future but acknowledged that it was not feasible for next year. As a former socially progressive mayor of Mexico City, Ebrard decriminalized abortion and legalized same-sex marriage in the capital. He also played a key role in negotiations with the Trump and Biden administrations on trade and immigration.

The new package will also include export bans, actions to tighten oil price caps, and measures to combat circumvention. The timing for the proposal is expected to be early next week.

item.title: Researchers give more insight into development of lupus in females
item.description: In lupus, an autoimmune disease, women are affected nine times more than males. The reasons behind this gender disparity have been unclear, but a recent study by Johns Hopkins Medicine has shed light on the role of the X chromosome and a specific genetic material called X-inactive specific transcript (XIST). The study found that XIST can trigger an immune response involving toll-like receptor 7 (TLR7), a protein in the immune system. This immune response contributes to the development and severity of lupus in women. The research suggests that XIST may play a role in promoting autoimmunity and could be a potential target for future therapies. Further studies are needed to explore XIST's involvement in other autoimmune conditions that predominantly affect women.

item.title: Odia actress held for ‘misbehaving’ with woman writer

Despite this, Nayak continued to make statements against Pati and her family, and even lodged a false case against her. Nayak also allegedly sent threatening messages. She has been arrested and charged with various offenses, including criminal intimidation and extortion.

item.title: 11,000 earthen lamps lit at Gorakhnath temple in UP as tribute to martyrs
item.description: As a part of the 'Ek Diya Shaheedon Ke Naam' initiative, 11,000 earthen lamps were lit at the Gorakhnath temple in Uttar Pradesh to pay tribute to martyrs. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath lit a lamp in the Bheem Sarovar area of the temple, and a cultural program was also organized as part of the initiative. The program was organized by the Bhojpuri Association of India.As a part of the 'Ek Diya Shaheedon Ke Naam' initiative, 11,000 earthen lamps were lit at the Gorakhnath Temple in Uttar Pradesh to pay tribute to martyrs.
