He accused the BJP government of running the state with "police, money, and administration" and claimed that the people of Madhya Pradesh will bid farewell to Chouhan after the elections. Nath also criticized Chouhan for not fulfilling his promise of providing one lakh jobs to the youth and for not filling the backlog of vacant government posts.

item.title: Art installation in Tel Aviv calls for death penalty for Hamas terrorists
item.description: A large art installation in Tel Aviv's Dizengoff Square is demanding the death penalty for the perpetrators of Hamas's deadly October 7 massacre in southern Israel. The installation features rope gallows framed by giant wings, with the faces of the victims covering the surface of the wings. The Israel PublicA large art installation in Tel Aviv's Dizengoff Square is calling for the death penalty for the perpetrators of Hamas's October 7 massacre in southern Israel. The installation features gallows framed by giant wings with the faces of the victims covering the wings' surface. It has been placed in front of the iconic "fire and water fountain" in the square. Meanwhile, Israel's public defenders' office has refused to represent the captured Hamas terrorists awaiting trial, stating that the current judicial procedure is not suited to deal with terrorism. The Israel Prison Service has started processing the Hamas terrorists into the prison system. The Israeli police commissioner has assured that all necessary security measures have been put in place. The Israel Defense Forces have reported that a significant number of soldiers are still fighting in Gaza City's Al-Shati camp and have encountered various incidents involving Hamas operatives.

item.title: Maharashtra CM Shinde dismisses Uddhav’s threat over demolition of Shiv Sena (UBT) shakha
item.description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Ekanth Shinde has dismissed Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray's criticism of the demolition of his party's 'shakha' in Thane district, calling it an empty threat. Thackeray attempted to visit the site of the demolished 'shakha' in Mumbra but faced resistance from workers of the chief minister's Shiv Sena. Shinde claimed that the people of Mumbra showed their power during Thackeray's visit and that the Shiv Sena UBT was thrown to the seventh position in recent gram panchayat elections. The chief minister refused to respond to Thackeray's allegations about the encroachment of 'shakha' land.

item.title: Golf-Campbell birdies last to win Hong Kong Open title from Smith
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Ben Campbell of New Zealand won the Hong Kong Open by sinking a 10-foot birdie putt on the last hole, securing a one-shot victory over former British Open champion Cameron Smith. Campbell finished with a four-under par 66, ending the tournament at 19-under. This win marked his success in the event since its return after a four-year hiatus due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Overnight leader Phachara Khongwatmai suffered a late slump, resulting in a tie for third place. Despite facing challenges throughout the day, Campbell was able to make crucial shots down the stretch to secure his victory.

item.title: Man dies while trying to save son from downing in Odisha
item.description: A man named Saroj Sahu died while trying to rescue his eight-year-old son from drowning in the Kathajodi River in Odisha's Cuttack district. The incident occurred at the Kaibartasahi Ghat when both the father and son went to bathe in the river. The minor boy slipped into the strong current of the river, leading Saroj to go into the deep water to save him. Saroj managed to pull his son up, but he drowned in the process. Local women saved the minor boy, while fishermen later retrieved Saroj's body. He was pronounced dead at the SCB Medical College and Hospital in Cuttack.

item.title: Japanese island holds disaster drill in shadow of Taiwan threat
item.description: Japan conducted a tsunami evacuation drill on Yonaguni Island, its westernmost island, involving about 200 island officials and military personnel. The exercise aimed to prepare residents for potential emergencies, including any conflict arising from China's attempt to control Taiwan. Due to strong winds, helicopters and landing craft were unable to participate. The mayor emphasized the need to plan for worst-case scenarios, considering Japan's vulnerability to earthquake-triggered tsunamis. The official in charge of disaster preparedness highlighted the proximity of Yonaguni to Taiwan and the importance of being prepared for both natural disasters and conflicts. Concerns over China's military activities and the situation in Ukraine prompted Japan's Prime Minister to announce plans to double defense spending.

item.title: Unless extraordinary, Constitutional Court should avoid fixing time-bound schedule for cases: SC
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Supreme Court of India has stated that the Constitutional Court should only fix a time-bound schedule for the disposal of cases if the situation is extraordinary. The court made this observation while rejecting a plea that sought directions for the timely disposal of a criminal matter. Justices Abhay S Oka and Pankaj Mithal highlighted the large number of bail petitions filed in high courts, which inevitably leads to some delays in their disposal. The court emphasized that unless there is an exceptional urgency, fixing a time-bound schedule should be avoided. However, it assured that genuine requests for urgent matters can be entertained by the concerned bench.

item.title: Arab League, OIC dismiss Israel’s ‘right to self defence’, call for ICC probe into ‘war crimes’
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Middle East rivals Iran and Saudi Arabia joined forces at a joint summit of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) and the Arab League in Riyadh to reject Israel's claim of self-defense. They called on the International Criminal Court (ICC) to investigate Israel for war crimes and crimes against humanity in Palestine. The summit, attended by leaders from various Arab and Islamic nations, marked Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi's first visit to Saudi Arabia since ties were restored earlier this year. The emergency summit was prompted by Israel's response to attacks by Hamas, resulting in numerous deaths, including many children. The joint resolution adopted at the summit condemned Israel's aggression and affirmed Palestinians' right to self-determination, an independent state, and their demand for Jerusalem as its capital. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan proposed an international peace conference, while Raisi blamed the US for enabling Israel's atrocities. The OIC and the Arab League also called for the establishment of a nuclear-weapon-free-zone in the Middle East and the elimination of other weapons of mass destruction in the region. Disagreements arose among the leaders regarding severing diplomatic ties with Israel, with some advocating for it and others emphasizing the importance of maintaining dialogue.

item.title: Saira Banu shares throwback picture with Dilip Kumar on Diwali
item.description: Veteran Bollywood star Saira Banu celebrated Diwali with actor Dilip Kumar and shared a throwback picture of them together. In her Instagram post, she reflected on the significance of Diwali and how it symbolizes the victory of good over evil. Banu wished for collective prosperity and resilience and expressed her hope that the festival would ignite introspection and self-discovery. She concluded by sending her best wishes to her fans and emphasized the importance of the enduring spirit that connects everyone. Saira Banu made her acting debut in 1961 and has appeared in numerous films throughout her career.

item.title: Diwali: Gippy Grewal unveils motion poster of action thriller ‘Warning 2’
item.description: The makers of the action thriller film 'Warning 2' starring Gippy Grewal and Prince Kanwaljit Singh unveiled the motion poster on Diwali. Gippy Grewal, who wrote the film, shared the poster on Instagram and announced that the movie will be released in cinemas on February 2, 2024. In addition to 'Warning 2', Gippy Grewal will also be seen in the thriller titled 'Chamak' and the film 'Shinda Shinda No Papa'. He is also collaborating with actor Sanjay Dutt for a Punjabi film called 'Sheran Di Kaum Punjabi'. Furthermore, Gippy Grewal has another film titled 'Carry On Jattiye' featuring Jasmin Bhasin, Sunil Grover, and Sargun Mehta.

item.title: Cement industry’s new ‘EV’ – A new low-carbon tech is here
item.description: The construction of cities equivalent to the size of New York City every month is being driven by population growth and urbanization. However, this rapid urban development is putting increased pressure on the planet and its natural resources because concrete and cement, which are key construction materials, contribute approximately 7% of global CO2 emissions. To address this issue, the World Economic Forum, in collaboration with Boston Consulting Group and industry input from the Global Cement and Concrete Association, has developed a framework to reduce concrete emissions. The framework suggests three key strategies: decarbonizing the manufacturing process, using lower-carbon cement blends, and optimizing the volume of material used in projects. One potential solution for decarbonizing cement production is an electric chemical approach that replaces fossil fuel kilns with an ambient temperature process. This approach aims to achieve true zero carbon and can be a high-performance, low-carbon building material. The journey of developing sustainable cement production technology serves as a lesson that good ideas can come from anywhere.

item.title: Masaba celebrates Diwali with dad Vivian Richards, calls it “special”
item.description: Designer Masaba Gupta celebrated Diwali with her father, cricketer Vivian Richards, who visited India for the festivities. She shared pictures on Instagram, including one of her posing with her dad. Masaba and her husband also performed the Diwali puja at her office. Masaba is the daughter of actor Neena Gupta and Vivian Richards, who had her out of wedlock. They have lived separately throughout their lives. Neena raised Masaba alone until she got married to Vivek Mehra in 2008. Vivian had previously visited India in January 2023 to attend Masaba's wedding with Satyadeep Misra. Masaba shared a family picture on Instagram, which included her husband, Satyadeep's mother and sister, Neena Gupta, her husband Vivek Mehra, and Vivian Richards.

item.title: Ranbir Kapoor twins with ‘Jiju’ Saif Ali Khan, Ibrahim in black at Diwali party
item.description: Actors Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt attended a Diwali bash hosted by Ranbir's cousin Kareena Kapoor Khan in Mumbai. Pictures and videos from the event were shared on social media, including one of Ranbir posing with Saif Ali Khan and Ibrahim Ali Khan. The trio was seen twinning in black ethnic outfits. Ranbir's mother Neetu Kapoor also attended the party, wearing a pink salwar suit. Other celebrities like Arjun Kapoor, Amrita Arora, Karisma Kapoor, Kunal Kemmu, and Soha Ali Khan were also spotted at the event. Kareena and Saif were dressed in traditional attire and shared an adorable picture on Instagram. Ranbir's upcoming film 'Animal' is set to release on December 1 and also stars Rashmika Mandanna, Anil Kapoor, and Bobby Deol.

item.title: Israel-Hamas war: Rocket alerts sounded in evacuated Israeli town near Gaza
item.description: Rocket alerts were heard in the Israeli town of Kissufim near the Gaza Strip, with no reports of impacts or casualties. The town had been previously evacuated. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu referred to Hamas as an "integral part of the axis of terrorism" and urged Arab leaders to speak out against them. He stated that Israel's war against Hamas is advancing at "full force" with the goal of victory and the return of hostages. Netanyahu claimed that Hamas has lost control of the northern Gaza Strip.

item.title: NHL roundup: Blues blitz Avs behind 2 hat tricks
item.description:
The St. Louis Blues dominated the Colorado Avalanche with an 8-2 victory, thanks to hat tricks from Brayden Schenn and Pavel Buchnevich. Schenn now has four career hat tricks, while Buchnevich has three. Torey Krug, Alexey Toropchenko, and Robert Thomas also contributed to the Blues' win. Mikko Rantanen and Jack Johnson scored for the Avalanche.
In another game, the Montreal Canadiens defeated the Boston Bruins 3-2 in overtime, with Kaiden Guhle scoring the winning goal. Nick Suzuki and Brendan Gallagher also found the net for Montreal, while Brad Marchand had a goal and an assist for Boston.
The Edmonton Oilers snapped a four-game losing streak by defeating the Seattle Kraken 4-1. Zach Hyman scored a natural hat trick, and Dylan Holloway also scored for the Oilers. Jaden Schwartz scored for the Kraken.
The Detroit Red Wings secured a 5-4 victory over the Columbus Blue Jackets, with Daniel Sprong scoring the go-ahead goal. Lucas Raymond, Alex DeBrincat, Robby Fabbri, and Jake Walman also scored for the Red Wings, while Patrik Laine scored his 200th career goal for the Blue Jackets.
The Dallas Stars emerged victorious with a 3-2 win against the Winnipeg Jets, thanks to goals from Wyatt Johnston, Thomas Harley, and Matt Duchene. Cole Perfetti and Brenden Dillon scored for the Jets.
The Ottawa Senators defeated the Calgary Flames 4-1, ending their five-game home skid. Drake Batherson, Mathieu Joseph, Rourke Chartier, and Travis Hamonic scored for the Senators, while Blake Coleman scored for the Flames.
The Carolina Hurricanes shut out the Tampa Bay Lightning 4-0, with Pyotr Kochetkov recording his fifth career shutout. Sebastian Aho and Brent Burns each had a goal and an assist for the Hurricanes.
The Toronto Maple Leafs defeated the Vancouver Canucks 5-2, with Noah Gregor scoring the go-ahead goal. Matthew Knies, William Nylander, Nicholas Robertson, and David Kampf also found the net for the Maple Leafs, while J.T. Miller and Pius Suter scored for the Canucks.
The Washington Capitals secured a 4-1 win over the New York Islanders, with goals from Nic Dowd, Aliaksei Protas, and Alex Ovechkin, who moved closer to Wayne Gretzky's all-time goal record. Alexander Romanov scored for the Islanders.
The Pittsburgh Penguins blanked the Buffalo Sabres 4-0, with Erik Karlsson scoring twice and Tristan Jarry making 35 saves.
The Arizona Coyotes defeated the Nashville Predators 7-5, with Michael Carcone scoring two goals and Sean Durzi netting the game-winner. Filip Forsberg scored two goals for the Predators.
The Philadelphia Flyers snapped the Los Angeles Kings' eight-game point streak with a 4-2 victory. Morgan Frost scored two goals for the Flyers, while Cal Petersen made 35 saves in net.

item.title: Tripura: 14 Bangladeshis held for illegally entering India
item.description: Fourteen Bangladeshi nationals, including four children, were arrested in Tripura's Gomati district for illegally entering India. Acting on a tip-off, raids were conducted at two houses in Baishnabpur village near the international border, and the illegal immigrants were held. Three locals who provided shelter to the Bangladeshi nationals were also arrested. The Sabroom subdivision border, which is 62 km long, is not fully fenced, making it easier for human traffickers to exploit. Authorities are taking a zero-tolerance approach to human trafficking and are booking those involved under stringent charges.

Australia aims to strengthen its standing in the Pacific amid China's increasing presence in the region. The treaty also allows Australia to review Tuvalu's security arrangements with other nations. item.title: Women will get Rs 15,000 annual assistance if Cong retains power in Chhattisgarh: CM Baghel
item.description: Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel of Chhattisgarh announced that if the Congress party remains in power, women in the state will receive an annual financial assistance of Rs 15,000. This announcement is seen as a response to the opposition BJP's promise of providing Rs 12,000 per year to married women. The assistance will be directly deposited into the bank accounts of eligible women under the "Chhattisgarh Gruha Lakshmi Yojana." The first phase of polling has already taken place, and the second phase is scheduled for November 17.

item.title: Uttarakhand: Tunnel under construction on Yamunotri NH partially collapses, 40 workers trapped
item.description: A tunnel under construction on the Brahmakhal-Yamunotri National Highway in Uttarakhand collapsed, trapping around 40 workers inside. The incident occurred early in the morning when a 150-meter portion of the four-and-a-half-kilometer tunnel collapsed. Rescue operations have been launched by the Uttarkashi Superintendent of Police and various emergency response teams. The tunnel is part of the Char Dham all-weather road project and its construction aims to reduce the journey between Uttarkashi and Yamunotri by 26 kilometers.A portion of a tunnel under construction on the Brahmakhal-Yamunotri national highway in Uttarkashi, Uttarakhand collapsed, trapping around 40 workers inside. The incident occurred around 4 am when a 150-meter-long section of the four-and-a-half-kilometer-long tunnel collapsed. Various rescue teams, including the National Disaster Response Force, State Disaster Response Force, fire brigade, and employees of the organization building the tunnel, are working to rescue the trapped laborers. The tunnel is part of the Char Dham all-weather road project, which aims to reduce the journey between Uttarkashi and Yamunotri by 26 km.

item.title: Bihar govt warns newly appointed teachers of strict disciplinary action if they form association

The warning comes after around 1.20 lakh teachers who cleared the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) recruitment exam in 2023 received provisional appointment letters. The education department stated that while these teachers have not yet been assigned postings or started teaching, some have formed or joined an association and criticized the department's policies. The department emphasized that forming a union or being part of one is not allowed, and strict disciplinary action will be taken, including cancellation of appointments, if guilty. The article also mentions that 1.20 lakh candidates cleared the BPSC examination for 1.70 lakh teaching positions in Bihar.

item.title: Oil price rise would hit 2024 global growth, inflation outlook: Fitch
item.description: Higher oil prices resulting from the ongoing conflict in the Middle East could lead to lower economic growth and higher inflation, according to Fitch Ratings. The rating agency estimates that world GDP growth would be 0.4 percentage points lower in 2024 and 0.1 percentage points lower in 2025. Fitch's simulations assume average oil prices of $120 per barrel in 2024 and $100 per barrel in 2025. The impact of higher oil prices would dampen GDP growth in most economies, with South Africa and Turkey being the most affected. Fitch also expects higher inflation rates in 2024, followed by corrections in 2025. The potential oil price shock could result in tighter financial conditions, lower business and consumer confidence, and corrections in financial markets.

item.title: WHO loses communication with Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza
item.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) has lost communication with Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza City, where repeated attacks have been reported. The hospital is said to be surrounded by tanks, and the safety of health workers, patients, and displaced people inside is a grave concern for the WHO. The organization is calling for an immediate humanitarian ceasefire in Gaza to save lives and reduce suffering. They also emphasize the need for medical evacuations of critically injured patients and the release of hostages. The conflict between Israel and Hamas has intensified, with reports of Hamas maintaining a major command center in tunnels. Jerusalem has urged hospital staff, patients, and other Gazans to flee south to avoid further attacks, but there are reports of gunfire targeting those trying to leave. The WHO is advocating for safe medical evacuations into Egypt through the Rafah Border Crossing.

item.title: Australia says ports operator cyber incident ‘serious’
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Australian government has described a cybersecurity incident at ports operator DP World Australia as "serious and ongoing." The incident, which began on Friday, has forced the suspension of operations at ports in several states. DP World Australia, which manages nearly half of the country's goods flow, is investigating possible data breaches and testing crucial systems for the resumption of normal operations. The breach has affected container terminals in Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, and Fremantle. The Australian Federal Police are investigating the incident, and the National Cyber Security Coordinator has warned that the interruption is likely to continue for several days, impacting the movement of goods in and out of the country. DP World operates in 18 locations in the Asia-Pacific region and is part of Dubai's state-owned DP World.

item.title: In UN talks for a global plastic treaty, delegates to face off over production limits
item.description: Negotiations are underway for the creation of a treaty to address plastic pollution, and officials are divided on whether to limit plastic production or focus on waste management. The world currently produces around 400 million tonnes of plastic waste annually, with less than 10% being recycled. The European Union and several countries advocate for binding provisions to reduce plastic production and eliminate problematic plastics, while the plastic industry and oil-exporting nations argue for a focus on recycling and reusing plastics. The United States has shifted its stance, now calling for national plans that align with global goals to reduce plastic pollution. Environmental groups hope the discussions can move past procedural matters and focus on substantive solutions.

item.title: Myanmar fighter jet crashes, rebels claim responsibility
item.description: A Myanmar fighter jet crashed during clashes between the military and an insurgent group in eastern Myanmar. The jet went down over Kayah State near the border with Thailand, with both the military and the Karenni Nationalities Defence Force claiming responsibility for shooting it down. The military stated that the crash was due to a technical problem and that the pilots had ejected safely. This incident adds to the challenges faced by the ruling junta, as it battles opposition forces on multiple fronts. Ethnic minority groups and anti-junta militias are coordinating a rebellion that poses a significant threat to the military's rule. The conflict in Shan State, which borders China, has displaced thousands of people and disrupted trade routes. China has called for all sides to cease hostilities. An alliance of insurgent groups claims to have seized over 100 army posts, and attacks on towns have occurred in Sagaing Region. The fighting has left hundreds of foreign workers, including nationals from Vietnam and Thailand, trapped in the conflict zone. The Thai government has stated that it is awaiting an opportunity to evacuate its citizens. The Karenni Nationalities Defence Force stated on Facebook that it shot down the jet using heavy machine guns and is currently searching for the pilots, but this information could not be verified. Images of an abandoned helmet and parachute believed to belong to one of the pilots were posted on social media.

item.title: Toll in Kerala blasts rises to 5
item.description: The death toll from the blasts that occurred at a Christian religious gathering near Kochi, Kerala, has now reached five, according to the Kerala government. A 45-year-old woman named Sally Pradeepan passed away on Saturday night at a private hospital where she was receiving ventilator support. Currently, 17 people injured in the blasts are being treated in various hospitals, with eight in intensive care units (ICU) and one in critical condition. The incident took place on October 29 during a prayer meeting of the Jehovah’s Witnesses, resulting in over 50 injuries. A man named Dominic Martin, claiming to be an estranged member of the sect, surrendered to the police and confessed to carrying out the multiple blasts. He has been arrested and charged under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and the Explosive Substances Act, as well as the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act.

item.title: Owning pet may not be linked with well-being, despite improving owner’s life, research finds
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.A study conducted by researchers from Michigan State University found that there is no reliable association between pet ownership and well-being. The study involved 767 participants who completed online surveys, and while pet owners reported that their pets improved their lives, there was no difference in the well-being of pet owners compared to non-pet owners over time. The study also found that the type of pet, the number of pets, and the quality of the human-pet relationship did not affect the association. The researchers suggested that non-pet owners may have other sources of happiness in their lives. They concluded that while pets may provide positive experiences, they may not have a transformative effect on overall well-being.

item.title: Pakistan: Three police personnel killed in terrorist attack in Tank
item.description: Three police personnel, including a station house officer (SHO), were killed and five others, including a deputy superintendent of police, were injured in a terrorist attack in Pakistan's Tank. The attack occurred when the police were attempting to arrest kidnappers. The injured personnel were taken to a hospital, and security forces have launched operations against the terrorists. This incident is part of a rise in terror activities in Pakistan, particularly in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Balochistan. In the first nine months of 2023, 386 security personnel lost their lives, reaching an eight-year high. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Balochistan accounted for the majority of fatalities and attacks during this time.

item.title: Uttarakhand: Tunnel under construction on Yamunotri National Highway partially collapses, 40 workers trapped
item.description: A tunnel under construction on the Brahmakhal-Yamunotri national highway in Uttarkashi district, Uttarakhand collapsed, trapping approximately 40 workers inside. The incident occurred at around 4 am when a 150-meter portion of the four-and-a-half-kilometer tunnel collapsed. Uttarkashi Superintendent of Police, Arpan Yaduvanshi, immediately launched a relief and rescue operation with the National Disaster Response Force, State Disaster Response Force, fire brigade, and employees of the National Highways and Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited (NHIDCL) also present. The construction of this tunnel, part of the Char Dham road project, aims to reduce the travel distance between Uttarkashi and Yamunotri Dham by 26 kilometers.

item.title: Diwali car discounts make for a great deal. But don’t drive home a soon-to-be extinct SUV
item.description:
The Indian automotive industry has experienced a swift rebound after the challenges of 2020, with consistent monthly sales growth over the past two years. It is predicted that by March 2024, the Indian passenger car market will surpass four million units, making it the world's third-largest car market behind China and the United States.
However, Chief Operating Officer of Hyundai Motor India, Tarun Garg, raises concerns about the current situation. He points out that rival carmakers are offering massive discounts on their flagship products during the Diwali season, suggesting that there may be underlying issues despite the apparent positive growth. Garg predicts a decline in growth as 2024 approaches, marking the end of a period of intense expansion.
Data from the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) indicates that sales of passenger cars in October 2023 grew by 15.87% compared to the previous year. While major manufacturers like Hyundai saw their sales increase by close to 15%, smaller players such as Renault, Nissan, and Citroen experienced significant declines. This could be due to a lack of suitable products, although even established carmakers like Honda have resorted to offering attractive discounts to drive sales growth.
Discounts are not limited to the mainstream market and can also be found in the luxury segment. Luxury carmakers offer attractive loan deals through their finance arms to show volumes, often at rates lower than those offered by banks. There are also instances where dealers are asked to pick up cars to demonstrate monthly volumes, which are then sold off as unregistered vehicles at significant discounts.
The shift towards electric vehicles (EVs) has created confusion among Indian consumers. Currently, the EV market offers limited choices, mostly retrofitted variants of internal-combustion engine cars. However, purpose-built EVs are expected to enter the market around 2025-26, providing better options for consumers. Major automakers like Tata Motors, Mahindra, Maruti-Suzuki, Hyundai, and Kia are working on upcoming EV models.
Despite potential economic uncertainty after the 2024 Lok Sabha election, Hyundai remains committed to its plans for a 'Made In India' EV, similar to a C-segment SUV, by 2025. This raises the question of whether buying a new vehicle at this time might lead to owning a car that could become obsolete in a few years.
In summary, while the Indian automotive industry has shown impressive growth, concerns about underlying issues such as discounts, declining sales for some manufacturers, and the impending shift towards EVs raise questions about the future of the market.

item.title: Bangladeshi Muslims are building a 300-yr-old Kali temple. Now they want Modi’s help
item.description:
The 300-year-old Sasan Kali temple in Bangladesh's Magura district was partially destroyed in the 2000 floods. Now, both Muslims and Hindus are coming together to rebuild the temple and are seeking assistance from the governments of Bangladesh and India. The village of Basurdhuljhuri, where the temple is located, serves as a symbol of secularism in a country that has been witnessing communal violence during Hindu festivities.
Every year, journalist Sahidul Hasan Khokon returns to his native village for the Kali pujo at the temple. This year, he and his friends plan to form a committee to restore the temple to its original glory. Despite its current modest appearance, the temple attracts millions of devotees who believe that their wishes will be granted by the goddess Kali.
In 2001, there was no Kali pujo due to the flood, but Muslim neighbors contributed funds and resources to help construct a temporary temple for the Hindus in the village. Now, the community wants to build a proper temple and hopes for support from both the Bangladeshi and Indian governments. They cite a similar project funded by India in Natore district as a precedent.
The Kali temple at Basurdhuljhuri holds historical significance and requires a budget of at least fifteen lakh Bangladeshi Taka for construction. Bengali Hindus in West Bengal and Bangladesh worship Goddess Kali during Diwali, and the Sasan Kali form is revered in certain temples like the one in Basurdhuljhuri.
The story of Hindus and Muslims coming together to rebuild a Kali temple is seen as an example of syncretic culture defeating fundamentalist forces in Bangladesh. Many individuals, such as actress Ashna Habib Bhabna, appreciate this display of unity and hope for the prompt construction of the temple.
For Sahidul Hasan Khokon, supporting the temple's restoration is not only about rebuilding a part of his childhood, but also about defending his belief system in the face of temple attacks. He hopes that both the Bangladeshi and Indian governments will help restore this shared heritage.

item.title: People dig deeper to fact-check social media posts when paired with someone who doesn’t share their perspective – new research
item.description: A recent study published in Frontiers in Psychology found that people are more likely to fact-check social media posts and revise their initial beliefs when paired with someone from a different cultural background. The study focused on English and French participants and found that when paired with someone from the same cultural background, participants tended to confirm their initial beliefs, while those paired with someone from a different cultural background engaged in deeper searches and revised their beliefs in line with evidence. The researchers believe that bringing together people from opposing sides to fact-check contentious social media posts could improve media literacy and civil discourse. However, it may be challenging to get people from opposing sides to engage in such discussions. The researchers plan to conduct future studies on more controversial topics to further explore the effects of mismatched pairs.

item.title: India’s creative talent has a ‘refuge’ near Chennai – the Cholamandal Artists’ Village
item.description: The Cholamandal Artists' Village is a modernist artist community located outside Chennai, India. It was established in 1966 by KCS Paniker as a refuge for artists to live and work in, focusing on their artistic practice and promoting the exchange of creative ideas. The village includes artists' studios, a contemporary art gallery, handicrafts association offices, a metalsmith workshop, and an open-air theater for discussions and conferences. The artists sustain themselves by producing handicrafts alongside their artistic practice. The village also features an international sculpture park and publishes an art journal called Artrends. It has gained international acclaim and has been showcased at various art festivals and exhibitions. While the original format of the village as a commune has shifted, it continues to be overseen by the Artists Handicrafts Association.

item.title: Top US official Brett McGurk to visit Israel: Report
item.description: Brett McGurk, the White House Coordinator for West Asia, is reportedly traveling to Israel as part of a visit to countries in the region. The goal of his visit is to reach a US-brokered deal for the release of hostages being held by Hamas in Gaza. Before visiting Israel, McGurk will hold talks with NATO and European Union officials in Brussels. In Israel, he is scheduled to meet with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, and senior security and intelligence officials. After his visit to Israel, McGurk will travel to Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, and Bahrain. The report suggests that one option under discussion is a deal that could release 80 women and children from captivity in Gaza in exchange for Israel releasing female and underage terror convicts from prison. US President Joe Biden has stated that there is "no possibility" of a ceasefire in Gaza and that the US government will continue its efforts to secure the release of the hostages.

item.title: Shadab backs skipper Babar, calls for change in cultural mindset

Former Pakistan cricketers have demanded the removal of Babar Azam as captain, but Shadab believes the responsibility for the defeats should not solely rest on the captain's shoulders. Babar's captaincy has come under scrutiny, and there has been talk of making wholesale changes in the team, including removing him as skipper. Shadab also expressed disappointment in his own performance and the team's failure to adapt to modern-day cricket. Meanwhile, England leg-spinner Adil Rashid, the team's leading wicket-taker in the World Cup, hopes it's not his last outing for England's ODI cricket. Rashid dismissed Shadab with a googly, which became one of the highlights of England's win against Pakistan.

item.title: Reading ‘Modi’ script, mapping family trees — how Maharashtra’s scouring old records to identify Kunbis
item.description: The Maharashtra government is working to identify all Marathas who were once part of the Kunbi caste before the January 2 deadline for their reservation quota. District officials are scrambling to complete the identification process, with more than 300-400 government officials involved in each taluka. The government has directed districts to search various documents and publish Kunbi references found. Afterward, people will be asked to submit claims for caste certificates based on their genealogy. However, there are challenges such as old and delicate records, missing last names, and discrepancies between siblings' castes. Scanning the documents has been a challenge, with smartphone cameras being used due to the issues with regular scanners. The records are in different scripts, so Modi script readers and translators have been employed to identify the word "Kunbi" in various formats. Despite the difficulties, progress is being made, with some districts having already found thousands of Kunbi records.

item.title: Soccer-Rapinoe suffers ‘devastating’ early exit with injury in final match
item.description: Megan Rapinoe, a two-time World Cup winner, expressed devastation after her final professional match ended prematurely due to injury. The highly anticipated showdown between her team, OL Reign, and Gotham FC, was meant to serve as an emotional farewell for Rapinoe and her former teammate Ali Krieger. However, Rapinoe sustained a non-contact injury just three minutes into the game, grasping at her right calf before limping off the field. The 2019 Ballon d'Or winner believes she tore her Achilles tendon but is awaiting further testing to confirm. Despite the disappointing ending, Rapinoe remains positive and grateful for her career. Gotham FC went on to win the match 2-1 and claim their first championship title. Rapinoe's early exit from her final match shocked fans and fellow U.S. women's national team veterans.

item.title: Unlike AAP’s corruption in Delhi, UP’s excise policy is transparent: UP minister Nitin Agarwal
item.description:
The Uttar Pradesh Excise Minister, Nitin Agarwal, has accused the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government in Delhi of engaging in corrupt practices that benefit the "liquor mafia." He stated that unlike Delhi, where one person can have more than two liquor shops, Uttar Pradesh restricts individuals to a maximum of two liquor shops. Agarwal highlighted that no deaths due to spurious liquor consumption have occurred during the current term of the Yogi Adityanath-led government. The excise policy of the Delhi government for 2021-22 came under scrutiny, leading to a recommendation for a CBI investigation into alleged irregularities by the Lieutenant Governor. Agarwal criticized the AAP for blaming the BJP and suggested that the leaders responsible for the excise scam were involved with the liquor mafia. Both the CBI and the ED are investigating the excise policy cases.
Agarwal emphasized that the UP excise department differs from Delhi's as it provides a level-playing field and operates on a pro-industry policy. He mentioned that the previous policies were not transparent and favored the liquor mafia. The minister stated that the current government welcomes anyone interested in doing business in the state and highlighted the revenue growth of the excise department since the formation of the BJP government in 2017. The target is to reach a revenue figure of Rs 50,000 crore in the current financial year and Rs 80,000 crore by 2027.
Agarwal also mentioned that there have been no deaths due to spurious liquor consumption in Uttar Pradesh during CM Adityanath's second term. He explained that deaths occur when local-level liquor production involves mixing jaggery with urea, which becomes poisonous if methyl alcohol is added. Agarwal assured that country liquor made in distilleries in Uttar Pradesh is safe. The department targets an annual growth rate of 8-10% and sells one crore cases of country liquor per month. Country liquor contributes 44% to the department's total revenue.

item.title: This Diwali season, have one healthy meal a day. Skincare won’t make up for it
item.description: The festive seasons in India can take a toll on the skin, leading to a dull and tired complexion. Winter pollution and indulgence in rich foods can further worsen skin issues. To maintain a glowing complexion, dermatologists recommend taking a vitamin B supplement, drinking plenty of water, and applying moisturizer regularly. Home remedies such as using vinegar and lime juice for dandruff or shampooing with beer can also help. Seeking advice from a dermatologist, especially in areas with heavy pollution, is advised. For specific skin issues, treatments like microdermabrasion and exfoliation creams can be effective. However, it is important not to try new treatments right before important events. Hydration, proper cleansing, and moisturizing are essential steps in a skincare routine. Using a micellar water for makeup removal and a gentle cleanser is recommended. Regular exfoliation and sunscreen application are also important. Additionally, maintaining a healthy diet is crucial for overall skin health. Following these skincare steps can ensure that the skin reflects the joy and brightness of the festive season.

item.title: Lok Sabha polls: SBSP seeks to contest five seats in UP, Bihar; party chief dismisses INDIA bloc threat
item.description: The Chief of Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party (SBSP), Om Prakash Rajbhar, has stated that his party is prepared for the upcoming Lok Sabha polls and has requested five seats from the BJP, their alliance partner, for the general elections. Rajbhar also mentioned that the opposition India bloc does not pose a challenge to the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) as the constituent parties within the opposition fight among themselves. In response to Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's statement on contesting in 65 out of 80 Lok Sabha seats in Uttar Pradesh, Rajbhar claimed that Yadav wants Narendra Modi to become the prime minister again, as the Congress becoming strong in Uttar Pradesh would weaken the Samajwadi Party. Rajbhar criticized Yadav's PDA (Pichhda, Dalit, Alpsankhyak) strategy, stating that the Samajwadi Party only benefits the Yadavs and not the backward classes. SBSP won six seats in the 2022 assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh in an alliance with the Samajwadi Party and later formally joined the NDA. Rajbhar dismissed the threat of the opposition India bloc, describing it as not a challenge and citing Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's controversial comments in the assembly on women. SBSP, with a significant presence among the OBC Rajbhar caste, aims to contest a few parliamentary seats in eastern Uttar Pradesh and contiguous areas of Bihar. Regarding seat-sharing for the 2024 elections, Rajbhar stated that the SBSP has sought three seats in Uttar Pradesh and two in Bihar from the BJP. Although discussions on seat-sharing are yet to be held, the party is laying groundwork in Bihar. Rajbhar did not disclose the specific seats his party has requested. The SBSP was previously in an alliance with the BJP in the 2017 assembly elections in Uttar Pradesh and won four seats, and Rajbhar served as a minister during Yogi Adityanath's first term. After formally rejoining the NDA in July, there is speculation about Rajbhar's return to the cabinet and the induction of another OBC leader, Dara Singh Chauhan.

item.title: Paresh Rawal shares update about ‘Welcome 3’ and ‘Hera Pheri 3’
item.description: Actor Paresh Rawal is excited to return to the popular franchises "Hera Pheri" and "Welcome" as he prepares to film the third installments of both series. Rawal believes that creating a new part for a beloved franchise is a challenging task, but is confident in the success of these films. He cited the "Munna Bhai" franchise as an example of how to create a successful franchise by offering something different with each film. Rawal revealed that filming for "Welcome 3" will start in December and will be released next year, while "Hera Pheri 3" will also be happening soon. Rawal's latest film, "Shastry Virudh Shastry," is a story about a boy caught between the emotions and conflicts of his parents and grandparents. The film explores themes of love, family, and the judiciary system. Produced by Viacom18 Studios, the film was released earlier this month.

item.title: Felt like a ‘third-wheel’ in England changing room, Willey says retirement decision final
item.description: David Willey, the English cricketer, has announced his retirement after feeling like a "third wheel" in the England cricket team's changing room due to not having a central contract. Despite performing well and taking three wickets against Pakistan, Willey was denied a central contract for the upcoming season. He expressed his confidence in his decision to retire from international cricket, stating that he doesn't want to feel like an outsider again. Willey believed he still had the ability to play in the T20 World Cup but cited the toll of not knowing where he stood with the team as a reason for his retirement. Despite his disappointment, he cherished the opportunity to enjoy his last game for England and thanked his teammates for their support.

item.title: Andhra Pradesh Guv, CM extend Diwali greetings
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Andhra Pradesh Governor, S Abdul Nazeer, and Chief Minister Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy extended Diwali greetings to the people of the state. The Governor expressed his wishes for peace, prosperity, and happiness during the festival of lights. He highlighted that Diwali symbolizes the triumph of light over darkness, good over evil, and knowledge over ignorance, emphasizing the festivity's ability to inspire and promote harmony in society. Similarly, the Chief Minister conveyed his festival greetings on a social media platform, emphasizing the significance of Diwali as a celebration of light's victory over darkness, good over evil, and wisdom over ignorance.

item.title: Enough with Diwali sensory overload—introverts like me want food, films, fairy lights
item.description: The article discusses the author's desire to have a low-key and solitary celebration during the festive season. They express their preference for watching movies, particularly the director's cut of The Lord of the Rings, and mention some recent films and short films they would like to watch. The author also mentions the joy of being in control of their own plans and the superficial nature of group chats during festivals. They express their intention to watch fireworks from their balcony and potentially take selfies for dating apps and Instagram.

item.title: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf blames PDM government for ‘economic catastrophe’
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) has released a white paper blaming the Pakistan Democratic Movement (PDM) coalition government for the economic crisis in Pakistan, according to a report by Dawn. The PTI claims that despite the COVID-19 pandemic, their government managed to put the economy on a path of rapid growth. The white paper argues that the PDM government, which came into power through a regime change conspiracy, reversed the economic gains achieved by the PTI-led government and caused more economic damage than natural disasters and the pandemic combined. The white paper highlights that when the PTI took office in 2018, the economy was on the verge of collapse, with various economic indicators such as an overvalued Pakistani rupee and a high current account deficit. The document also criticizes the previous government's mismanagement of the energy sector, particularly in relation to the overbuilding of power supply through imported fuel plants. The white paper states that the PTI government had to approach the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for assistance, which came with tough conditions such as increasing taxes and tariffs. Despite facing a global commodity super cycle that led to higher prices for petroleum products, edible oil, and coal, the PTI government was able to maintain control over inflation rates. The white paper also emphasizes that the PTI government accumulated additional debt compared to the previous government, largely due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. In related news, the PTI has canceled its public gathering in Karachi after the district administration denied permission. The PTI described the attitude of the authorities towards the party as unfair and stated that they were being denied a level-playing field.

item.title: Jordan airdrops humanitarian aid to field hospital in Gaza Strip
item.description: The Jordan Air Force has dropped humanitarian aid to a field hospital in the Gaza Strip, operated by Amman, to assist Gazan civilians amid the ongoing crisis. This is the second operation by Jordan in recent weeks, with packages being dropped from planes along with parachutes. Earlier this week, Jordan also airdropped medical aid into Gaza, bypassing Israel's tight embargo on aid entering the Strip. The move was coordinated with the US and Israel. However, Israel insists on inspecting all aid entering the Strip due to concerns about weapons smuggling. Gazans and rights groups have criticized the amount and pace of aid reaching the Strip as insufficient. Three babies died in a neonatal unit in northern Gaza after the hospital went "out of service" due to continuous Israeli fire in the vicinity. The hospital is currently treating 36 babies and providing shelter for around 20,000 displaced people.

item.title: Cricket-England’s poor World Cup doesn’t mean ‘huge clear-out,’ says skipper Buttler
item.description: England's one-day international cricket team will not undergo major changes despite their poor performance in the World Cup, according to captain Jos Buttler. The team finished their campaign with a convincing win over Pakistan, securing a place in the 2025 Champions Trophy. Buttler stated that there will not be a drastic change in playing style, but rather a push forward. White-ball coach Matthew Mott expressed confidence in keeping his job and backed Buttler to continue as captain, despite his own lack of strong performances.

item.title: Dubai’s gold king Joy Alukkas started his rise with a revenge plan
item.description: The article tells a story of betrayal and determination in the business world. It starts with an advertisement aimed at undermining the author's gold business in Abu Dhabi. They discover that their advisor and mentor, George Varghese, was behind it, leading to feelings of hurt and anger. Instead of confronting Varghese directly, the author decides to open a store in the same building as his mentor's, turning the tables on him. The author strategically chooses a prime location in the Gold Souk of Dubai, ensuring maximum visibility for their store. Despite facing challenges with regulations, the author successfully opens the new store, which becomes a testament to their instinct for ideal locations.

item.title: Israel offers to evacuate babies from main Gaza hospital amid fierce fighting
item.description: Israel's military is prepared to evacuate babies from Gaza's largest hospital after fuel ran out amid intense fighting in the area. Palestinian officials reported that two newborns have died and dozens more are at risk. The Rafah crossing into Egypt will reopen on Sunday for foreign passport holders after closing on Friday. Hamas claims to have destroyed over 160 Israeli military targets in Gaza, including more than 25 vehicles in the past 48 hours. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced the deaths of five more Israeli soldiers in Gaza, bringing the total to 46 since ground operations began. Israel said rockets were still being fired from Gaza into southern Israel, where it claims that about 1,200 people were killed and more than 200 taken hostage by Hamas last month. Palestinian officials said that 11,078 Gaza residents had been killed in air and artillery strikes since October 7th, with around 40% of them being children. Israel's three major TV news channels reported progress towards a deal to free hostages held by Hamas in Gaza. The deal would involve releasing women and minor Palestinian prisoners and considering letting fuel into Gaza while reserving the right to resume fighting.

item.title: 15-year-old boy, held with brown sugar, sent to special home for 3 yrs
item.description: A 15-year-old boy in Bhubaneswar has been sentenced to three years in a special home after being caught with 1.26 kg of brown sugar. The Juvenile Justice Board found him guilty under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act, 1985 and ordered the home to provide reformative services during his stay, including education, skill development, counseling, behavior modification therapy, psychiatric support, and treatment. The boy was apprehended by the Special Task Force of the state police on August 12, 2021, along with three others near the Khurdha Bus Stand. The trial is ongoing for the adult co-accused.

item.title: Kohli’s 50th ton is a big worry for fans. King’s focused on cup, not the crown
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The article discusses the burden of expectations and individual records carried by cricket players Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli. It questions the notion that they prioritized personal milestones over the team's success, suggesting that this accusation arises only when they approach a century. The article argues that intent cannot be judged based on a player's stroke play from 80 to 100, just as a bowler shouldn't be faulted for leaking runs in search of a wicket. The obsession with records in cricket is highlighted, with numerous examples mentioned, including Tendulkar's records. It emphasizes that Kohli understands the fans' obsession but states that breaking records isn't what truly drives his cricket. The article also addresses the criticism faced by players who are deemed good enough only for quick innings and argues that match situations and team requirements take precedence over personal milestones. It concludes by suggesting that individual records can coexist with team victories and questions whether fans can accept a Kohli century in a World Cup final loss.

item.title: Man held for UP for murder of person in Maharashtra
item.description: A 40-year-old man from Jaunpur, Uttar Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly killing a 19-year-old person in Thane, Maharashtra. The victim's body was found on November 8, and the police launched an investigation into the murder. Through CCTV footage and intelligence inputs, the victim was identified and it was discovered that the accused was angry because the victim had helped his third wife leave him. The accused also intended to kill his wife, who was in Pratapgarh, Uttar Pradesh. The police traced the accused to a village in Jaunpur district and arrested him with the assistance of the local police. The accused has a history of criminal offenses, including theft and assault.

item.title: Soccer-Gotham defeat Reign for first NWSL title, Rapinoe exits early
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Spanish striker Esther Gonzalez scored the winning goal for Gotham FC, securing their first National Women's Soccer League championship title with a 2-1 victory over OL Reign. The match also marked the final career game for veteran Megan Rapinoe, who unfortunately exited early due to injury. Lynn Williams opened the scoring for Gotham, while Rose Lavelle found the net for Reign. After numerous missed opportunities and drama in the final moments of the game, Gonzalez's header in stoppage time sealed the victory for Gotham.

item.title: Navi Mumbai cops register case against 8 including ex-minister for APMC mismanagement
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Navi Mumbai police have registered a case against eight individuals, including a former Maharashtra minister, for allegedly mismanaging an Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC) and causing a loss of Rs 7.61 crore to the state exchequer. The case involves the alleged favoring of certain organizations in awarding contracts for the construction of toilets in areas under the APMC's control. The accused violated regulations between 2005 and 2022, resulting in the financial loss. The FIR registered by the police includes charges under various sections of the Indian Penal Code and the Prevention of Corruption Act.

item.title: As fighting rages, Israel says ready to evacuate babies from Gaza’s main hospital
item.description: Israel's military is prepared to evacuate babies from Gaza's largest hospital as fuel runs out and the humanitarian situation worsens. The Rafah crossing into Egypt will reopen for foreign passport holders after closing on Friday. Hamas claims to have destroyed over 160 Israeli military targets, while the Israeli military announces the deaths of five more soldiers in Gaza. Reports suggest progress towards a possible deal to release hostages held by Hamas. In Tel Aviv, a rally supports hostage families. Al Shifa hospital in Gaza suspends operations due to fuel shortage, resulting in the deaths of two newborns. Israel denies siege or shooting at the hospital but agrees to help evacuate infants from there. The conflict continues with ongoing clashes and continuous bombardment. Muslim and Arab countries call for an immediate end to military operations in Gaza. Pro-Palestinian rallies take place in London and Brussels.

item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Security was tightened across West Bengal in preparation for Kali Puja and Diwali celebrations. In Kolkata, over 5,000 police personnel were deployed to maintain law and order and monitor illegal firecrackers. Similar security measures were taken in other major cities of the state. Fire and emergency services were on standby, and hospitals were prepared for any emergencies.Security was tightened across West Bengal in preparation for Kali Puja and Diwali celebrations. In Kolkata, over 5,000 police personnel were deployed to maintain law and order and monitor illegal firecrackers. Similar security measures were taken in other major cities of the state. Fire and emergency services were on standby, and hospitals were prepared for any emergencies.

item.title: Arab and Muslim leaders demand immediate end to Gaza war
item.description: Saudi Arabia and other Muslim countries have called for an immediate end to military operations in Gaza, rejecting Israel's justification of its actions against Palestinians as self-defense. The joint Islamic-Arab summit in Riyadh urged the International Criminal Court to investigate "war crimes and crimes against humanity that Israel is committing" in the Palestinian territories. Saudi Arabia has sought to press the United States and Israel for an end to hostilities in Gaza, and Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman gathered Arab and Muslim leaders to reinforce that message. Leaders including Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi, Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan, Qatar's Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani, and Syrian President Bashar al-Assad attended the summit. The summit demanded an end to the siege of Gaza, access for humanitarian aid, and a halt to the sale of arms to Israel.

item.title: Police investigate ‘cyber incident’ at Australia ports operator
item.description: Australian police are investigating a cybersecurity incident that caused ports operator DP World Australia to suspend operations at ports in several states. The breach was detected on Friday, leading to the suspension of container terminals in Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, and Fremantle. DP World Australia is currently testing key systems and examining the nature of data access and theft. The company has not provided a timeline for when normal operations will resume. The interruption is expected to impact the movement of goods into and out of the country for several days. The government is coordinating a response to the incident, and DP World employs over 7,000 people in the Asia-Pacific region, with ports and terminals in 18 locations.

item.title: Telangana assembly polls: Some families ‘more equal than others’ for political parties, given 2 tickets
item.description: The article discusses the presence of family members in the Telangana Assembly election. It highlights how members from the same family, such as siblings or spouses, are contesting from different parties. Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao and his son K T Rama Rao are both seeking re-election. The Congress party has also fielded candidates who are related to each other, including a husband and wife and two brothers. The article mentions criticism from the opposition party regarding the Congress party's violation of its "one family, one ticket" resolution. The presence of dynastic politics is acknowledged, with advantages such as branding, family vote banks, and financial influence mentioned. The article concludes by emphasizing the responsibility of intellectuals and educated voters to inform the public about the negative aspects of such politics.

item.title: Kareena Kapoor, Saif Ali Khan exude desi vibes at Diwali celebration
item.description: Bollywood celebrities Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan hosted a lavish Diwali party for their close friends and family members. Kareena shared her stunning Diwali look on Instagram, wearing a red embellished saree with floral prints and a matching strappy blouse. Her makeup was dewy, and she accessorized with diamond-studded earrings and a bindi. Saif looked stylish in a black and white dhoti kurta set. The couple also shared pictures of themselves with their sons Taimur and Jeh, decorating their home for the festival. The star-studded party was attended by Sara Ali Khan, Ibrahim Ali Khan, Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor, Karisma Kapoor, and Neetu Singh. On the work front, Kareena's film 'The Buckingham Murders' premiered at the BFI London Film Festival, and Saif will be seen in the Pan-India film 'Devara' with Jr NTR and Janhvi Kapoor.

item.title: Ranbir, Alia arrive hand-in-hand at Kareena Kapoor Khan’s Diwali bash
item.description: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt attended Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan's Diwali bash in Mumbai. Alia looked stunning in a red lehenga, while Ranbir wore a black kurta with a black jacket and white pants. They posed for photos together, holding hands. Ranbir's mother Neetu Kapoor also attended the party wearing a pink salwar suit. Other celebrities like Arjun Kapoor, Amrita Arora, Karisma Kapoor, Kunal Kemmu, and Soha Ali Khan were also seen arriving at the event. Kareena and Saif were dressed elegantly, with Kareena sharing a stylish picture of the couple on Instagram. Before the party, Kareena shared pictures of her sons, Taimur and Jeh, creating a rangoli. Kareena recently premiered her film 'The Buckingham Murders' at the BFI London Film Festival, and Saif will be seen in the Pan-India film 'Devara.'

item.title: Pandian true disciple of Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, says top BJD leader
item.description: Former bureaucrat VK Pandian, who recently retired from government service, has been described as a "true disciple" of Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik by a top leader of the ruling BJD party in Odisha. Pandian, who served as Patnaik's private secretary, has been appointed as the chairman of the 'Nabin Odisha' program and the '5T' transformational initiatives. He has also been given the status of a cabinet minister and will report directly to the chief minister. The BJD party is reportedly waiting for Patnaik's final word to officially induct Pandian into the party.

item.title: Anti-terrorism court extends judicial remand of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf leader Yasmin Rashid and others
item.description: The anti-terrorism court in Islamabad, Pakistan has extended the judicial remand of three accused individuals, including PTI leader Yasmin Rashid, in a case related to vandalism. The court ordered a 14-day extension and scheduled their next presentation for November 25. The case revolves around the arson of the Shadman Town police station. These individuals were initially sent to jail on a 13-day judicial remand after protests erupted following the arrest of PTI chairman Imran Khan on May 9. Imran Khan was later released, but many PTI workers and leaders were rounded up and are still facing court proceedings. It is important to note that Imran Khan's arrest took place on August 5, following his sentencing in the Toshakhana case, resulting in his disqualification from politics for five years.

item.title: Taliban-led Ministry of Refugees and Repatriation calls Pak’s move to deport Afghan migrants “rushed”
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Pakistan's decision to deport Afghan immigrants has been criticized by Mohammad Arsalan Kharoti, Deputy Minister of Refugees and Repatriation in Afghanistan. Kharoti called the decision rushed and a violation of international laws. He also highlighted that in the past two weeks, around 300,000 Afghan refugees have returned to Kabul from neighboring countries, particularly Pakistan. Kharoti emphasized the need for more assistance to be provided to the returning immigrants. Balochistan caretaker information minister Jan Achakzai also stated that their government would continue the campaign against illegal immigrants.

The final match was expected to be Megan Rapinoe's retirement party, but she was forced to leave the game early due to an injury. Rose Lavelle scored for Reign, but they were unable to equalize in the second half.

item.title: Former UK PM Johnson condemns ‘anti-Semitic rally’ in London
item.description: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson condemned the anti-Semitic rally in London and the Hamas massacre, stating that they will not succeed in wiping Israel off the map. He expressed shock at the anti-Semitic chants and called for more action to combat rising hatred in Europe. The protest, organized to denounce Israeli aggression in Gaza, drew thousands of people and was anticipated to be one of Britain's largest-ever protests. The Metropolitan Police mobilized a large number of officers to ensure safety and prevent any disruptions. The protest became embroiled in a political debate over whether it should take place. Counterprotesters confronted the police and threw missiles as they moved towards other parts of the city.

item.title: Hamas integral part of axis of terrorism led by Iran: Israeli PM Netanyahu
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has referred to Hamas as an integral part of the axis of terrorism led by Iran, stating that it endangers the Middle East and the Arab world. Netanyahu called on Arab leaders to take a stand against Hamas and criticized the group for bringing disaster to Gaza over the past 16 years. He affirmed that international pressure will not change Israel's determination to defend itself. Netanyahu declared that Israel's war against Hamas is advancing with the goal of victory, vowing to eliminate Hamas and bring back hostages. He stated that thousands of Hamas terrorists, including senior commanders, have been killed. Netanyahu emphasized that the return of hostages is the main objective of the conflict and that there will be no ceasefire without their release. The Israeli Defense Forces also launched airstrikes on Hezbollah infrastructure and military posts in Lebanon in response to previous attacks.

item.title: Soccer-New coach Talay sees room to improve on Sydney’s five-goal haul
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Ufuk Talay, the new coach of Sydney FC, emphasized that there is still room for improvement despite their 5-1 victory over Adelaide United in his first game in charge. Talay took over from Steve Corica after Sydney had lost their first three games of the season. He was pleased with the team's performance but acknowledged that there is still work to be done. Talay believes that the international break will provide an opportunity to make further changes and prepare for their upcoming match against Western Sydney Wanderers.

item.title: China’s Singles Day sales festival wraps up with e-commerce giants reporting sales growth
item.description: Alibaba's Chinese e-commerce platforms, Tmall and Taobao, experienced positive growth during this year's Singles Day sales period. Competitor JD.com also reported a record high in gross merchandising volume (GMV) during the sales period. The Singles Day festival, originally a 24-hour online shopping event, has expanded into weeks of promotions across major e-commerce platforms and physical stores in China. Alibaba did not disclose the actual yuan value of its sales for the second consecutive year. The festival is seen as a measure of consumer confidence, and expectations for sales growth this year were subdued due to economic challenges. Alibaba pressured merchants to offer low prices for Singles Day to compete with rivals such as Douyin and Pinduoduo. A Bain and Company report found that consumers planned to spend less or the same compared to last year. Shoppers focused on purchasing necessities rather than discretionary items. The final sales picture and growth rates will take longer to emerge, as return rates are expected to be high this year.

item.title: Four killed in building collapse in China’s Wenzhou city
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Four construction workers were killed when a building collapsed during renovation in Wenzhou city, China. The incident was attributed to continuous rain that hindered rescue efforts. Investigations are ongoing to determine the cause of the collapse. This incident is one of several similar accidents in recent months, including the collapse of a gym in Heilongjiang province that resulted in three fatalities. Authorities suspect the illegal stacking of construction materials on the gym's roof may have caused the collapse. These incidents have prompted concerns about building safety, with social media users calling for greater attention to be given to hidden dangers.

item.title: Delhi may see best Diwali day air quality in 8 years if firecracker ban works
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Delhi experienced its best air quality on Diwali day in eight years due to a strict ban on firecrackers and favorable weather conditions. The city woke up to clear skies and an Air Quality Index (AQI) of 202, the best in at least three weeks. The AQI between zero and 50 is considered 'good', while 201 and 300 are considered 'poor'. The improvement in air quality can be attributed to intermittent rainfall and wind speed that helped disperse pollutants. Last year, Delhi recorded an AQI of 312 on Diwali day. However, sporadic incidents of firecracker burning were reported despite the ban, which could lead to a rise in pollution levels.

item.title: Spain’s Sanchez wins support for PM bid amid anger over Catalan amnesty vow
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Spain's acting Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez is likely to secure another term in office with the backing of regional parties, including the National Basque Party (PNV), the Canaries' coalition, and the Catalan separatist party Junts. This support would give Sanchez an absolute majority in the lower house. However, there is widespread anger over Sanchez's pledge of amnesty for Catalan separatists, with opinion polls showing the country divided on the issue. The proposed amnesty law would release civil servants involved in the illegal independence referendum in Catalonia in 2017 and allow separatist leaders, like Carles Puigdemont, to run for office again. Critics argue that the amnesty undermines the rule of law, while tensions have led to violent clashes between protesters and police.

item.title: How Centre’s ‘Aaina’ portal could help 4,700+ urban local bodies take long, hard look in the mirror
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA) in India is launching a new initiative called "Aaina" (mirror), which aims to consolidate information on over 4,700 urban local bodies (ULBs) onto a single portal. The initiative is intended to help ULBs understand their current status and improve their performance and service delivery. The portal will provide data across domains such as planning and finance, allowing ULBs to learn from each other's work. Under the initiative, ULBs will be asked to provide data on five categories: planning, municipal finance, citizen-centric services, administrative structure, and basic service delivery. The new platform will also standardize data collection, as ULBs currently have different methods of collating data. The initiative is expected to aid in planning future schemes and serve as a knowledge-sharing platform for ULBs to improve their functioning.

item.title: MP: Migration for employment continues in tribal-dominated Jhabua; BJP and Congress pass the blame
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Migration for employment opportunities is a significant issue in the Jhabua assembly constituency in Madhya Pradesh. Many residents, like Ran Singh, migrate to Gujarat in search of work because the rocky land in Jhabua does not yield sufficient crops. Singh himself had worked as a cotton-picker in Gujarat in the past. The upcoming state assembly elections in Jhabua, a Congress stronghold reserved for scheduled tribes, have not generated much election atmosphere. The incumbent Congress candidate is Vikrant Bhuria, while the Bharatiya Janata Party has fielded Bhanu Bhuria as their candidate. Vikrant claims that the BJP government has not done enough to increase employment opportunities in the tribal-dominated region, leading to migration. Bhanu Bhuria alleges that the lack of dams in Jhabua, which could have provided water for irrigation, has contributed to the migration issue. In the 2018 assembly elections, Guman Singh Damor of the BJP defeated Vikrant Bhuria, but subsequently resigned for the Lok Sabha seat. Kantilal Bhuria, another Congress candidate, won the by-election for the Jhabua assembly seat.

item.title: Arab countries oppose measures against Israel despite fighting in Gaza
item.description: An emergency meeting of the Arab League and the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation was held in Riyadh to discuss Israel's invasion of Gaza. However, no practical measures were adopted against Israel. Discussions focused on stopping Israeli air traffic over the Gulf, preventing the US Air Force from delivering arms to Israel through Gulf air force bases, and cutting back oil sales to the US due to its support for Israel. Some Arab countries demanded that moderate Arab states suspend their economic relations with Israel, but a resolution to adopt these measures was blocked by Israel's Abraham accords partner states. Egypt, Jordan, the UAE, Bahrain, Sudan, and Morocco voted against the measures, along with Saudi Arabia, Mauritania, and Djibouti. The meeting also rejected an Iranian demand to designate the Israel Defense Forces as a terror organization.

item.title: Hamas’s human shields: ‘Terrorists left the hospital with civilians’
item.description:
Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) evacuated Rantisi Hospital in the Gaza Strip to avoid harming Palestinian noncombatants. They chose not to target Hamas terrorists leaving with civilians and instead worked with the Israel Security Agency (Shin Bet) to later kill the terrorist who held approximately 1,000 Gaza residents hostage at the hospital. The IDF stated that Ahmed Siam, a commander of the Naser Radwan Company of Hamas, was killed while hiding in the Al Buraq School, along with other terrorists. The IDF emphasized that Hamas uses civilians as human shields for their terror activities.
The IDF's Coordination and Liaison Administration for Gaza clarified that there was no shooting or siege at Shifa Hospital, and they were willing to coordinate the safe evacuation of anyone who wanted to leave. However, Lt. Col. (res.) Peter Lerner stated that hospitals would have to be evacuated in order to go after Hamas.
The Givati Brigade, an IDF unit, had been asking civilians to leave Rantisi Hospital for three days, but they realized that Hamas was holding hostages there. The IDF allowed Hamas operatives to leave with civilians to avoid causing more harm. Nevertheless, terrorists still shot at those evacuating. IDF ground troops killed numerous terrorists and targeted infrastructure and weapons belonging to Hamas.
The IDF also conducted operations against Hezbollah in Lebanon. Furthermore, Hezbollah chief Hassan Nasrallah blamed the United States for the Israeli aggression against Gaza and called for pressure to be directed at them to stop the conflict.

item.title: French national Michel Morliere dies at Apnaghar Ashram in Varanasi
item.description: A French national named Michel Morliere has passed away at Apnaghar Ashram in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh. The French Embassy in India has given permission for individuals named Gopal Jha, Emeline Jamont, and Aman to collect the deceased's body and related documents, including death certificates, on its behalf. The embassy has also allowed them to cremate the body and hand over the ashes to Emeline Jamond, as per the wishes of the deceased's family. The embassy expresses gratitude to the authorities for their assistance in this matter.

item.title: Netanyahu rules out Palestinian authority’s return to Gaza
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has stated that the Palestinian Authority (PA) will not be permitted to return to Gaza following the war. He emphasized the importance of total security control to eliminate potential terrorists and prevent the teaching of hatred towards Israel. Netanyahu also criticized the PA's leader for his delayed condemnation of a massacre. In 2007, Hamas, backed by Iran, forcefully took over the Gaza Strip, resulting in the expulsion, imprisonment, or death of Fatah members.Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has ruled out the return of the Palestinian Authority (PA) to Gaza after the war. He emphasized the need for total security control to eliminate terrorists and prevent the education of children to hate Israel. Netanyahu also criticized the PA leader for not condemning a massacre in a timely manner. The Gaza Strip has been under the control of the Iran-backed Hamas since 2007, with members of rival Fatah either killed, imprisoned, or expelled.
