item.title: Over 800 Sudanese reportedly killed by armed groups in West Darfur: UNHCR
item.description: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) has reported that over 800 people have been killed and more than 4.8 million people displaced in the past six months due to armed insurgency in Ardamata, Sudan's West Darfur region. The UN warns that the escalating violence in Darfur raises concerns of a repeat of the atrocities committed two decades ago. The conflict has resulted in the destruction of close to 100 shelters and extensive looting, including UNHCR relief items. In the past, thousands were killed and millions displaced during fighting between government forces and rebel groups in Darfur. The UN Special Adviser on the Prevention of Genocide has warned that continued fighting, including attacks based on ethnicity, could amount to war crimes and crimes against humanity. The UN refugee agency expresses alarm over reports of sexual violence, torture, arbitrary killings, extortion, and targeting of specific ethnic groups. UN High Commissioner for Refugees, Filippo Grandi, urges an immediate end to the fighting and respect for civilians to avoid another catastrophe. Since mid-April, over 4.8 million people have been displaced within Sudan, with an additional 1.2 million seeking refuge in neighboring countries. Over 8,000 people have fled to Chad in the last week alone, according to UNHCR.

item.title: French Ambassador to India visits war veterans’ memorial
item.description: French Ambassador to India, Thierry Mathou, and France's Deputy Ambassador to Puducherry, Talbot Barre, visited the war veterans' memorial in Puducherry on November 11, to commemorate the end of World War I. They paid tribute to the soldiers who lost their lives by placing a wreath at the memorial and observing a moment of silence. The memorial is dedicated to residents of French India who died during the war. Additionally, India and France have committed to deepening their cooperation in areas such as digital public infrastructure, cybersecurity, start-ups, AI, supercomputing, and digital skills development. They aim to harness their respective strengths in digital technologies and work together for a peaceful and open cyberspace. The two countries also recognize the potential of startups in driving innovation and economic growth and emphasize their commitment to bilateral cooperation.

item.title: Satisfaction level of Afghan women for their freedom, social life lowest in world: Survey
item.description: According to a recent survey by the Gallup Institute, Afghan women have the lowest satisfaction level for their freedom and social life compared to other countries. Only 11% of Afghan women are satisfied with their social freedom in Afghanistan, while 17% said they are treated with respect. The survey highlights that women in Afghanistan continue to face suffering despite some level of freedom. The Taliban, however, dismissed the survey as invalid and claimed that the suffering of Afghan women has ended. The report also expresses concern about the deportation of Afghan refugees from Pakistan and the pressure it puts on the lives of deported women and girls.

item.title: Soccer-Juventus move top of Serie A with 2-1 win over Cagliari

Gleison Bremer and Daniele Rugani scored in the second half to secure Juventus' fifth consecutive win. Coach Massimiliano Allegri praised his team's spirit and emphasized the need for improved effectiveness in the final pass. After six clean sheets, Juventus conceded their first goal since September. Despite the victory, Allegri considers Inter Milan as favorites for the Scudetto, with AC Milan and Napoli close behind. The next game for Juventus is a top-of-the-table clash against Inter after the international break. Cagliari, who recently climbed out of the relegation zone, currently sit in 17th place with nine points.

item.title: Trump backs requests for TV coverage of his federal criminal trial – court filing
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump has filed a legal motion supporting media requests for live television coverage of his federal trial. Trump argues that prosecutors want the trial held in darkness as part of a politically motivated effort by President Joe Biden's administration to undermine his bid for re-election in 2024. Trump is facing four criminal proceedings, including charges of attempting to defraud the federal government and obstructing Congress by spreading false claims of election fraud. The latest filing by Trump's lawyers endorses media organizations' requests for live television coverage, stating that it would allow the American public to see that the case is a "dreamt-up constitutional charade." Special prosecutor Jack Smith had previously opposed the media requests, citing a federal court rule that prohibits broadcasts of criminal proceedings.

item.title: Heavy rains flood homes and crops in northern France
item.description: Days of heavy rains in northern France have caused rivers to overflow, leading to flooding of houses and fields. Residents have been evacuated, with some having to be airlifted to safety. More than 100 towns are on red alert and around 200 schools in the region have been closed. Rescue workers have also had to evacuate cattle. Farmers have suffered significant losses, with poultry farms flooded and crops compromised, raising concerns about the spread of disease. The situation is being considered a natural disaster, which allows affected individuals to benefit from insurance coverage.

item.title: Wegovy’s heart benefits due to more than weight loss, Novo says
item.description: Novo Nordisk has announced new data that suggests the heart protective benefits of its obesity treatment, Wegovy, are not solely due to weight loss. The drug, which has been shown to help patients lose an average of 15% of their weight, also reduces the risk of heart attack, stroke, or death from heart disease by 20%, according to early data from the company's select trial. The study found that the cardiovascular benefits of Wegovy appeared almost immediately after starting treatment, suggesting they were not solely a result of weight loss. The drug also demonstrated a reduction in non-fatal heart attack, non-fatal stroke, and heart-related death. The study's authors note that while the mechanisms behind Wegovy's cardiovascular protection remain speculative, it has a consistent effect on associated risk factors such as inflammation, blood pressure, and blood sugar control. However, the trial did report adverse side effects, primarily gastrointestinal disorders like nausea and vomiting, in almost 1,500 patients taking Wegovy compared to 718 patients in the placebo group. Novo Nordisk expects to have Wegovy's label updated to include the heart benefits in the U.S. and EU next year.

item.title: Taliban criticises Pakistan’s decision to deport Afghan immigrants from country
item.description: Pakistan's decision to deport Afghan immigrants has been criticized by Mohammad Arsala Kharoti, the Taliban-appointed deputy of Afghanistan's Ministry of Refugees and Repatriation. Kharoti stated that the decision was rushed and violated the rights of immigrants, calling on Pakistan to allow them to return voluntarily. He highlighted that approximately 300,000 Afghan refugees had returned to Kabul from neighboring countries, particularly Pakistan, in the past two weeks. Kharoti emphasized that more assistance should be provided to these returnees, as current support from the international community and organizations is insufficient. Additionally, Jan Achakzai, Balochistan's caretaker information minister, claimed that the Pakistani government would take similar actions against those residing without legal documents in the country.

item.title: US accomplice in Israel ‘crimes’: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi

He criticized the US for supporting Israel and providing it with weapons, claiming that Israel has dropped bombs equivalent to seven atomic bombs in Gaza. Raisi made these remarks at the Arab Islamic Summit in Riyadh, where he called on attendees to "save the Palestinians." This summit was hosted by Saudi Arabia in response to the ongoing situation in Gaza. This marks the first visit by an Iranian leader to Saudi Arabia in 11 years, following the restoration of diplomatic relations between the two countries in March.

In a fit of rage, he repeatedly struck her on the head with a pressure cooker, resulting in her immediate death. item.title: J’khand: Two die as train stops suddenly after overhead electric wire snaps

The incident occurred between Gomoh and Koderma railway stations when the driver of the Purushottam Express applied the emergency brake. As a result, two people were killed due to the jolt caused by the sudden stop. The train was traveling at a speed of 130 kmph at the time of the accident. Train services resumed after a four-hour delay. The Purushottam Express was taken to Gomoh by a diesel engine and then sent to Delhi using an electric engine. The railway division manager and other officials visited the accident site.

item.title: Vigilance minister initiates inquiry against Delhi chief secretary in Bamnoli land acquisition case
item.description: Delhi Vigilance Minister Atishi has initiated an inquiry into a complaint against Chief Secretary Naresh Kumar regarding the acquisition of land in Bamnoli village for the Dwarka Expressway. The complaint alleges that the chief secretary's son was employed by a relative of a landowner who received enhanced compensation for the acquired land. Atishi has summoned all the files on the land acquisition and has directed the divisional commissioner and vigilance director to provide them by 7 pm on Saturday. The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is already probing the matter, but Atishi has insisted on conducting her own inquiry. The chief secretary has called the complaint an act of "mudslinging" by disgruntled individuals. Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has marked the complaint for an inquiry and requested a detailed report from the vigilance minister.

item.title: Mansour bin Zayed participates in Joint Arab-Islamic Extraordinary Summit in Riyadh
item.description: The UAE delegation, led by Sheikh Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan, attended the Joint Arab-Islamic Extraordinary Summit on the developments in Gaza. The summit aimed to discuss the situation in Gaza and the Palestinian territories. The participants emphasized the importance of an immediate ceasefire, protecting civilians, and providing humanitarian aid. Sheikh Mansour bin Zayed later left Saudi Arabia after the summit.The UAE delegation led by Sheikh Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan, Vice President and Chairman of the Presidential Court, attended the joint Arab-Islamic extraordinary summit on the developments in Gaza. The summit, inaugurated by Prince Mohammed bin Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud, discussed the situation in Gaza and the Palestinian territories. The participants emphasized the need for an immediate ceasefire, protection of civilians, and the opening of safe humanitarian corridors. Sheikh Mansour bin Zayed later left the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia after the summit.

item.title: Woman creates flutter in PM Modi’s rally in Hyderabad
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi had to pause his speech during a rally in Hyderabad when he noticed a young woman climbing a structure with lights fixed on it. The incident occurred at the Parade Grounds where Modi was addressing a meeting organized by the Madiga Reservation Porata Samithi (MRPS), a community organization representing the Madigas, a significant group within the Scheduled Castes in Telugu states. Concerned about the condition of the electric wires, Modi urged the woman to come down and emphasized that he was there for the people. He was supported by Rajya Sabha member K Laxman, who translated the Prime Minister's request into Telugu. The police are currently verifying the incident. Prior to this interruption, Modi consoled Krishna Madiga, the founder of MRPS, who became emotional and hugged him at the beginning of the speech.

item.title: UAE dispatches 100 tonnes of food, medical supplies to support Palestinians in Gaza
item.description: The UAE has sent a plane carrying 100 tonnes of food, medical, and relief supplies to El Arish city in Egypt, as part of the "Tarahum for Gaza" campaign. The supplies will be used to support those affected in the Gaza Strip, particularly women, children, and the elderly. The campaign, launched last month, aims to provide relief for Palestinians and reflects the UAE's commitment to humanitarian efforts.The UAE has sent a plane carrying 100 tonnes of food, medical supplies, and relief items to Egypt's El Arish city as part of the "Tarahum for Gaza" campaign. The aid will be transported to the Gaza Strip through the Rafah Border Crossing in coordination with the UN World Food Programme. The UAE aims to alleviate the humanitarian conditions in Gaza by providing essential supplies, particularly for women, children, and the elderly. The campaign, launched last month, reflects the country's values of giving and human solidarity.

item.title: HP Governor inaugurates Lavi Mela in Shimla
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Lavi Mela in Himachal Pradesh has become a cultural festival in the region, according to Governor Shiv Pratap Shukla. The fair, which lasts for four days, not only preserves the area's rich traditions but also provides trade opportunities for locals. Former Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh was honored for his efforts in giving the fair international status in 1985. Shukla commended the organizers for showcasing unique textiles, crafts, and products, which gives traditional artisans and farmers a chance to sell their goods. The governor also inaugurated exhibitions and unveiled a video teaser for the international Lavi Fair to be held in 2023. Several folk dance groups performed at the event.

item.title: Tight security arrangements in Kolkata ahead of Diwali, Kali Puja
item.description: The Kolkata Police has implemented precautionary measures to maintain law and order and prevent the use of banned firecrackers during Kali Puja and Diwali celebrations in the city. Over 5,000 police personnel will be on duty, ensuring compliance with regulations and monitoring firecracker activity. Police officers will be stationed at various locations, including shopping malls, markets, religious places, railway stations, and jetties. The report is sourced from PTI news service and is not the responsibility of ThePrint.The Kolkata Police have implemented precautionary measures to maintain law and order and prevent the use of banned firecrackers during the Kali Puja and Diwali celebrations in Kolkata. Over 5,000 police personnel will be on duty, with officers monitoring the situation and ensuring compliance with the ban on firecrackers. Police presence will be increased at key locations such as shopping malls, markets, religious places, railway stations, and jetties. Approximately 21 deputy commissioners and 35 assistant commissioners will be deployed for this purpose.

item.title: Modi government made country secure by stopping infiltration: Amit Shah
item.description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah spoke at a public meeting in Madhya Pradesh, praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi for making the country secure by stopping infiltration. Shah criticized the opposition's India grouping and the Congress party for being incapable of stopping infiltration. He also highlighted the Modi government's actions such as banning the Popular Front of India (PFI), abrogating Article 370, carrying out surgical and air strikes on Pakistan, and making Kashmir an integral part of the country. Shah urged voters to elect a Modi government at the center and a BJP government in the state to secure the country. He claimed that the Congress party, which he accused of corruption and dynastic politics, will be wiped out from Madhya Pradesh. Shah also mentioned the transformative change brought by the BJP to the state in 18 years compared to the 53-year-long rule of the Congress. He announced the date of January 22, 2024, for the inauguration of the Ram temple in Ayodhya and accused Rahul Gandhi of mocking him in the past. Shah claimed that the Congress obstructed the construction of the temple for 70 years. He accused the Congress of insulting Indian culture while highlighting the initiatives taken by Modi, such as the construction of the Ram temple, Kashi Vishwanath corridor, and Kartarpur Sahib corridor. Shah also mentioned the Teerth Darshan Yojana pilgrimage scheme introduced by the BJP government and alleged that the Congress stalled it during its rule in Madhya Pradesh.

item.title: CPI(M) holds massive pro-Palestine rally at Kerala’s Kozhikode
item.description: The Communist Party of India (Marxist) held a rally in Kozhikode expressing solidarity with Palestine and criticizing the BJP-led Indian government for its alleged pro-Israel stance. Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan stated that the Left parties stand firmly with Palestine and accused the BJP of going against humanity. He claimed that while the people of India support Palestine, the government does not reflect their sentiments and instead cooperates with Israel. Vijayan also criticized the BJP government for diluting India's foreign policy to support Israel. The article mentions the controversy surrounding the CPI(M)'s invitation to the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML), causing tensions within the opposition United Democratic Front (UDF). The report also provides casualty figures from the conflict between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: Pakistan play old school cricket to end World Cup with embarrassing defeat against England
item.description: England defeated Pakistan by 93 runs in their World Cup game, securing seventh place in the tournament. Pakistan's chances of qualifying for the semi-finals were shattered as England scored 337 runs in their innings, while Pakistan only managed 244 runs in response. Pakistan's batting performance was lackluster, with Babar Azam and Mohammed Rizwan struggling to make an impact. The pitch conditions at Eden Gardens made it difficult for Pakistan to chase a near 340-run target. England's star-studded batting lineup, including Ben Stokes, Joe Root, and Jonny Bairstow, contributed to their commendable total. Stokes, in particular, played a crucial role in their batting performance, scoring 84 runs. Pakistan's Haris Rauf and Shaheen Shah Afridi took wickets, but England lost momentum towards the end of their innings. Stokes, who returned from retirement, had a successful World Cup with three consecutive innings of 50-plus scores. Root also performed well, forming a 132-run partnership with Stokes. Bairstow provided a strong start for England with his quick 59 runs off 61 balls.

item.title: President Herzog speaks with German President on Kristallnacht anniversary
item.description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog spoke with German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier on the 85th anniversary of the Kristallnacht Pogrom. President Steinmeier expressed solidarity with Israel following a terrorist attack by Hamas. President Herzog thanked President Steinmeier for his support and friendship, and discussed Israel's ongoing battle against Hamas and efforts to secure the release of hostages. He emphasized the pain of the families affected and the symbolic significance of speaking on the anniversary of Kristallnacht. The article also provides background information on Kristallnacht, which marked the start of the Holocaust.

item.title: Khaled bin Mohamed bin Zayed attends Abu Dhabi International Boat Show
item.description: Sheikh Khaled bin Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi, attended the Abu Dhabi international Boat Show (ADIBS) held at the Abu Dhabi National Exhibition Centre. He toured the pavilions showcasing the latest marine technology and praised the efforts of the organizers. The event aims to strengthen the presence of maritime companies in the region's markets and attract marine enthusiasts. This year's exhibition has seen significant local and international participation, with over 700 companies and brands from more than 15 countries. The event is expected to attract over 10,000 visitors. Sheikh Khaled was accompanied by other prominent figures from Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Ayodhya Deepotsav sets new Guinness world record by lighting over 22.23 lakh diyas
item.description: Ayodhya, a temple town in Uttar Pradesh, India, has set a new Guinness world record by lighting over 22.23 lakh earthen lamps during the 'Deepotsav 2023' festival. This broke the town's own record of 15.76 lakh lamps lit last year. The Uttar Pradesh Government's 'Grand Deepotsav' was recognized by the Guinness Book of World Records, and representatives from the organization witnessed and acknowledged the achievement. Teachers, students, and volunteer organizations all contributed to the creation of the record. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who initiated the Deepotsav festival in 2017, received warm greetings and congratulations for this accomplishment. The increasing number of lamps lit each year symbolizes the growing prosperity of the state and the country.

item.title: Our platform shall not be used for any election campaign: Samyukta Kisan Morcha
item.description: The Samyukta Kisan Morcha (SKM), the largest platform of farmers and farmworkers in India, has stated that it will not be involved in any election campaign. While individual members and constituent organizations are allowed to support and vote for their preferred candidates or political parties, the SKM as a whole will not endorse any particular candidate or party. This statement was made in response to three constituent organizations of the SKM in Rajasthan issuing a joint press note supporting a specific political party candidate. The SKM reiterates its position of not contesting elections or supporting any particular candidate or party.

item.title: Nath slams BJP for manifesto not mentioning Ladli Bahna Yojana dole hike, accuses Chouhan of lying
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) released its manifesto for the Madhya Pradesh assembly polls without mentioning an increase in the monthly financial aid under the Ladli Bahna Yojana to Rs 3,000, which was promised earlier by Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan. The manifesto includes promises such as reduced prices for cooking gas cylinders, free education for girls from poor families, higher minimum support price for wheat and paddy, houses for Ladli Bahna scheme beneficiaries, and free education up to class 12 for poor students. Kamal Nath, the state unit chief of the opposition Congress party, criticized the BJP for copying many promises from the Congress' announcements. Nath assured women that if the Congress comes to power, they will receive Rs 1,500 per month under the Nari Samman Yojana and gas cylinders at Rs 500 starting from January 1. The Congress has also promised to waive loans for farmers, fill vacant posts, provide free and subsidized power units, offer reservations for other backward classes, and reintroduce the old pension scheme. The state assembly polls are scheduled for November 17, with vote counting on December 3.

Doctors in the neonatal ward are now manually performing artificial respiration on 36 babies. The hospital is reportedly surrounded from all directions, with approximately 400 people being treated and 20,000 displaced seeking shelter there. The IDF has accused Hamas of using Gaza hospitals and civilian infrastructure as cover for military operations. Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah has called for prolonging the war between Israel and Hamas, stating that pressure needs to be expanded. The IDF intercepted a Hezbollah anti-tank squad in southern Lebanon, and sirens sounded in an Israeli community. The IDF is responding to the attacks with artillery shelling.

item.title: 23-year-old man killed, two women injured as SUV hits two-wheelers
item.description: A 23-year-old man was killed and a woman and her daughter were seriously injured in Nagpur, India, after a rashly-driven SUV hit their scooters. The incident occurred on Friday night near a temple, and the SUV driver fled the scene after hitting an electric pole and overturning the vehicle. The police have registered a case under IPC section 304(a) and are conducting further investigations.A 23-year-old man was killed and a woman and her daughter were seriously injured after being hit by a rashly-driven SUV in Nagpur. The incident occurred near a temple on Friday night. The man was identified as Gaurav Raut, while the injured woman and her daughter were named Varsha Kharabe and Divyanshi. The SUV also collided with an electric pole and overturned before the driver fled the scene. The police have registered a case and further investigation is ongoing.

item.title: “Indian diaspora…worked hard for this initiative”: US official on Diwali holidays in New York
item.description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has declared Diwali as a public school holiday for the first time in the city's history. Dilip Chauhan, Deputy Commissioner at the Mayor's office, praised the decision and credited the Indian diaspora and Indian-American community for their years of advocacy. Chauhan emphasized the significance of Diwali, which represents the festival of light over darkness. The announcement came after state lawmakers passed legislation designating Diwali as a holiday in the city's school system. Mayor Adams called it a significant win for local families.

item.title: Over 22 lakh ‘diyas’ light up Ayodhya as Deepotsav sets world record
item.description: The seventh edition of the Deepotsav in Ayodhya set a new world record by lighting over 22 lakh 'diyas' (earthen lanterns) along the banks of the Saryu river. The lamps were lit by 25,000 volunteers at the 51 ghats of Ram Ki Paidi. Representatives from the Guinness Book of World Records confirmed the record and awarded the city the status of a world record holder. The event was attended by Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, Governor Anandiben Patel, and diplomats from 54 countries. The Deepotsav, which has become a major event in the state since 2017, featured cultural presentations, Ramlila performances, and the participation of artists from India and abroad. The event coincided with Hanuman Jayanti and marked the countdown to the consecration ceremony of the idol of Lord Ram Lalla on January 22.

item.title: Congress govt implemented welfare schemes keeping in mind every section, says CM Gehlot
item.description: Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot of Rajasthan, India, stated that the Congress government implemented public welfare schemes for all sections of society during its five-year tenure. He expressed confidence that the public will return the party to power in the upcoming elections. Gehlot highlighted the achievements of the government, including the all-round development of the state and the benefits provided to households through schemes based on the opinions of the common people. He also announced seven guarantees, such as an annual honorarium for women heads of families and school education in English medium, if the Congress retains power. The voting for the Rajasthan Assembly will take place on November 25, with the results being counted on December 3.

item.title: Sisodia meets ailing wife after court’s permission
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Former Delhi deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia, who is currently in Tihar jail in connection with an alleged liquor scam case, was granted permission by a city court to meet his ailing wife for six hours. Sisodia spent the time with his wife at their home on Mathura Road, where he lit diyas for 'Choti Diwali'. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal expressed his sympathy for Sisodia, questioning the injustice done to him. This is not the first time Sisodia has been allowed to meet his wife, as he was granted permission in June but could not do so due to her hospitalization. Sisodia's bail application in the case was recently rejected by the Supreme Court.

item.title: Eatery owner murdered in Nagpur by two staffers over financial dispute
item.description: An eatery owner in Nagpur, Maharashtra, was allegedly murdered by two of his employees following a financial dispute. The owner, Raju Bhaurao Dhengre, was attacked with a wooden log and strangled at around 3:30 am. The motive for the murder was an argument over salary and bonus, as the accused employees wanted to go on vacation for Diwali. After the incident, they fled in Dhengre's car, which they later abandoned after crashing near a bridge on Naag river in Vhirgaon. The local police are investigating the case, and political leader Chandrashekhar Bawankule has sought the immediate arrest of the culprits.

item.title: “Biggest blessing”: Parineeti Chopra’s mother Reena pens sweet birthday wish for son-in-law Raghav Chadha
item.description: Parineeti Chopra's mother, Reena Chopra, has written a heartwarming birthday message for her son-in-law and Aam Aadmi Party MP, Raghav Chadha. Reena shared pictures on Instagram with a caption expressing gratitude for his presence in their lives and the family they have formed. Parineeti also posted sweet pictures with her husband, praising his intelligence, values, and commitment to family. The couple got married in September, with the ceremony attended by well-known figures from the entertainment industry and politics. Their love story is said to have started in London while they were studying together. On the work front, Parineeti will be starring alongside Diljit Dosanjh in the film 'Chamkila', directed by Imtiaz Ali.

item.title: Pradhan urges Gadkari to expand NHs from Raigarh to Talcher to 8 lanes
item.description: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan has requested his cabinet colleague Nitin Gadkari to expand an economic corridor connecting two national highways between Raigarh in Chhattisgarh and Talcher in Odisha. The minister highlighted the presence of major industrial areas along this corridor and emphasized the need for expanding the roads to accommodate the growing economic activities in the region. The industrial zones in the area include Ib Valley for thermal power, sponge iron, refractories, and coal mines, Hirakud for aluminium and rolling mills, and Talcher-Angul for power plants, coal washeries, and ferroalloys. Pradhan pointed out that this region has become not only the industrial backbone of Odisha but also of the nation. Currently, there are ongoing developmental works to upgrade NH-49 and NH-53 into four-lane highways. Pradhan requested the upgrading of this stretch to an eight-lane economic corridor to improve infrastructure and boost the economy of both the state and the nation.

item.title: “Israel occupation responsible for crimes against Palestinians”; says Saudi Prince at summit on Gaza
item.description: Saudi Arabian Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman has blamed the "Israeli occupation" for the crimes committed against Palestinians. Speaking at the Arab Islamic Summit, he called for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza and criticized the international community's silence on the violations against Palestinian civilians. The crown prince also emphasized the need for a coordinated effort among Arab and Islamic states to lift the siege in Gaza and deliver humanitarian aid. He reiterated the importance of ending the occupation and establishing a Palestinian state on the 1967 borders with East Jerusalem as its capital. The emergency summit was held in response to the ongoing situation in Gaza, with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan also expressing concern and calling for a ceasefire. Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi arrived in Saudi Arabia to participate in the summit, wearing a traditional Palestinian keffiyeh scarf.

item.title: AIIMS Delhi takes measures on taxis overcharging patients for short trips
item.description: AIIMS Delhi has announced a plan to regulate the entry of commercial passenger vehicles into the hospital campus following reports of drivers overcharging patients. The initiative will install bilingual signages providing information about transportation options and introduce a number plate reader camera-based ticketing system. Vehicles exiting within 15 minutes will not be charged, while those exiting after 15 minutes will incur a fee of Rs 50 per half hour. The ticketing system will rely on automated technology and is scheduled to be implemented by December 31. The aim of these measures is to enhance the overall experience for patients seeking medical care at AIIMS.

item.title: Delhi Police takes out flag march in overcrowded markets
item.description: The Delhi Police conducted a flag march in overcrowded markets to ensure security during the ongoing festive season. The march started from Virat Chowk, Ambedkar Nagar in South Delhi. The police have also tightened security in other markets such as Janpath Market, Connaught Place, Sarojini Market, Khan Market, Chandni Chowk, and Sadar Bazar. Local police officers have been instructed to maintain a strict vigil in their respective areas. Traffic police have been directed to provide parking facilities and issue alerts about potential traffic jams. The report is auto-generated from PTI News Service, and ThePrint is not responsible for its content.

item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. The manifesto includes plans for new expressways, Metro lines, and airports. It also focuses on healthcare, education, employment opportunities, and women's empowerment. The BJP aims to fill government vacancies, invest in the tourism sector, and augment existing schemes like Ladli Laxmi Yojana. The manifesto emphasizes the party's commitment to implementing its promises and empowering the poor under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

item.title: Tennis-Italy overcome spirited Slovenia to reach BJK Cup final
item.description: Italy secured a 2-0 victory over Slovenia in Sevilla, Spain, in the Billie Jean King Cup, advancing to the final and keeping their bid for a fifth crown alive. Jasmine Paolini defeated Tamara Zidansek in a grueling match, while Martina Trevisan beat Kaja Juvan to give Italy the win. Italy's last victory in the competition was ten years ago. They will face tough competition from the Czech Republic or Canada in the final.Italy secured a 2-0 victory over Slovenia in Seville on Saturday, advancing to the Billie Jean King Cup final. Jasmine Paolini defeated Tamara Zidansek in a tight match, while Martina Trevisan beat Kaja Juvan to give Italy the win. This victory puts Italy on track for their fifth crown in the team competition. Italy's last triumph in the competition was 10 years ago. They will face either the Czech Republic or Canada in the final.

item.title: Soccer-Wolves stun Spurs 2-1 with two stoppage-time goals
item.description: In a surprising turn of events, Wolverhampton Wanderers defeated Tottenham Hotspur 2-1 with last-minute goals from Pablo Sarabia and Mario Lemina. Sarabia, who was brought on as a substitute, scored the equalizer in the 91st minute and provided the assist for Lemina's winning goal in the 97th minute. This victory prevented Tottenham from regaining the top spot in the Premier League table, leaving them in second place behind Manchester City. Wolves climbed to 12th place in the standings with this win. Despite injuries and suspensions forcing Tottenham to field a makeshift defense, they took an early lead through Brennan Johnson's goal. The first half saw back-and-forth action, but Wolves lacked the finishing touch. Sarabia finally equalized in the 91st minute, and Lemina secured the win in stoppage time. Both teams acknowledged the tough nature of the game, with Spurs manager Ange Postecoglou admitting his side ran out of energy towards the end.

item.title: Iceland evacuates town over concerns of volcanic eruption
item.description: Icelandic authorities have evacuated 3,000 residents from a town in the southwest of the island due to concerns of a volcanic eruption. The Icelandic Meteorological Office has warned of a "considerable" risk of an eruption on the Reykjanes Peninsula, citing the size and movement of the underground magma intrusion. Professor Thorvaldur Thordarson, a volcanology expert, believes an eruption could occur within hours or days. The evacuation order is not described as an emergency, but authorities believe there is an immediate risk to the town. The area has experienced previous volcanic activity, including eruptions in 2021 and 2022. The current eruption threat is in the Fagradalsfjall volcanic system, which had been inactive for over 6,000 years prior to recent eruptions.

item.title: LinkedIn says spy firm targeted Hungarian activists, journalists before 2022 election
item.description: Private spy firm Black Cube used LinkedIn to target Hungarian activists and journalists in a hidden video campaign leading up to Hungary's 2022 election, according to the professional networking site. Black Cube, based in Israel, created a network of fake personas on LinkedIn that used bogus job postings to connect with their targets. Video conversations occurred off-platform, and clips from those conversations were used to discredit NGOs in Hungary. LinkedIn has taken down the fake accounts and removed Black Cube's company page due to violations of its terms of service. Black Cube has previously been accused of interfering in Hungary's 2018 elections by secretly recording NGO leaders and publishing the footage on right-wing news outlets. The operation attributed to Black Cube by LinkedIn began in 2020 and targeted at least 12 activists and journalists critical of Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban. The footage was widely covered in Hungarian media ahead of the election, which resulted in a victory for Orban's party.

item.title: London police scuffle with far-right protesters near pro-Palestinian rally
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Tens of thousands of pro-Palestinian protesters marched through central London on Saturday, calling for a ceasefire in Israel's bombardment of the Gaza Strip. The march drew counter-protesters from right-wing groups on Armistice Day, leading to scuffles with police near the Cenotaph war memorial. The far-right protesters were contained by officers in riot gear, and police vehicles responded to tensions in the streets. Mayor Sadiq Khan and Scotland's first minister blamed the interior minister for emboldening the far-right. The pro-Palestinian rally had a large turnout, and police vowed to prevent clashes between the two groups. The protest is set to end at the U.S. Embassy.

item.title: Israel’s war on Hamas homes in on Gaza hospitals
item.description: The article reports on the dire situation in Gaza, where a baby has died and many patients are at risk due to an Israeli siege around Al Shifa hospital. Israel claims that Hamas militants have used hospitals as command centers, leading to their demand for evacuation. However, Hamas denies these allegations and argues that moving patients could result in their deaths. The hospital has suspended operations due to fuel shortages caused by Israeli shelling. Palestinian officials claim that Israeli snipers on nearby rooftops and ongoing bombardment make it dangerous for medics and people to move. Furthermore, clashes between Israeli troops and Hamas gunmen have been reported throughout Gaza City. The article also mentions that Hamas has requested international investigations into Israeli allegations of military use of hospitals. As the crisis continues, the health ministry warns that failure to bring in fuel will be a death sentence for patients, including 39 babies at risk. The World Health Organization expresses concerns about the safety of healthcare workers. Israel states that rockets are still being fired from Gaza into southern Israel, and it has implemented temporary pauses in firing to allow Gazans to evacuate. The article concludes by mentioning that Muslim and Arab countries meeting in Saudi Arabia called for an immediate end to military operations in Gaza and held Israel responsible for "crimes" against Palestinians.

item.title: J-K DGP to meet people twice every month to address grievances
item.description: Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Police (DGP) R R Swain has announced that he will hold two-hour public grievance meetings twice a month. The DGP urges individuals with complaints to submit written statements or applications. This decision was made after people began approaching the police headquarters in Jammu without prior appointments as grievance redressal seekers. The DGP emphasizes that grievances should be addressed by junior officers in the field, and priority will be given to those whose issues remain unresolved despite approaching local police units.

item.title: Three Bangladeshi tourists die in houseboat fire in India’s Kashmir
item.description: Three Bangladeshi tourists died in a fire that broke out in houseboats stationed in India's Kashmir region. The fire quickly spread to other nearby boats, resulting in the destruction of five houseboats and the injury of seven others. The preliminary investigation revealed that faulty electric wiring caused the fire. The Jammu and Kashmir region, known for its natural beauty, received a record high of 16.2 million tourists in 2022. The increase in tourist arrivals is beneficial for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government, which integrated the Muslim-majority region with the rest of India in 2019. However, Kashmir has been experiencing an ongoing separatist Islamist insurgency and is also claimed by neighboring Pakistan.

item.title: Three Bangladeshi tourists killed in Dal Lake blaze in Kashmir
item.description: Three tourists from Bangladesh were killed in a fire that engulfed a houseboat on Dal Lake in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir. The victims were identified as Anindaya Kowshal, Mohammad Moinud, and Das Gupta. The cause of the fire is still unknown, but preliminary investigations suggest it may have started due to a malfunctioning heating appliance. Eight people were rescued, and DNA samples were taken from the victims for identification purposes. The fire destroyed five houseboats, seven residential huts, and neighboring houses, resulting in extensive property damage. This incident follows a similar fire in April 2022 that gutted seven houseboats on Nigeen Lake. Lt Governor Manoj Sinha expressed his condolences and directed the District Administration to provide necessary assistance to the affected individuals. The Kashmir Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KCCI) called for compensation and swift permission for the reconstruction of the damaged houseboats.

item.title: French envoy Thierry Mathou “excited to celebrate first Diwali” in India
item.description: The French Ambassador to India, Thierry Mathou, extended his Diwali wishes and expressed his enjoyment of the festive atmosphere in India. He shared a video of his wife exploring Indian markets and purchasing handicrafts and diyas. Rishi Sunak, the first British Asian Prime Minister, also extended Diwali wishes and emphasized looking towards the future with hope. He also wished Bandi Chhor Divas to the Sikh community. Dilip Chauhan, Deputy Commissioner at the New York City Mayor's Office, highlighted the significance of Diwali this year, as it has been declared a public holiday in the city's schools.

item.title: ‘ATCM Adityanath pulls chariot to mark symbolic return of Lord Ram to Ayodhya
item.description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and Governor Anandiben Patel participated in a ceremony in Ayodhya, where a chariot carrying artistes depicting the return of Lord Ram, Sita, and Lakshman after 14 years of exile was pulled. Flowers were showered on them from a helicopter. The Chief Minister extended his Diwali greetings and emphasized the significance of the event, stating that Lord Ram would soon be enshrined in his grand temple. He also highlighted the development projects in Ayodhya and the expected increase in tourism after the inauguration of the Ram temple. The Governor and Chief Minister released a coffee table book based on the Deepotsav festival, which is being organized for the seventh time. Last year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi also participated in the event.

item.title: ‘Act of sacrilege’: Outrage over AR Rahman’s rendition of Bengali poet Nazrul Islam’s patriotic song

item.title: Pro-Palestinian rally kicks off in London amid Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Thousands of people gathered in central London for a pro-Palestinian rally to protest against Israeli aggression in Gaza. The protesters held signs that read "Free Palestine." The Metropolitan Police mobilized 1,850 officers to anticipate potential conflicts and disruption from splinter groups and far-right activists. The demonstrators planned to march to the US embassy to protest against the US's support for Israel. This protest was expected to draw even larger numbers than previous ones due to the political debate surrounding its occurrence. Counterprotesters faced off with the police, and a large group of counterprotesters was detained. In the US, anti-Israel demonstrators stormed Grand Central Terminal, closed the station, burned an Israeli flag, and chanted slogans against Israel.

item.title: Teammates have advised Babar not to step down: PCB sources
item.description: Pakistan cricket captain Babar Azam has been advised by his teammates not to step down from his position, despite criticism following the team's failure to qualify for the World Cup semi-finals. Babar has a strong following within the team, and players such as Imam ul Haq, Shadab Khan, Shaheen Shah Afridi, and Haris Rauf are considered to be close to him. Babar is expected to leave the decision of his captaincy up to the Pakistan Cricket Board, headed by Zaka Ashraf. While Babar has had success in T20 Internationals, his record in Tests and ODIs has been less impressive. The PCB head has stated that he will consult with former players, including Misbah ul Haq and Muhammad Hafeez, before making any decisions regarding the captaincy and team management.

item.title: Vijayendra’s appointment: Senior BJP leader Ravi says he too is haunted by questions
item.description: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in Karnataka is facing criticism for practicing "dynasty politics" after appointing B Y Vijayendra, the son of veteran leader B S Yediyurappa, as its state unit president. In response to questions about this appointment, senior BJP leader C T Ravi cryptically stated that he too is being haunted by certain "questions." Ravi congratulated Vijayendra and emphasized that he is not an aspirant for any post. He also mentioned that the responsibility has been given to Vijayendra to strengthen the party and achieve good results in future elections. Ravi avoided commenting on the issue of dynasty politics and stated that discussing such questions in public is not appropriate. He affirmed his commitment to working as a party member to bring back the Modi government in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. The article also mentions that some senior BJP leaders may be upset about Vijayendra's appointment, but no public statements have been made.

item.title: Pak stays till Dec 31st its decision to deport legal Afghan residents: Official
item.description: The Pakistan government has suspended its decision to repatriate legal Afghan refugee residents whose residency documents expired this year. The pause will be in effect until December 31. Previously, the government had planned to send back Afghans living with legal documents after their expiration. The deportation of illegal Afghan refugees has been ongoing, with as many as 250,000 voluntarily returning home and 80,000 being deported. The decision was made due to concerns that Afghan soil is being used by terrorists to target Pakistan. Pressure from international organizations and countries has urged Pakistan not to deport Afghans who fled the Taliban rule or conflict in their home country. Pakistan claims there are approximately 1.7 million illegal Afghan residents. Human rights groups have criticized Pakistan's move, warning of a potential humanitarian crisis and increased child labor in Afghanistan.

item.title: Committee to be set up soon to empower Madigas, says PM Modi in rally in Hyderabad
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has announced that a committee will be formed to empower the Madigas, a Scheduled Caste community, in response to their demand for categorization. Speaking at a rally organized by the Madiga Reservation Porata Samithi (MRPS), Modi pledged to end the injustice faced by the Madigas and ensure their access to justice through legal processes. He also criticized the Congress party for its treatment of B.R. Ambedkar, the architect of the Indian constitution. Modi accused the Congress of preventing Ambedkar from winning elections and not displaying his portrait in parliament. He also took a swipe at the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) government, stating that it had failed to appoint a Dalit chief minister as promised during the statehood agitation. Modi apologized on behalf of political parties and leaders who had made promises to the Madigas in the past and betrayed them. During the rally, Modi interacted with a young woman who had climbed a structure and thanked her for expressing her concerns.

item.title: ‘Act of sacrilege’: Outrage over AR Rahman’s rendition of Bengali poet Nazrul Islam’s patriotic song
item.description: Controversy has erupted over AR Rahman's rendition of a popular patriotic song by Bengali poet Kazi Nazrul Islam in the Bollywood film "Pippa." The family of Nazrul Islam and several singers have expressed outrage at the "distortion" of the song's rhythm and tunes. The song, titled "Karar Oi Louho Kopat" (Iron Bars of a Jail), was released as part of the war movie based on real-life events during the 1971 India-Pakistan war. Nazrul's family has called for the song to be removed from the film and public domain. Bengali singer Haimanti Shukla and Nazrul's granddaughter Anindita Kazi have also voiced their protest against the change in the song's tune. The controversy has caused social media outrage, with many questioning whether AR Rahman did sufficient research before altering the song.

item.title: Punjab govt to recruit over 1,400 police personnel
item.description: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has approved the recruitment of 1,450 additional police personnel in the state. The positions include 50 inspectors, 150 sub-inspectors, 500 assistant sub-inspectors, and 750 head constables. The aim is to involve youth in the socio-economic growth of the state and provide them with government job opportunities. The state government has already provided jobs to 37,683 youth in Punjab, completing the recruitment drive in just 18 months. This recruitment will help streamline the functioning of the police force at the district level.

item.title: J-K’s Kishtwar to soon emerge as north India’s power hub: Union minister Jitendra Singh
item.description: Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar region is set to become a major power hub in North India, generating around 6,000 MW of electricity after the completion of ongoing power projects, according to Union Minister Jitendra Singh. He visited remote areas of Kishtwar and inaugurated a new school in the village of Massu. Singh highlighted the significant hydropower projects in the region and emphasized that they would not only improve power supply but also provide opportunities for locals. He credited Prime Minister Narendra Modi for prioritizing neglected regions like Kishtwar. Singh also mentioned the improvement in road travel to Kishtwar and the development of infrastructure in the region.

item.title: Shiv Sena (UBT) ‘shakha’ razed: Those high on power will be taught a lesson, warns Uddhav
item.description: Uddhav Thackeray, the chief of the Shiv Sena, criticized the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena for destroying a local office controlled by the Shiv Sena. Thackeray, along with other Sena leaders, visited the site but faced resistance from workers of the CM's Shiv Sena. Thackeray condemned the destruction of the office and promised to retaliate in the elections. He also accused the administration of being helpless and stated that the Shiv Sena would continue to assemble at the site daily. Thackeray warned the administration and police that they would face consequences for protecting the "thieves" who destroyed the office. The report is auto-generated by the PTI news service.

The poet's family and singers are outraged by the "distortion" in rhythm and tunes. The song, titled 'Karar oi louho kopat' (Iron bars of a jail), was released in the war movie based on real-life events during the 1971 India-Pakistan War. Nazrul's family and singers are demanding that the song be removed from the film and public domain. The controversy has sparked outrage on social media, with netizens questioning Rahman's research. However, historian-researcher Chinmoy Guha criticized the outrage, stating that Bengalis rarely read Nazrul's works. AR Rahman has not yet commented on the controversy.

item.title: J-K’s Kishtwar to soon emerge as north India’s power hub: Union minister Jitendra Singh
item.description: The hill district of Kishtwar in Jammu and Kashmir is set to become a major power hub in North India with the generation of approximately 6,000 MW of electricity once ongoing power projects are completed, according to Union Minister Jitendra Singh. He visited Gulabgarh and inaugurated a new school for village children. Singh highlighted that several major hydropower projects have been developed in the region in recent years, including the Pakal Dul project with a capacity of 1,000 MW and the Kiru hydroelectric project with a capacity of 624 MW. These projects aim to improve the power supply in Jammu and Kashmir and provide economic opportunities for the local population. Singh also mentioned the development of infrastructure, such as roads, mobile towers, and a new airport in Kishtwar during the tenure of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

State ministers and priests will also be present at the event, which will include rituals and special pujas. The temple will remain open through the night on Sunday but will be closed on Monday and Tuesday. The puja rituals will be live-streamed on giant screens for devotees, and the use of only green crackers has been enforced by the police.

item.title: People of Rajasthan will vote for Bharat Jodo Yatra’s message: Congress
item.description: The Congress party is confident of winning the upcoming Rajasthan assembly polls. They believe that the people of the state will support their message of fighting inequality, unemployment, and political dictatorship by the Narendra Modi government. Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh expressed his confidence while reminiscing about the Bharat Jodo Yatra, a 485-km-long journey through Rajasthan in December last year. Ramesh stated that the yatra had a profound impact on the political fortunes of the Indian National Congress in Rajasthan and other parts of India. He further added that when the people of Rajasthan vote on November 25, the Congress will get the mandate again. They will vote for the message of the yatra and for the achievements of the Congress government led by Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot. The article also mentions that the 200-member Rajasthan assembly will go to polls on November 25, and the counting of votes will be on December 3.

item.title: Raja Kumari releases music video for her song ‘No Nazar’
item.description: Rapper Raja Kumari has released the music video for her song "No Nazar" from her own label Godmother Records. The song was written during a dark time in Kumari's life and is meant to protect listeners from the evil eye and negative energy. Kumari also recently collaborated with Sushmita Sen on the music video for "Sherni Aayi" from the show "Aarya 3." She expressed admiration for Sen's positivity and strength, and the song is a tribute to strong women facing challenges. Kumari previously gained recognition for her rap in Shah Rukh Khan's film "Jawan."

item.title: JP Nadda mourns demise of Telugu actor Chandra Mohan
item.description: Telugu actor Chandra Mohan has passed away at the age of 82 after suffering a cardiac arrest. Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) National President JP Nadda expressed his condolences on social media, praising the actor's versatile and charismatic performances throughout his career. Chandra Mohan, also known as Mallampalli Chandrasekhar Rao, entered the Telugu film industry in 1966 and went on to act in several notable films. The final rites will be held in Hyderabad on November 13.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.

item.description: Actor-director Prithviraj Sukumaran has unveiled the first poster of his upcoming film 'L2E: Empuraan', which is the sequel to the 2019 blockbuster film 'Lucifer'. The poster features Mohanlal, who starred in the first film, facing away from the camera with a gun in his hand and a helicopter in the background. The film will be released in multiple languages including Malayalam, Kannada, Tamil, Telugu, and Hindi. The official release date is yet to be announced. Prithviraj Sukumaran is also working on other projects, including the action thriller film 'Salaar' and 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan'. Mohanlal will also be seen in the Pan-India film 'Vrushabha'.

item.description: Three people were injured and one died from cardiac arrest in a fire at a shop in a three-storey building in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh. item.title: Punjab records over 100 farm fires; Haryana’s air quality at many places in ‘moderate’ category
item.description: Punjab reported 104 farm fires, bringing the total number of stubble-burning incidents to 23,730. This is a decrease from previous days. Stubble burning in Punjab and Haryana is a major cause of air pollution in Delhi. Only six cases of stubble burning were reported in Punjab on Friday due to rain. Sangrur district had the highest number of cases with 43, followed by Mansa with 22. The total number of farm fires this season is 42% less than last year. Air quality in Haryana and Punjab has improved and is now in the 'satisfactory' and 'moderate' categories.

item.description: A 61-year-old man named Zafar Hussain died of a snakebite in Malad, Mumbai. He had come to his relative's home in Raheja locality for shopping for his son's wedding. Hussain was bitten by a cobra in the bathroom and was taken to a nearby hospital where he died during treatment. A snake rescuer removed the snake, and an accidental death report has been registered.Hmm, I am not sure. item.title: Morning walker attacked with cricket bat in Latur; two booked
item.description: A 53-year-old woman and her son were violently attacked with a cricket bat by a couple in Latur city, Maharashtra. The incident occurred in the Shrinivas Nagar area, and the police have registered a case against the couple named Gopal and Sapna Darak based on a complaint. The woman, Sangeeta Rajkumar Bhosle, was out on a morning walk when the couple intercepted her and assaulted her. Her son, who was nearby, also tried to intervene and was also beaten up. The attack lasted for about 30 minutes, resulting in serious injuries for the woman. No arrests have been made so far.

item.title: Turbulent winters are coming. Blame El Niño and global warming combo
item.description: According to a new forecast from the US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), the climate pattern known as "El Niño" is predicted to intensify over the winter, potentially leading to a winter of extreme weather, particularly in the US. El Niño refers to a rise in sea surface temperatures in the tropical eastern Pacific, which results in warmer-than-average weather globally. After three years of a cooling phase called La Niña, El Niño is returning at a time when the world is already experiencing high temperatures due to climate change. As a result, NOAA predicts warmer-than-average temperatures in wide areas of the US, along with above-average rainfall in some southern states. El Niño's impact extends beyond the Americas, with potential hotter and drier weather in areas like Australia and Indonesia, and increased hurricane activity in the Pacific Ocean. Studies suggest that global warming may lead to stronger El Niño phases, and climate-related risks are a top concern for risk experts. Mitigating and adapting to climate change is seen as the most pressing issue of the next decade.

item.title: IPL contract will be next level for Netherlands players after WC show: Coach Ryan Cook
item.description: The coach of the Netherlands cricket team, Ryan Cook, is hopeful that some of his players have caught the attention of IPL franchises ahead of this year's auction. The Netherlands has performed well in the World Cup, securing memorable wins against South Africa and Bangladesh. Cook believes that participation in the IPL would be a significant step up for his players and that the experience gained would be valuable. He pointed out the quality and availability of Dutch players as reasons for IPL teams to consider them. Cook acknowledged that the lack of cricket to play after their World Cup qualification has affected their preparation for the tournament. Despite this, he expressed excitement about facing India, stating that they are a strong team. Cook also spoke positively about the time his team spent in Bengaluru for warm-up matches.

item.title: Death toll in Haryana’s spurious liquor case climbs to 18
item.description: A suspected case of poisoning due to the consumption of spurious liquor has claimed the lives of 18 people in Haryana, with six more deaths reported recently. Previous reports indicated that 10 people had already died in Yamunanagar, and two in Ambala. In response to the incident, Yamunanagar police have arrested seven individuals and plan to arrest more based on the information they have gathered. The police have also been informing villagers about the incident and warning against consuming liquor of unknown origin. Opposition parties have criticized the government for its failure to address problems related to spurious liquor. The deaths have occurred in various villages in Yamunanagar, prompting the police to establish a special investigation team. The cabinet minister has assured strict action against those responsible, and the police investigation is ongoing.

item.title: Haze over Kolkata as pollution levels rise ahead of Kali Puja
item.description: The air quality in Kolkata has deteriorated, with the Air Quality Index (AQI) ranging from poor to very poor. The burning of crop residues in neighboring districts and the use of firecrackers during Kali Puja celebrations have worsened the situation. The AQI at various locations in the city was recorded as very poor or poor. Environmentalists warn that the pollution could cause respiratory problems and recommend sprinkling water on plants in the evening to reduce the pollution's effects. Illegal fireworks are expected to further worsen air pollution in the coming days.

item.title: Tribal activists threaten self-immolation if Sarna is not declared a religion during PM’s Nov 15 visit
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Tribal activists in Jamshedpur, Jharkhand, are demanding recognition of Sarna as a separate religion and have threatened to immolate themselves if Prime Minister Narendra Modi doesn't make an announcement regarding it during his visit on November 15. They will also observe a fast in support of their demand. The activists are part of the Adivasi Sengel Abhiyan (ASA) group, and its president, Salkhan Murmu, stated that the decision to immolate was made independently by two ASA members. The activists are expecting the Prime Minister to address their demand for the recognition of a separate 'Sarna' religion and will carry out immolations at 4 pm at Ulihatu and Bokaro if their demand is not met. ASA leaders from Assam, Bengal, and Jharkhand have decided to hold a rail and road blockade on December 30 to support their cause. Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren has stated that the decision to recognize the 'Sarna' religion is pending with the center. Soren has previously requested the recognition of the 'Sarna' code for tribals, asserting that their population in the region has decreased over the years.

item.title: Can taking salt off the table help prevent diabetes? It’s not that simple
item.description: A new study from Tulane University in New Orleans suggests that salt consumption may be linked to an increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes. However, the study is an observational study and cannot prove causation, only association. The data used to assess salt intake was based on a simple question, making it difficult to accurately estimate the amount of salt associated with an increased risk. Most salt intake comes from processed foods rather than added at the table. The study also found a weak association between salt consumption and the risk of developing type 2 diabetes, but did not provide specific recommendations for reducing salt intake. The key takeaway is that maintaining a healthy weight, being physically active, and eating a healthy diet are known to reduce the risk of type 2 diabetes.

item.title: Diwali eve rush slows down traffic on Delhi roads
item.description: Massive traffic jams were reported in several parts of New Delhi, including Ghazipur and Nangloi, on the eve of Diwali as people crowded the markets. There were long delays on the Ghazipur border towards Ghaziabad, with commuters stuck for hours. Some users on social media claimed that sellers illegally encroached on the road, causing a traffic jam. People also complained of congestion in other areas such as Nangloi and the GT Road. The heavy traffic was exacerbated by intermittent rain showers. The Delhi police had issued an advisory asking commuters to use public transport to avoid inconvenience and reduce pollution.

item.title: UAE Embassy, Cyprus National Library organise cultural initiative
item.description: The UAE Embassy in Nicosia, in collaboration with the Cyprus National Library, has initiated a program to promote cultural cooperation between the national libraries of the UAE and Cyprus. The UAE Ambassador to Cyprus, Mohammed Saif Al Shehhi, praised the strong bilateral ties between the two countries, particularly in the cultural realm, and expressed a desire for increased cooperation and coordination. The "Exchange of Books" initiative aims to strengthen cultural ties between the UAE and Cyprus and encourage collaboration in various sectors. Both sides emphasized the importance of culture in bringing people and nations closer together, as well as the significance of mutual historical and cultural understanding. The initiative includes discussions on methods to enhance cultural cooperation and establish joint coordination between national libraries.

item.title: Three foreign tourists killed in Dal Lake blaze in Kashmir
item.description: I'm sorry to hear about the tragic incident involving the fire on the houseboat in Dal Lake. Three foreign tourists, believed to be from Bangladesh, lost their lives in the blaze. The cause of the fire is still under investigation, but it is suspected to have started due to a malfunctioning heating appliance. The bodies of the victims were retrieved from the debris and their identities will be established through DNA samples. The fire resulted in significant damage to the houseboats and huts attached to them. Efforts were made to control the blaze, and authorities have assured support in rebuilding the damaged houseboats. It is indeed a great loss to the heritage houseboat population.

item.title: CM Adityanath pulls chariot to mark symbolic return of Lord Ram to Ayodhya
item.description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and Governor Anandiben Patel participated in a procession that depicted the return of Lord Ram, Sita, and Lakshman to Ayodhya after 14 years of exile. Flowers were showered on them from a helicopter. Lord Ram's brothers Bharat and Shatrughan welcomed them, and they proceeded towards the venue of Ramkatha Park. The governor and chief minister performed the aarti and the symbolic coronation of Lord Ram. They also released a coffee table book on the Deepotsav festival of Ayodhya. This festival has been organized for the seventh time, with last year's event being attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. In 2022, a Guinness World Record was set with 15.76 lakh lamps being lit at Ram ki Pauri in Ayodhya.

item.title: Mubadala Health kicks off two-day Diabetes Conference in Abu Dhabi
item.description: The Mubadala Health Diabetes Conference was successfully launched by Imperial College London Diabetes Centre and HealthPlus Diabetes and Endocrinology Center. The conference brought together global experts to address critical issues in diabetes management. On the first day, renowned medical experts shared the latest advancements in diabetes care through talks and panel discussions. The conference emphasized collaboration and innovation in driving progress. Topics covered included diabetes guidelines, blood sugar management, complications, prevention and treatment, gestational diabetes, and care for patients of all ages. Workshops focused on cases from the diabetes type 1 clinic, diabetes type 2 clinic, and obesity and lipid clinic. The conference aims to unite healthcare practitioners in the fight against diabetes and promote knowledge sharing and research. (Please stay in character!)

item.title: HC stays termination of seven teachers by Jalna school
item.description: The Aurangabad bench of the Bombay High Court has granted relief to seven teachers who were terminated by the management of an English medium school in Jalna. The teachers, with service periods ranging from six to 26 years, had filed a writ petition over their low and irregular salaries and termination. They claimed to have received temporary appointment orders annually, but were terminated without notice or cause. The court stayed the termination order, directed the school to deposit outstanding salaries, and instructed the education department to collect information about the school's functioning. The school management was asked to submit a reply by December 6.

item.title: Taliban embassy in Qatar raises concerns over Afghan refugees’ forced deportation by Pakistan
item.description: The Taliban's Embassy in Qatar has expressed concerns about the forced deportation of Afghan refugees from Pakistan in a memorandum addressed to diplomatic and international organizations. The memo, obtained by Khaama Press, criticizes Pakistan for its mistreatment and inadequate handling of Afghan refugees during the deportation process. It highlights that Pakistan made the decision to deport Afghan refugees without consulting the Afghan government, leading to a humanitarian crisis. The Afghan Embassy in Qatar calls for Pakistan to be held accountable for the consequences of its actions and to collaborate with Afghanistan in finding solutions to the crisis. The statement also raises concerns about the well-being and rights of Afghan nationals facing harsh conditions and mistreatment during repatriation. The mass deportation of Afghan nationals poses significant challenges for Afghanistan, which must reintegrate these individuals into society and provide essential services. The Afghan government seeks international support and attention for the issue, aiming to uphold the rights and dignity of its citizens. The report emphasizes the need for cooperation, diplomacy, and international engagement to address the deportation crisis and ensure the well-being of Afghan refugees.

item.title: Pakistan seeks USD600 million from Chinese banks amid IMF bailout negotiations
item.description: Pakistan has formally requested fresh loans amounting to USD 600 million from two Chinese banks, as part of its ongoing negotiations with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for a USD 3 billion bailout package. The Pakistani government is in discussions with the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) and the Bank of China, seeking a combined loan of USD 600 million. China has been a crucial source of financial support for Pakistan, providing various forms of assistance. These loans are important for Pakistan's low credit ratings and fragile macroeconomic situation, which have made it challenging to secure financing. Successful completion of the negotiations is expected to have a positive impact on Pakistan's credit ratings and access to capital markets. Under the terms of the IMF bailout deal, Pakistan has committed to adopting a market-based exchange rate regime.

item.title: Delhi HC asks city government to respond to widow’s plea for ex-gratia after husband’s death due to COVID-19
item.description: The Delhi High Court has asked the city government and Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) to respond to a plea by the wife of a COVID-19 warrior seeking the release of an ex-gratia of Rs 1 crore. The petitioner's husband, who was employed with the civic body, died after contracting the disease while performing duties during the pandemic. The court has listed the matter for further hearing in January 2024. The Delhi government had previously announced an ex-gratia of Rs 1 crore for the families of frontline COVID-19 warriors who died in the line of duty. The petitioner claims that her husband, who was a permanent employee of the East Delhi Municipal Corporation, is eligible for the compensation. She has received a compensation of Rs 10 lakh from the EDMC but is yet to receive the promised ex-gratia amount from the Delhi government. The plea seeks a direction to the Delhi government to release the money.

item.title: Deepfake video: Delhi Police writes to Meta for URL
item.description: The Delhi Police has contacted Meta, the parent company of Facebook, requesting the URL of the account responsible for sharing a 'deepfake' video of actress Rashmika Mandanna on social media. The police have also sought information about the individuals who shared the fake video. An FIR has been registered under forgery and IT Act sections after a complaint from the Delhi Commission for Women. A dedicated team is working on the case, with hopes of solving it soon. The deepfake video, suspected to be made with artificial intelligence, went viral last week, featuring Mandanna's face edited onto that of a British-Indian influencer.

item.title: 45-year-old woman trampled to death by wild elephant in Odisha’s Kalahandi
item.description: A 45-year-old woman in Odisha's Kalahandi district was killed by an elephant while she was going to a nearby stream to wash clothes. The elephant chased her and trampled her to death. The woman's body was sent for post-mortem examination and her family will receive financial assistance.A 45-year-old woman was killed by an elephant in Odisha's Kalahandi district. item.title: BJP promises LPG cylinder at Rs 450, free education, higher MSP in its manifesto for Madhya Pradesh polls
item.description: The ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in Madhya Pradesh has released its manifesto for the upcoming assembly elections. The manifesto includes promises such as providing cooking gas cylinders at a reduced price for beneficiaries of certain schemes, free education up to post-graduation level for girls from poor families, higher minimum support prices for wheat and paddy, houses for beneficiaries of the Ladli Behna scheme, and free education up to Class 12 for poor students. Other promises include the continuation of farmer welfare schemes, the establishment of technological and medical institutes, the construction of expressways, empowerment of tribal communities, and various other development initiatives. The BJP claims that its manifesto reflects the aspirations of the people and that it has a track record of implementing its promises.

item.title: PM Modi condoles death of noted Telugu actor Chandra Mohan
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his sorrow over the passing of renowned Telugu actor Chandra Mohan. He praised Mohan for his powerful performances and unique charisma that captivated audiences for generations. Modi acknowledged the void left by Mohan's departure in the creative world and extended his condolences to his family and numerous admirers. Chandra Mohan, aged 82, had a successful career spanning over five decades and was admitted to a private hospital after being unresponsive for about 20 minutes.Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed sorrow over the death of renowned Telugu actor Chandra Mohan. item.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan’s wife may be arrested in a corruption case: Report
item.description: Bushra Bibi, the wife of former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan, may face serious trouble, including potential imprisonment, in an alleged corruption case, according to a media report. The National Accountability Bureau (NAB) is examining evidence related to financial transactions that Bibi allegedly received. If confirmed, this evidence could change her status from a witness to an accused individual, and she may also be arrested. The NAB is also accelerating its investigation into Khan's alleged corruption cases. Bibi and her close aide, Farah Shahzadi, have been summoned by the NAB in connection with the Al-Qadir Trust corruption case. Recent reports have alleged corruption by Shahzadi, linking her to Khan and Bibi. These developments could pose additional problems for Khan, who served as prime minister from August 2018 to April 2022.
