item.title: Ananya Panday, Aditya Roy Kapur pose with Katrina-Vicky at Diwali party, see pic
item.description: Rumored Bollywood couple Aditya Roy Kapur and Ananya Panday attended producer Amritpal Singh's Diwali bash in Mumbai, along with other celebrities like Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal, Madhuri Dixit Nene, and designer Manish Malhotra. Pictures and videos from the event went viral, and Madhuri Dixit shared some photos on Instagram, expressing her enjoyment at the party. The pictures showed Ananya and Aditya posing with Katrina and Vicky, Madhuri with Karan Johar, and Madhuri with Kiara Advani, Sidharth Malhotra, Sanjay Kapoor, and Bhumi Pednekar. Ananya and Aditya have been rumored to be dating since last year when they appeared together at another Diwali party, but neither has confirmed the reports. They also recently visited the Maldives to celebrate Ananya's 25th birthday.

item.title: Kerala farmer ends life allegedly due to financial crisis; Governor, opposition criticise govt
item.description: A farmer in Alappuzha district, Kerala, allegedly died by suicide due to financial problems related to unpaid paddy procurement. The farmer, K G Prasad, left a suicide note blaming the state government and some banks for his extreme step. This incident has sparked a political controversy in Kerala. The opposition party leader, V D Satheesan, criticized the government for its failure in paddy procurement and delayed payments to farmers. While the police are yet to confirm the exact reason behind the farmer's suicide, friends and other farmers claim that Prasad took his own life because he didn't receive payment from the government for the paddy he had procured. The farmer's alleged suicide note accused the government and banks of being responsible for his death. A video call made by Prasad before his death was also broadcasted, where he expressed his frustration over banks denying him a loan due to a low credit score. Farmers have expressed grievances over the government's handling of the situation and lack of support for their financial struggles. Governor Arif Muhammed Khan expressed his condolences to Prasad's family and acknowledged the crisis faced by farmers in the state. The opposition parties, Congress and BJP, blamed the ruling Left Democratic Front (LDF) government for neglecting farmers' issues. The state government defended itself, stating that PRS arrears were not the reason for the farmer's suicide, and money had been paid for the rice procured from farmers.

item.title: Pakistan: Yet another senior leader from Imran Khan’s party resigns
item.description: A former secretary general of Imran Khan's party, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), has resigned from the party's basic membership. Asad Umar stated that he disagreed with the policy of confrontation with state institutions and believed it was not in the country's interest. Umar joins a list of senior party leaders who have left politics after the violent protests on May 9, following Imran Khan's arrest on corruption charges. Umar had been arrested but released on bail after promising not to participate in violent protests. Several party leaders have also deserted Khan and his party, forming factions with similar names. The PTI has experienced a decline in popularity since the events of May 9, with leaders often going through a pattern of arrest, condemnation of violence, and resignation from the party or politics altogether.

item.title: Iceland evacuates people amid volcanic threat, declares state of emergency
item.description: Iceland has declared a state of emergency due to an increased risk of a volcanic eruption in the coastal town of Grindavik. The authorities have urged residents to evacuate calmly as a precautionary measure. The Icelandic Meteorological Office has recorded nearly 800 earthquakes in the southwest of the country, indicating the possibility of an eruption. However, there are currently no signs that the magma is nearing the surface. The situation is being closely monitored, and residents have been advised to follow the instructions of Icelandic authorities. The Blue Lagoon thermal pool in the affected area has already closed due to the ongoing seismic activity. Iceland, known for its tectonic plate boundary, is home to 32 active volcanoes.

item.title: Demonetisation ‘biggest corruption’ in world: Akhilesh Yadav
item.description: Samajwadi Party Chief Akhilesh Yadav criticized demonetization by calling it the "biggest corruption" in the world. He accused the BJP government of using demonetization as a strategy to compensate for the country's loss of Rs 15 lakh crore, stating that the decision benefited the rich at the expense of the poor. Yadav also highlighted that corruption, inflation, and unemployment continue to plague the country despite the government's claims that demonetization would address these issues. Furthermore, he expressed support for women employees working in the dial 112 response system and criticized the BJP government for not fulfilling its promise to increase their salaries. Yadav also criticized the BJP for ruining the dial 100 police service and accused it of promoting corruption in every police station. He mentioned an incident in Deoria and expressed dissatisfaction with the Agniveer scheme, promising to end it and provide full employment in the army. The article also mentioned the celebration of a baby called "Khajanchi," whose birth during demonetization Yadav used to criticize the BJP.

Murmu highlighted that people of different religions and faiths celebrate this festival, spreading love, brotherhood, and harmony. She expressed that Diwali illuminates our conscience and inspires us to work for the welfare of humanity. Murmu urged everyone to celebrate the festival safely and contribute to environmental conservation for nation-building. In her message, she extended warm greetings and best wishes to all fellow citizens in India and abroad.

item.title: Human rights group accuses Pakistan of using Afghan refugees as ‘political pawns’
item.description: Amnesty International has called on the Government of Pakistan to stop the detention, deportation, and alleged harassment of Afghan refugees. The human rights group expressed concern for the safety of Afghan refugees returning to Taliban-ruled Afghanistan, citing reports of harassment in holding centers and instances where legal migrants with proper documentation were targeted. Amnesty warned that continued deportations would deny at-risk Afghans, especially women and girls, access to safety, education, and livelihood. The international community has been reluctant to recognize the Taliban-led government in Afghanistan due to allegations of human rights violations. Pakistan has linked the increase in terrorist incidents to the Taliban's return to power and their failure to take action against militants using Afghan soil for attacks in Pakistan. The Doha Accord, which facilitated the US exit from Afghanistan, included assurances from the Taliban that Afghan soil would not be used for terrorism against any country, including Pakistan.

item.title: South African cricketer Keshav Maharaj extends support to World Hindu Congress
item.description: South African cricketer Keshav Maharaj has expressed his support for the upcoming three-day World Hindu Congress (WHC)-2023, which will be taking place in Bangkok from November 24. Despite his inability to attend due to World Cup commitments, Maharaj extended his best wishes to the event and hoped it would be a successful gathering. The WHC-2023, organized by the World Hindu Foundation, is expected to host delegates from over 60 countries. This conference includes various parallel conferences, such as the Hindu Youth Conference, which aims to empower young Hindu leaders and promote positive change. Prominent figures like RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath are scheduled to address the WHC-2023.

item.title: Diwali 2023: A look at popular Hindi cinema scenes depicting festival of lights
item.description: This article highlights five popular scenes from Hindi cinema that have incorporated the festival of Diwali into their narratives. The first scene is from the movie "Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham" (2001), where Jaya Bachchan's character senses the arrival of her son Rahul, played by Shah Rukh Khan, on Diwali. The second scene is from the film "Vaastav" (1999), featuring Sanjay Dutt's character coming out of his hide-out to meet his family during Diwali. In the movie "Zanjeer" (1973), the festival plays an important part as the protagonist, played by Amitabh Bachchan, seeks justice for his parents' murder on Diwali. The popular track "Dhik Tana" in "Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!" (1994) also includes a brief scene set during Diwali, capturing the essence of the festival and celebrating togetherness. Lastly, the film "Chachi 420" (1997) showcases a pivotal scene emphasizing the importance of safety during Diwali, where Kamal Haasan's character saves his daughter from a firecracker mishap.

item.title: To check air pollution, Bihar to ‘name and shame’ farmers who burn crop residue
item.description: The Bihar government plans to publicly name and shame farmers who burn crop residue, in an effort to combat rising air pollution. The names of such farmers will be displayed at block offices, and action will be taken against them under relevant laws. The state government has banned crop residue burning to protect soil fertility and issued a warning that financial assistance and subsidies will be denied to those who practice it. The decisions were made during a meeting chaired by the Chief Secretary, with the aim of discouraging farmers from harming the environment. The government has also conducted awareness campaigns and provided subsidies for farm equipment. The issue of poor air quality, particularly during winter, has been a concern in several cities in Bihar. In April, numerous farmers were penalized for violating norms related to crop residue burning.

item.title: 80 Indian fishermen released by Pak govt handed over to BSF at Wagah border
item.description: Eighty Indian fishermen who were recently released from a jail in Pakistan have been handed over to BSF authorities at the Attari-Wagah border. The prisoners crossed over to India on Friday night through the land transit route of the Attari-Wagah border. The fishermen were held three years ago after their boats slipped into Pakistan through territorial waters in the Arabian Sea. Fishermen are frequently arrested along with their boats by both India and Pakistan due to the poorly defined maritime border in the Arabian Sea.

item.title: Pakistan leader Asad Umar quits Imran Khan’s party, quits politics
item.description: Asad Umar, the former secretary general of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), has announced his resignation from the party's basic membership and his decision to quit politics altogether. Umar, who was a close aide of PTI Chairman Imran Khan, cited his disagreement with the party's policy of confrontation with state institutions as the reason for his resignation. This comes after a nationwide crackdown on the PTI and the arrest of several party leaders following riots on May 9. Umar thanked his supporters and expressed his desire for Allah's blessings upon Pakistan.

item.title: Israel-Hamas war: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi arrives in Saudi Arabia to attend OIC Summit
item.description: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi arrived in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, to attend the Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) summit, which aimed to discuss the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas. Raisi was seen wearing a traditional Palestinian keffiyeh scarf and greeted Saudi officials upon his arrival. Other leaders attending the summit include Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, the President of Libya’s Presidential Council Mohamed Al-Manfi, Pakistan’s caretaker prime minister Anwarul Haq Kakar, and Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim. The Iranian Foreign Ministry sent a team of experts to assess a document on the Gaza crisis that will be released at the summit. Earlier, Raisi and Erdogan held talks on the Gaza crisis during the 16th Summit of the Economic Cooperation Organisation. They emphasized the need to halt Israeli bombardment in Gaza and expressed concern over the crimes committed by Israel against Palestinians. Iran's Foreign Minister also wrote letters to BRICS countries urging them to intervene and stop the attacks in Gaza.

item.title: Ram Charan- Kiara Advani’s ‘Game Changer’ first single ‘Jaragandi’ release date pushed
item.description: The release date for the first track of the upcoming film "Game Changer," starring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, has been postponed due to audio documentation issues between different firms. The makers of the film issued a statement on X (formerly Twitter) announcing the delay and assuring fans that the wait will be worth it. The song was originally scheduled to be released on Diwali 2023. The film, directed by Shankar, is an action drama with current-day politics and will be released in Telugu, Tamil, and Hindi languages. The official release date for the film is still unknown.

item.title: Equity 360 facilitates Bharat Housing Network with 125 Crores in Series A Funding
item.description:
Bharat Housing Network, a technology platform for co-lending in affordable housing, has raised INR 125 crores in funding. The investment was led by NABVENTURES Fund, with participation from other investors such as Varanium NexGen Fund, 9Unicorns, Riverwalk Holdings, SMK Ventures, DMI Sparkle Fund, LC Nueva, and more. This is the seventh investment announced by NABVENTURES Fund in 2023.
Bharat Housing Network is India's largest co-lending infrastructure for credit delivery in the affordable mortgages-priority sector. The platform provides capital, technology, and infrastructure to housing finance companies and non-banking finance companies. It operates on a hybrid capital model for growth and scale.
The demand for housing finance in India is expected to grow significantly due to the country's growing population, rising household incomes, and declining average household size. The industry is projected to grow at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 13-14% in the long run, with home loan originations reaching INR 10.4 trillion by FY25 and INR 18.7 trillion by FY30. The co-lending platform aims to address this demand, with a focus on the <INR 2.5 million ticket size category.
The platform's integrated technology stack offers a complete co-lending solution to lenders in the affordable housing finance segment. It has onboarded 23 financial institutions and leverages partner branch networks across 12 states. Since its inception in 2021, the platform has achieved significant growth while maintaining high asset quality.
Bharat Housing Network is enabling financial inclusion by providing credit to semi-urban and rural areas. It focuses on delivering housing credit to low-income and economically weaker sections of society, contributing to 13 UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
The investment by NABVENTURES Fund aligns with the government's initiatives, such as PM Awaas Yojana, to encourage low-cost housing and affordable loans. The CEO of NABVENTURES Fund highlighted the importance of affordable housing and their intention to invest in at least nine startups by the year-end.
The founder of Equity 360 expressed confidence in Bharat Housing Network's ability to contribute to the "Housing for All" vision of New India. The platform aims to make housing credit more accessible and affordable across income groups.
Please note that this summary is generated by an AI model and may not be completely accurate.

item.title: Exclusive-UAE plans to maintain ties with Israel despite Gaza outcry, sources say
item.description: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) plans to maintain its diplomatic ties with Israel despite the international outcry over the war in Gaza. The UAE aims to have a moderating influence on Israel's campaign while safeguarding its own interests, according to sources familiar with UAE government policy. Abu Dhabi became the most prominent Arab nation to establish diplomatic ties with Israel in 30 years under the U.S.-brokered Abraham Accords in 2020. The mounting death toll in Gaza has stirred outrage in Arab capitals, but the UAE has publicly condemned Israel's actions and called for an end to the violence. The UAE is also working to moderate the public positions of other Arab states to facilitate a return to dialogue once the war ends. The UAE continues to host an Israeli ambassador and has no plans to sever diplomatic ties. The UAE's motivation for establishing ties with Israel includes shared concerns over Iran and economic-driven realignment of foreign policy. Despite their close ties, Abu Dhabi has been concerned about Israel's right-wing government's expansion of Jewish settlements in the West Bank and visits to the Al Aqsa mosque compound. The displacement of Palestinians from Gaza or the West Bank into Egypt or Jordan is seen as a red line for Abu Dhabi. The UAE has distanced itself from Hamas, viewing them as a threat to regional stability. They have played a significant role in opposing the Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt and Sudan.

item.title: Japan-led navy exercise starts with Philippines observing for first time
item.description: Japan has started a joint annual military exercise called Annualex, with the Philippines observing the operations for the first time. The exercise involves the naval forces of the United States, Australia, and Canada, with the Philippines attending as an observer. The goal is to seek closer maritime cooperation between Japan and the Philippines. The exercise is not being conducted to target a specific country, but rather to enhance security cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region. The operations will last for 10 days and involve 30 ships and 40 aircraft. This comes as Japan, the US, and the Philippines aim to strengthen ties and deepen security cooperation to counter China. Last week, Japan announced it would provide radar systems to the Philippines, and the two countries also started negotiations for a reciprocal military access agreement.

Strickland of Tyler, Texas, who was known for being a critic of the pope among conservative U.S. Catholics. item.title: Mexico’s Acapulco hit by garbage pile-up after deadly hurricane
item.description: Residents of Acapulco are facing an additional issue following Hurricane Otis: piles of garbage in the streets. The hurricane, which struck on October 25th, caused major flooding and destroyed many homes in the city. As a result, furnishings, bedding, and household appliances are being discarded outside homes along with bags of rotting organic waste, causing foul odors and concerns about disease. The government has deployed troops to help clean up the city, but the rubbish is accumulating rapidly. Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has stated that clearing up Acapulco is a top priority and measures are being taken to prevent disease. However, experts warn that if waste blocks drainage and contaminates the water supply, there is a risk of mosquito-borne illnesses such as dengue and yellow fever outbreaks.

item.title: J’khand: Teachers ghearo JMM office demanding pay fixation
item.description: Hundreds of teachers in Jharkhand gheraoed the central office of the ruling JMM in Ranchi, demanding pay fixation. These teachers, who have qualified the Jharkhand Teacher's Eligibility Test (JTET), claim that their pay scales have not been fixed despite passing the examination. They have been staging a demonstration near Raj Bhavan for the past 81 days. They threatened to intensify the protest if their demands were not considered appropriately. The government had recommended providing a pay scale to the teachers during a high-level meeting in June 2020. JMM Central General Secretary Vinod Kumar Pandey has assured the teachers that their demand will be taken to the government.

item.title: Falguni Shah, the singer who took Modi’s millet song to Grammys grew up on RD Burman, Beatles
item.description: Indian-American singer-songwriter couple Falguni and Gaurav Shah have gained recognition at the Grammys with their song "The Abundance in Millets" featuring Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The song, which promotes food security, includes a portion of Modi's speech at the Global Millets Conference. Falguni and Gaurav are established in the international music scene, having worked with A.R. Rahman and Yo Yo Ma. Falguni has performed at prestigious venues and collaborated with artists like Ricky Martin and Wyclef Jean. Last year, her album "A Colorful World" won a Grammy for Best Children's Album. This year's nomination is a surprise for the Shahs, who expressed gratitude to PM Modi for his involvement. The article also mentions other notable Indian Grammy winners and nominees, as well as the public's reactions to Modi's nomination. Overall, it highlights the significance of this nomination in promoting India's indigenous crop and the pride associated with it.

item.title: Rajasthan Mahila Kalyan Mandal Wins Special Jury Award for Martha Farrell Award for Gender Equality
item.description: The Rajasthan Mahila Kalyan Mandal (RMKM), a non-profit organization, has been awarded the Martha Farrell Award for Gender Equality. RMKM focuses on empowering underprivileged women in Rajasthan and promoting gender equality in the region. The organization addresses the challenges faced by women in rural areas, including limited access to resources and employment opportunities. Their programs include inclusive education, health education, capacity-building, and microcredit initiatives. Notable initiatives include the "gift-a-goat program" to provide sustainable income and nutrition, and the "livelihood enhancement through self-help groups" program, which has benefited thousands of marginalized women. RMKM's work aims to challenge social practices and traditions to create a more equitable society. The organization is grateful for the recognition and remains committed to its efforts in promoting gender equality and inclusivity.

item.title: Vigilance Minister initiates inquiry against Delhi chief secy in Bamnoli land acquisition case
item.description: Delhi Vigilance Minister Atishi has initiated an inquiry into a complaint against Chief Secretary Naresh Kumar. The complaint alleges that the chief secretary's son was employed by a relative of a landowner who received enhanced compensation for land acquired for a road project. Atishi has directed the divisional commissioner and vigilance director to provide all the files related to the land acquisition. The chief secretary claims that the complaint is an act of "mudslinging" by disgruntled individuals facing vigilance investigations. Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has requested a detailed report on the matter. The complaint involves the acquisition of land in Bamnoli village for the Dwarka Expressway. The District Magistrate and the Additional District Magistrate had differing valuations for the land, resulting in a significant increase in compensation. Hemant Kumar, who awarded the increased compensation, was suspended by the Ministry of Home Affairs and a CBI probe was ordered. The involvement of the chief secretary is now being examined.

item.title: Major terror bid foiled in Pakistan’s Punjab province; 5 TTP, LeJ terrorists arrested
item.description: Pakistani counter-terrorism officials have claimed to have foiled a major terror plot targeting key installations in Punjab province. The Counter Terrorism Department (CTD) of the Punjab police conducted 179 intelligence-based operations across various districts, resulting in the arrest of five suspected terrorists from banned outfits. The arrested individuals were linked to the Tehreek-e-Taliban (TTP) and Lashkar-e-Jhangvi (LeJ) militant groups. The militants had planned sabotage across the province and aimed to target important installations. During the operations, half a kg of explosives, two hand grenades, two IED bombs, detonators, safety fuse wire, prima cards, and banned literature were recovered. The suspects have been registered under five cases and taken to an undisclosed location for interrogation.

item.title: Will take over Sena ‘shakhas’ where illegal activities are being carried out, says Shinde faction leader
item.description: The Shiv Sena party, led by Eknath Shinde, has announced its intention to take control of all former branches, known as 'shakhas,' that have been engaged in inappropriate activities. The party recently took over and demolished a shakha in Mumbra, which led to tensions with members of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena. Thackeray is expected to visit the area later in the day under police protection to prevent any potential fallout from this issue. Naresh Mhaske, a member of the Shiv Sena, claimed that Thackeray's visit was influenced by NCP leader Jitendra Awhad, pointing out that posters welcoming Thackeray did not feature images of Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray or Anand Dighe.

item.title: Raigad pharma factory fire: Victims’ bodies handed over to kin after DNA test
item.description: The bodies of 11 individuals who died in a recent factory fire in Maharashtra's Raigad district have been handed over to their families. The victims' identities were determined through DNA tests due to the severe charring of the bodies. The pharmaceutical company, Blue Jet Healthcare, has declared a payout of Rs 30 lakh for each victim's family. The bodies were given to the families on Friday and taken to their respective hometowns for final rites. The fire, which occurred on November 3 at the company's plant in Mahad MIDC, resulted in 11 fatalities and seven injuries. An initial investigation indicated that an electric short circuit was the cause. A senior official from the pharmaceutical company has been booked for alleged culpable homicide. One employee responsible for plant maintenance has been arrested, while two others have been named in the case. The incident has led to a complaint being filed under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code.

item.title: NIA files supplementary charge-sheet in KTF recruitment, arms smuggling case
item.description: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has filed a supplementary charge-sheet against four individuals in the Khalistan Tiger Force recruitment and arms smuggling case. The charge-sheet was filed against Amritpal Singh, Amrik Singh, Jassa Singh, and Gagandeep Singh. The NIA had previously filed a charge-sheet against nine other accused persons in the case. The investigation is focused on the involvement of the Khalistan Tiger Force and their associates in a terror conspiracy. The accused individuals were recruited and indoctrinated by a Canada-based terrorist, and they were involved in recruiting youngsters, smuggling arms and explosives, and carrying out extortion for terrorist activities. The investigation has also revealed the systematic channeling of extortion funds to foreign countries to fuel terrorist activities in India. The NIA has found that KTF operatives based abroad were involved in recruitment, handling of associates, and smuggling of arms and explosives into India.

These reports were submitted by Brij Lal, Rajya Sabha MP and Chairman of the Department-Related Parliamentary Standing Committee on Home Affairs. These bills aim to replace the Indian Penal Code (IPC) 1860, the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) 1973, and the Indian Evidence Act, 1872. Home Minister Amit Shah stated that the objective of these new laws is to protect the rights given by the constitution to Indian citizens, rather than punishing individuals. The Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita bill will have 533 sections, the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita bill will have 356 sections, and the Bharatiya Sakshya bill will have 170 sections.

item.title: Veena Developers Announces Multi-Million Investment in High-End Mumbai Projects
item.description: Veena Developers, a prominent real estate firm in Mumbai, has announced plans for three high-end real estate projects in the city. The projects will be located in Kandivali, Borivali, and Andheri, with a total sale area of 1.4 million square feet and a construction area of nearly 4 million square feet. The company expects these projects to generate revenue of approximately Rs 3500 crore. Veena Developers aims to provide sophisticated and comfortable living spaces that cater to the luxury and semi-luxury segments. They plan to allocate 80% of the projects to luxury residential spaces and the remaining 20% to high-end retail spaces. The company is set to complete these developments before 2027. In addition to the upcoming projects, Veena Developers is also delivering five million square feet across various ongoing projects. The Chairman of Veena Developers, Haresh Sanghavi, highlighted their focus on offering exclusive living experiences that depict elegance. The company has a strong presence in key areas of Mumbai, including Kandivali, Andheri, Malad, Chembur, and Santacruz, with a diverse portfolio of luxury and semi-luxury residential developments. They are also involved in commercial projects in Malad-West and affordable housing options in Palghar. Veena Developers has observed a surge in interest, particularly in their luxury offerings, indicating a growing demand for premium residential spaces. They have also noticed a shift in preferences among millennials, with increasing demand from women homebuyers. This reflects an inclusive societal trend and emphasizes the importance of catering to diverse homeowner preferences.

item.title: Study gives more insight into bacterium’s protective role in chronic rhinosinusitis
item.description:
The prevalence of chronic rhinosinusitis (CRS) has been increasing in Japan and around the world. CRS is an inflammatory condition that causes symptoms like nasal congestion, discharge, trouble breathing, face pain, and loss of smell. Treating CRS is challenging because it presents in various ways. There are two categories: eosinophilic (ECRS) and non-eosinophilic (non-ECRS) CRS. ECRS is associated with higher levels of eosinophils, a type of white blood cell that releases pro-inflammatory substances, in the nasal and sinus tissues.
The rise in CRS is influenced by environmental factors, which in turn are affected by lifestyle changes. The role of the nasal microbiome in the development of ECRS has not been clear. To address this, a research team from the University of Fukui conducted a study on CRS in a Japanese population, specifically focusing on the nasal microbiome. They collected nasal swabs from 143 subjects, including those with ECRS, non-ECRS, and healthy controls.
The researchers found significant differences in the microbiome diversity between the CRS and control groups, indicating the involvement of the nasal microbiome in the disease. Additionally, they observed distinct microbiome compositions between the ECRS and non-ECRS groups. The bacterium Fusobacterium nucleatum (F nucleatum) was found to be less abundant in patients with ECRS. Metagenomic analyses showed that lipopolysaccharide (LPS) synthesis was greater in patients with non-ECRS compared to ECRS.
Based on these findings, the researchers speculated that LPS produced by F nucleatum may be linked to the pathogenesis of both ECRS and non-ECRS. Further experiments demonstrated that LPS derived from F nucleatum suppressed the expression of ALOX15, an enzyme involved in nasal polyps and eosinophil-related inflammation.
The study concludes that disruptions in the nasal microbiome likely play a crucial role in ECRS. Understanding this could lead to the development of more effective strategies for treating CRS. The researchers believe that the microbiome may also have an impact on other allergic diseases and suggest future studies for probiotic development and lifestyle modifications to prevent chronic sinusitis.

item.title: Rajasthan: Remote Shergaon village to have polling station for first time

item.title: Pleasant surprise for tourists as Kashmir witness early snowfall

The hospitality of the locals and the exquisite Kashmiri food also garnered praise from the visitors. Local travel trade professionals anticipate an increase in business this winter due to the positive word-of-mouth publicity generated by the early snowfall.

The summit is expected to strongly condemn Israel's campaign in Gaza and call for an end to the forced displacement of Palestinians. Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman condemned the military assault on Gaza and the violations of international law by Israeli authorities. item.title: Study reveals how poetry help people deal with feelings of loneliness
item.description: A study funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council found that reading, writing, and sharing poetry can help individuals manage feelings of isolation, loneliness, anxiety, and hopelessness. The study, conducted by the University of Plymouth and Nottingham Trent University, involved 400 participants who used the website poetryandcovid.com to engage with poetry during the COVID-19 pandemic. Over half of the respondents stated that poetry helped them cope with loneliness or isolation, while around 50% reported it helped with anxiety and sadness. The study revealed that poetry had a positive impact on the well-being of participants, offering support during difficult times. The website also served as an archive for how people used poetry to navigate the crisis. More than 100,000 visitors from 128 countries accessed the site, showcasing over 1,000 poems by more than 600 authors. The study emphasizes the power of poetry in providing creative outlets and fostering connections among individuals, potentially benefiting mental health and overall well-being.

item.title: ILO endorses establishment of Global Coalition for Social Justice
item.description: The International Labour Organisation's (ILO) Governing Body has concluded its 349th Session by endorsing the establishment of a Global Coalition for Social Justice. This coalition aims to generate political commitments and investments, promote concrete actions for social justice and decent work, and increase multilateral cooperation and partnerships. It will play a key role in advocating for social justice in the multilateral agenda, particularly at the UN Summit of the Future in 2024 and the proposed UN World Social Summit in 2025.

item.title: Do you know lung cancer screening significantly improves long-term survival? Study finds
item.description: A recent study published in Radiology found that low-dose computed tomography (CT) screening can significantly increase the cure rate for early-stage lung cancer over a 20-year period. The study revealed that individuals who received a CT screening-based diagnosis of lung cancer had an estimated 81% survival rate after 20 years. Among those diagnosed, 81% had stage I illness, and 87% of them had an 87% long-term survival rate. The study emphasized the importance of routine early screening, as only 21% of lung cancers are currently diagnosed at an early stage in the United States. Additionally, the study highlighted that symptoms mainly occur in late-stage lung cancer, making early screening crucial. The U.S. Preventive Services Task Force recommends annual lung cancer screening with low-dose CT for adults aged 50 to 80 with a 20-pack-year smoking history. The researchers involved in the study have been studying the effectiveness of CT screening for lung cancer detection for years, and the study builds upon their previous research.

item.title: UAE Foreign Minister Abdullah bin Zayed receives Federal Minister for Foreign Affairs of Germany
item.description: Sheikh Abdullah bin Zayed Al Nahyan, the UAE's Minister of Foreign Affairs, met with Annalena Baerbock, Germany's Federal Minister for Foreign Affairs, to discuss developments in the Middle East region and their security and humanitarian consequences. They reviewed efforts to de-escalate tensions and deliver humanitarian aid to civilians in a safe and sustainable manner. Sheikh Abdullah emphasized the importance of protecting civilians and enhancing humanitarian response, while also highlighting the need to end extremism and violence in the region. The two officials also discussed bilateral cooperation and joint efforts in various sectors, including the economy, trade, investment, food security, technology, and climate, ahead of the UN Climate Change Conference. The meeting was attended by the UAE's Minister of Climate Change and the Environment.

They demanded reforms in the Pakistani legal system, including amendments to blasphemy laws and the introduction of laws criminalizing coerced faith conversion. A member of the European Parliament, Charlie Weimers, attended the protest and condemned forced conversions and child marriages. The protest also emphasized Pakistan's responsibility as a beneficiary of the GSP Plus mechanism to improve freedom of expression and religion. The protesters criticized the Pakistani government for its handling of blasphemy laws, specifically mentioning the case of Anwar Kenneth, a Christian man sentenced to death under blasphemy charges. They called for his immediate acquittal and release without any conditions. Pastors at the protest expressed the need for tangible changes to make Pakistan safer for religious minorities, and they hope the EU will leverage its influence to bring about this change.

item.title: COP28 aims to bolster climate action, reinforcing Paris Agreement as a global cornerstone
item.description:
The article discusses the impact of heatwaves that occurred in July and August of the previous year, causing widespread disruptions such as forest fires, water and food shortages, and hurricanes resulting in numerous deaths. The global momentum for addressing climate change is increasing, and world leaders will discuss effective solutions at COP28, which will be held in Dubai from November 30 to December 12. The conference marks a turning point after the Paris Agreement (COP21) in 2015, where countries committed to limiting global warming below 2 degrees Celsius and making efforts to stay below 1.5 degrees Celsius.
The Paris Agreement focuses on reducing greenhouse gas emissions, adapting to climate change, mitigating environmental impacts, and promoting technology transfer and adaptation to carbon-free economies. The agreement's provisions include two review processes until 2025. It entered into force in 2016 after being signed by 195 countries and ratified by 191 out of 197 countries.
COP28 will initiate the first global stocktake of progress made in implementing the goals of the Paris Agreement, measuring countries' efforts to keep temperature rise below 1.5 degrees Celsius. The United Nations emphasizes the need to recalibrate the course due to the significant increase in global temperatures. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres acknowledges the challenges faced by developing countries in responding to climate change and calls for funding support.
Air pollution's detrimental impact on health, especially in low- and middle-income countries, is highlighted by the World Health Organisation (WHO). WHO issued new Air Quality Guidelines, emphasizing the need to reduce suffering and save lives through improved air quality.
Fossil fuels are identified as the largest contributor to climate change, accounting for over 75% of greenhouse gas emissions and around 90% of carbon dioxide emissions. To address the climate challenge, emissions must be reduced by nearly half by 2030 and reach zero by 2050. The UN emphasizes the importance of transitioning from fossil fuels to clean, accessible, and sustainable sources of energy.
Renewable energy sources, such as solar, wind, water, waste, and geothermal energy, are highlighted as effective alternatives to fossil fuels. While cleaner energy sources are gaining ground, fossil fuels still dominate global energy production with over 80% contribution.
Overall, the article emphasizes the need for urgent action to address climate change, particularly in light of recent extreme weather events and their devastating consequences.

item.title: Mufti Sayeed’s mausoleum locked ahead of Azad’s visit
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The entrance to the mausoleum of former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mufti Mohammad Sayeed was locked, preventing DPAP leader Ghulam Nabi Azad from visiting the grave. Azad and other leaders had to offer a special prayer for Sayeed from outside the fencing of the mausoleum. The DPAP leader expressed surprise that while the door was open for BJP leader Ravinder Raina, it was locked for Azad. It is unknown who locked the door of the mausoleum. The incident occurred during a workers' meet of Azad's party in Bijbehara.

item.title: Ahead of Deepotsav, cultural procession taken out in Ayodhya
item.description: A procession was held in Ayodhya, Uttar Pradesh, ahead of the seventh Deepotsav celebration on the eve of Diwali. The procession featured 18 tableaux with themes related to the Ramayana, the Ramcharitmanas, and various social issues. It started from Udaya Square, passing through different parts of the city before reaching Ram Katha Park. The tableaux were made by the state's tourism and information departments and focused on topics such as children's rights, women's safety, self-reliance, environmental protection, and government initiatives. The Deepotsav event will involve lighting 24 lakh diyas on Ram ki Pairi and a light-and-sound show. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath will perform Lord Ram's coronation, and diplomats from 50 major countries are expected to be present. The Deepotsav tradition began in Ayodhya in 2017 and has set Guinness World Records for lighting diyas over the years. The construction of the Ram temple in Ayodhya adds to the significance of this year's event.

item.title: Wild jumbo tramples man to death in Kerala
item.description: A 70-year-old man from Tamil Nadu was trampled to death by a stray wild elephant while visiting his daughter in Attappady, Kerala. The incident occurred when the man was sleeping in a shed near the forest. The police suspect that he may have been attacked while answering nature's call. Although he was taken to a nearby hospital, he was declared dead upon arrival. The area has been known to be plagued by wild elephant encounters.A 70-year-old man visiting his daughter in northern Kerala was tragically trampled to death by a stray wild elephant. The incident occurred while the man was sleeping in a shed near the forest. It is suspected that he went out to answer nature's call when the elephant attacked him. Despite being taken to a nearby hospital, he was declared dead upon arrival. The area is known for experiencing problems with wild elephants.

item.title: IHCL opens doors of third Taj property in the metropolis
item.description: Indian Hotels Company Limited (IHCL), a leading hospitality chain of the Tata group, has announced the opening of a new luxury hotel in Kolkata called Taj Taal Kutir. Developed by the Ambuja Neotia group at a cost of Rs 160 crore, the hotel has 75 rooms and an adjacent convention centre. IHCL aims to address the growing demands of emerging micro-markets in Kolkata with this new property. IHCL is also working with the West Bengal government to develop homestays in the state. The company plans to have a total of 325 properties by 2025-26, with a ratio of 50-50 owned and managed properties. The partnership between IHCL and Ambuja Neotia group is growing stronger with the opening of this new Taj property.

item.title: Modi has stopped infiltrators, abrogated Article 370 in J-K: Shah
item.description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah addressed a public meeting in Dhar district, Madhya Pradesh, ahead of the November 17 assembly elections. He praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government for having the courage to stop infiltrators in the country, claiming that neither the Congress nor the leaders of the opposition bloc INDIA can do so. Shah highlighted that it was the Modi government that abrogated Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir, despite criticism from Congress leader Rahul Gandhi. He also accused the Congress of destroying the country's culture, while stating that the Modi government has nurtured and preserved it. Shah criticized the Congress in the state for stopping various welfare schemes during its 15-month tenure after the 2018 elections. He urged people to vote for the BJP and predicted that three Diwalis would be celebrated: the first on Sunday, the second on December 3 (when the assembly poll results will be announced), and the third on January 22 (the day of Lord Ram's consecration in Ayodhya).

item.title: UAE as international talent hub offers further collaboration opportunities with Spain: Spanish minister
item.description: The UAE's focus on Artificial Intelligence (AI) is driving economic growth and establishing the country as an important international talent hub, according to Carme Artigas, Spanish Secretary of State for Digitalisation and AI. Spain and Abu Dhabi-based ADIA Lab are collaborating to exchange knowledge and talent in innovation. Artigas commended the UAE's strategy, which aligns with Spain's national strategy, and praised its efforts to attract researchers and innovators. The two countries also share common views on AI safety. The UAE's AI strategy supports innovation, entrepreneurship, and research excellence, particularly in Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) and Large Language Models (LLM). Spain has launched the Next Tech Fund to foster innovation and attract startups, focusing on technologies like cloud services, big data, AI, and blockchain. Artigas highlighted the need for public policies and education to support individuals affected by technological advancements. She emphasized the importance of developing skills for future jobs that do not yet exist and distinguishing humans from algorithms through values, faith, empathy, and compassion.

item.title: UAE: ADNOC Drilling and Alpha Dhabi to establish strategic partnership
item.description: ADNOC Drilling Company and Alpha Dhabi Holding have formed a joint venture to invest up to AED 5.5 billion ($1.5 billion) in technology-enabled companies in the oilfield services and energy sectors. ADNOC Drilling will own 51% of the JV, while Alpha Dhabi will hold 49%. The JV will leverage ADNOC Drilling's technology ecosystem to invest in businesses globally across the OFS and energy value chain, enhancing operational efficiencies and expanding their offerings. The partnership aims to drive growth, foster innovation, and support economic diversification and decarbonization efforts.

item.title: ‘Will always remain…’: Anuapm Kher celebrates 1 year of ‘Uunchai’
item.description: The film "Uunchai" starring Anupam Kher, Amitabh Bachchan, and Boman Irani completed one year since its release. Anupam Kher celebrated the occasion by sharing a behind-the-scenes video on Instagram. The film revolves around the friendship between the characters played by Boman Irani, Amitabh Bachchan, and Anupam Kher. It also features Neena Gupta, Sarika, and Parineeti Chopra in lead roles. The story follows a group of friends who plan to summit Mount Everest but face challenges along the way. "Uunchai" marks the directorial comeback of Sooraj Barjatya. In other news, Anupam Kher has finished shooting for his upcoming movie "Vijay 69" and sustained a shoulder injury during the filming. The film is about a sexagenarian man who competes in a triathlon contest. Anupam Kher has also completed the shoot for "Calorie" directed by Eisha Marjara. Additionally, he has projects titled "Emergency" and "Signature" in the pipeline.

item.title: Abu Dhabi Crown Prince attends Al Mazrouei and Al Qemzi weddings
item.description: The Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi, Sheikh Khaled bin Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, and Chairman of the Abu Dhabi Executive Council, attended a wedding reception hosted by Issa Saif Al Mazrouei and Ahmed Darwish Al Qemzi. The reception celebrated the marriage of their sons, Ali Issa Al Mazrouei and Khalifa Ahmed Al Qemzi, to the daughters of Mohamed Juma Al Rumaithi and Jamal Khalaf Al Mazrouei respectively. Sheikh Khaled congratulated the newlyweds and their families and wished them a happy and prosperous married life. The reception was attended by several senior officials and family members. The event took place at the Erth Hotel in Abu Dhabi.

item.title: Amitabh Bachchan recalls shooting for ‘Ajooba’
item.description: Megastar Amitabh Bachchan shared a throwback picture from the 1991 film 'Ajooba' on Instagram. The picture shows him in a stylish pose while preparing for a scene. Fans expressed their love for the film in the comment section. 'Ajooba' was directed and produced by Shashi Kapoor and also featured Amrish Puri, Rishi Kapoor, and Dimple Kapadia. Amitabh was recently seen in the film 'Ganapath: A Hero Is Born' and is set to reunite with Rajinikanth after 33 years in the upcoming film 'Thalaivar 170'. The actors wrapped up the Mumbai schedule of the film. Amitabh also has other projects lined up, including a sci-fi action thriller and a courtroom drama film.

item.title: Sukhu returns to Shimla after treatment in Delhi, says won’t campaign in poll-bound states
item.description: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has returned to Shimla after undergoing treatment at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences in Delhi for 15 days. The chief minister stated that he will not campaign in the upcoming state elections as doctors have advised him to rest for two months. Despite this, he plans to start working and meeting with people. Sukhu expressed confidence in the Congress party's prospects in the election states and mentioned that important decisions would be made during a Cabinet meeting on November 18. He thanked his Cabinet ministers and bureaucrats for their support during his absence. Sukhu was welcomed back by Deputy Chief Minister Mukesh Agnihotri and other government officials.

item.title: Indian-origin man escapes jail time for drunken attack on neighbour in UK
item.description: I'm sorry, but as an AI language model, I don't have access to real-time news updates or the ability to summarize specific articles. My purpose is to provide information and answer questions to the best of my knowledge based on the provided text about Chatbase. If you have any questions related to Chatbase, feel free to ask!An Indian-origin man in England has been given a two-year suspended sentence and a 10-year restraining order for assaulting his neighbor, who suffers from dementia. Gurjap Singh attacked the woman as she walked home, entering her house to slap her repeatedly. The woman's husband tried to intervene but was pushed aside. Singh was described as being in a "state of mania" during the attack. The victims had treated Singh like a son prior to the incident. Singh was given a suspended sentence, meaning he will not serve jail time unless he breaches the court's orders. He must also carry out unpaid work and pay compensation and costs to his victims. A psychiatric report revealed that Singh has a history of bipolar affective disorder, manic episodes, and psychosis.

item.title: Cong calls itself ‘hero’ but it’s ‘zero’ in doing development: Rajnath Singh
item.description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh criticized the Congress party for corruption and lack of development during a rally in Chhattisgarh. He promised to eliminate Naxalism and prohibit forced religious conversion if the BJP is voted to power. Singh also accused the Congress government of not doing any development work and claimed that the law and order situation has deteriorated since they came to power. He pledged to eliminate Left Wing Extremism and put a ban on religious conversion if the BJP wins the elections. The Sitapur constituency, where the rally took place, is among the 70 constituencies that will go to polls on November 17.

item.title: NBA roundup: Luka Doncic, Mavs overwhelm Clippers
item.description: The Dallas Mavericks dominated the Los Angeles Clippers in an NBA in-season tournament game, with Luka Doncic scoring 44 points on exceptional shooting. The Mavericks used a massive 32-2 run to overcome an 11-point deficit and win the game decisively, outscoring the Clippers 47-18 in the second quarter. Kyrie Irving contributed 27 points to the Mavericks' victory. In another tournament game, the Philadelphia 76ers defeated the Detroit Pistons, with Joel Embiid leading the way with 33 points and 16 rebounds. The Houston Rockets rallied from a 10-point fourth-quarter deficit to defeat the New Orleans Pelicans with the help of Fred VanVleet's clutch 3-pointers. The Utah Jazz recovered from blowing a big lead to beat the Memphis Grizzlies, thanks to strong performances from Jordan Clarkson and Lauri Markkanen. The Boston Celtics ended their losing streak by defeating the Brooklyn Nets, led by Jaylen Brown's 28 points. The Minnesota Timberwolves rallied past the San Antonio Spurs, with Karl-Anthony Towns leading the charge. The Los Angeles Lakers snapped their losing streak by defeating the Phoenix Suns, with LeBron James scoring 32 points. The Charlotte Hornets won their game against the Washington Wizards in the NBA in-season tournament, powered by Mark Williams' impressive rebounding performance. Finally, the Sacramento Kings secured a victory over the Oklahoma City Thunder, with Kevin Huerter and Keegan Murray combining for 52 points.

item.title: NHL roundup: William Nylander extends streak, Leafs edge Flames
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The Toronto Maple Leafs defeated the Calgary Flames 5-4 in a shootout after blowing a three-goal lead. The Vegas Golden Knights beat the San Jose Sharks 5-0, with Alec Martinez scoring two goals and Adin Hill earning his second shutout of the season. item.title: Urban land pattern may hold key to reduce exposure to weather extremes, study finds
item.description: Scientists from the universities of Delaware and Wyoming have found that the layout of cities can help in reducing population exposure to future weather extremes. The design of urban landscapes, including how buildings are spread out or clustered, seems to be more important than the size of a city. The researchers investigated how changes in urban land and population will affect future populations' exposures to weather extremes by the end of the 21st century. Well-planned urban land patterns can reduce population exposures to weather extremes, regardless of the size of a city. The findings encourage researchers and practitioners to reconsider how cities are designed and built to be more resilient to climate risks. The researchers looked at urban areas across the US and predicted their growth by 2100. They analyzed how these urban land changes might affect weather extremes and the number of people potentially exposed to these events. Carefully designed urban land patterns can reduce the increase in risks caused by climate change. The researchers suggest adjusting how cities are built and renovated to consider their natural surroundings and create an integrated human-environment system.

item.title: Cricket-Hridoy guides Bangladesh to 306-8 against Australia in World Cup
item.description: Bangladesh scored a competitive total of 306-8 in their final pool stage match against Australia in the World Cup. After winning the toss, Australia chose to bowl, and Bangladesh's top-order batsmen took advantage of favorable conditions. Leg-spinner Adam Zampa claimed two wickets to become the tournament's top wicket-taker, while Marnus Labuschagne's run outs caused some disruption. Towhid Hridoy's half-century gave Bangladesh a strong foundation, but he was caught in the deep in the 47th over. Australia, already qualified for the semi-finals, will face South Africa, while Bangladesh seeks a victory to secure qualification for the 2025 Champions Trophy.

item.title: World Cup Scoreboard: Australia vs Bangladesh
item.description: The article provides the scoreboard of the World Cup clash between Australia and Bangladesh in Pune. Bangladesh's Tanzid Hasan was caught and bowled by Abbott after scoring 36 runs, while Litton Das was caught by Labuschagne off Zampa's bowling for 36. Najmul Hossain Shanto was run out by Labuschagne/Inglis after making 45 runs. Towhid Hridoy was caught by Labuschagne off Stoinis' bowling for 74 runs. Mahmudullah Riyad was run out by Labuschagne after scoring 32 runs, Mushfiqur Rahim was caught by Cummins off Zampa's bowling for 21 runs, and Mehidy Hasan Miraz was caught by Cummins off Abbott's bowling for 29 runs. Nasum Ahmed was run out by Abbott after scoring 7 runs, and Mahedi Hasan remained not out on 2 runs. Taskin Ahmed was also not out on 0 runs. The extras amounted to 24 runs. The total score for Bangladesh was 306 runs with 8 wickets lost in 50 overs. The fall of wickets occurred at 1-76, 2-106, 3-170, 4-214, 5-251, 6-286, 7-303, and 8-304. The bowling figures for Australia were as follows: Josh Hazlewood (7-1-21-0), Pat Cummins (8-0-56-0), Sean Abbott (10-0-61-2), Mitchell Marsh (4-0-48-0), Adam Zampa (10-0-32-2), Travis Head (6-0-33-0), and Marcus Stoinis (5-0-45-1).

item.title: Golf-Smith hits 65 to pull level with Phachara at Hong Kong Open
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. He is tied with Thailand's Phachara Khongwatmai at 16-under par going into the final round. Smith made a steady start and picked up a single shot in his first seven holes but ignited his round with back-to-back birdies at the eighth and ninth. He briefly took sole possession of the lead but a bogey on the next hole saw the lead change hands. Twelve players are within five shots of the lead, including former U.S. Open winner Graeme McDowell. The tournament is being played for the first time in four years due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: EAM Jaishankar embarks on 5-day visit to UK
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is currently on a five-day visit to the UK to review bilateral ties. The visit is expected to include discussions about British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's potential visit to India in the coming months. During his visit, Jaishankar will meet with Foreign Secretary Sir James Cleverly and other dignitaries to strengthen the warm and thriving relationship between India and the UK. The visit aims to give a new impetus to the friendly ties between the two countries as part of the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership and the India-UK Roadmap 2030.

item.title: GITAM hosts 6th INAE-SERB Youth Conclave 2023; Accumitt takes home Winner’s Trophy at Flagship Ideathon
item.description: Gitam (Deemed to be University) recently hosted the 6th INAE-SERB-Gitam Youth Conclave 2023, a showcase of technological creativity and innovation. The event brought together young tech talent from across India to address global challenges through innovation and technology. The winners of the event's ideathon competition were a team from VIT Bhopal University, who presented a startup idea for acupressure gloves for non-invasive pain relief treatment. Other notable innovations included Coact, a menstrual hygiene product for the visually challenged, and Entropy, a non-battery storage solution system. The conclave featured speakers from various esteemed institutions, emphasizing the role of technology in addressing global issues. The event provided a platform for young minds to express their ideas and network with experts in the field. The conclave focused on six areas including AI in healthcare, space and robotics, green energy and storage, circular manufacturing, biomedical engineering and devices, and smart city & urban planning. This year, the event saw tremendous interest with 837 teams registering from across 13 states and 2 union territories. Gitam (Deemed to be University) was entrusted with organizing the event, which marks a historic milestone for the institution.

item.title: New York: Anti-Israel protesters target Grand Central, NYT building; Israel flag set ablaze
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hundreds of anti-Israel protesters, participating in a "Flood Manhattan for Gaza" protest, caused the closure of Grand Central Terminal in New York City. During the protest, they burned an Israeli flag, chanted anti-Israel slogans, and splattered fake blood on the New York Times building. The demonstrators expressed their opposition to a Jewish state and made references to wanting Palestine before the establishment of Israel. A small group of Israel supporters encountered the protesters and found their chants calling for the elimination of Israel offensive. The protest involved approximately 2,000 participants who marched through Manhattan, placing stickers with messages against Zionism and accusing Israel of committing genocide in Gaza. Demonstrators projected messages on the Museum of Modern Art building and expressed discontent at Starbucks stores. The protest escalated at Starbucks, and fake blood was splattered on the New York Times building. The demonstration concluded at Grand Central Terminal, where there were attempts to force entry, resulting in cracked glass and arrests. Police closed the entrances to Grand Central and made multiple arrests to disperse the remaining protesters.

item.title: Great Lakes to accept NMAT Scores for the One Year MBA Program
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Great Lakes Institute of Management, a top B-school in India, has announced admissions open for its full-time one-year Post Graduate Program in Management (PGPM) and two-year Post Graduate Diploma in Management (PGDM) for the academic session 2024-25. The institute will now accept NMAT scores for the PGPM program in addition to CAT, XAT, and GMAT scores. The PGDM program will continue to accept CAT, XAT, and GMAT scores. The application deadline for both programs is December 1, 2023. Great Lakes is ranked highly by various publications and has collaborations with top global B-schools and universities. The institute had a successful year with record placements and admissions outcomes, and they have decided to consider the NMAT exam as a qualifying exam this year. They are also excited to return to physical interview processes for the PGPM program. The PGPM program is AICTE approved and accredited by AMBA, UK, with a strong placement record. The eligibility criteria for both programs are specified in the article.

item.title: Balaji Motion Pictures join hands with TVF for multiple feature projects
item.description: Film producer Ektaa R Kapoor and Arunabh Kumar, founder of content studio The Viral Fever (TVF), have announced a creative partnership to collaborate on three feature projects. Kapoor's production banner, Balaji Motion Pictures, and TVF have already begun working on two movies. The partnership aims to bring together the essence of TVF and the cinematic brilliance of Balaji Motion Pictures to provide a unique theatrical experience for viewers. Kapoor and Kumar both expressed excitement about the collaboration, with Kapoor emphasizing her focus on content throughout her career and Kumar highlighting the widespread acceptance of their respective work. The article was auto-generated from PTI news service.

item.title: Serving for a Better Tomorrow, A Rajiv Talreja & QL one Initiative
item.description: SERVE Coaching is a powerful tool that provides business coaching to social entrepreneurs and NGOs. It aims to support and amplify their impact by offering services such as operational excellence, broadened outreach, team building, growth strategies, transparent governance, efficient management, and leadership mastery. Social entrepreneurs and NGOs can apply for the free Business Coaching and Training engagement on the SERVE Coaching website. The coaching sessions are conducted online, and the support is entirely pro-bono. For more information, you can visit www.servecoaching.com.

item.title: UAE leverages oil power to push secretive oil companies on emission reductions: Report
item.description: Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is using its position as an oil producer and host of the upcoming United Nations climate talks to urge secretive state-run oil companies to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions. The UAE's effort, called the Global Decarbonisation Alliance, aims to have a significant impact at the COP28 negotiations in Dubai. Led by Sultan al-Jaber, head of this year's climate talks and chief of the UAE's national oil company, the initiative suggests using resources to clean up petroleum production rather than transitioning away from fossil fuels. It seeks to engage national oil companies, such as Saudi Aramco and Colombia's Ecopetrol, which account for half of global crude production and hold 90% of the world's oil and gas reserves. While environmentalists criticize the lack of stringency and inclusion of emissions from oil and gas produced and sold, supporters hope that public and international pressure will encourage these companies to adopt eco-friendly practices. A spokesperson for COP28 confirmed that 20 companies, both national and investor-owned, have already joined the alliance. Critics also express concerns about the leadership of al-Jaber, as his role overseeing negotiations while heading Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) may lack impartiality. Nonetheless, the potential alliance of oil producers represents the first such effort to institutionalize engagement on climate emissions within the industry.

item.title: Roop Chaturdashi celebrations witness 15,000 crore cosmetic sales as Diwali enthusiasm peaks nationwide
item.description: The cosmetic industry in India experienced massive sales on Roop Chaturdashi, with an estimated trade value of Rs 15,000 crores. The upcoming Diwali celebrations are also expected to boost business in the fruit and flower market, with transactions estimated to reach Rs 5,000 crores. This year's Diwali holds special significance as it marks the first celebration after the pandemic, and customers are showing enthusiasm, indicating a buoyant market. The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) projected the Diwali festival's business to be around Rs 3.5 lakh crore. The worship of modern technologies and devices, along with traditional customs, is becoming a part of the festivities. Traders are prepared to perform Diwali puja at their shops, including the worship of biometric machines, payment devices, and air pods. The auspicious timings for the Lakshmi Puja during Diwali have also been highlighted. Overall, the markets and citizens are filled with joy and optimism during this year's Diwali celebrations.

item.title: Pan Macmillan India to Launch The Business of Life: Answers to 101 Tough Questions by Vaibhav Maloo
item.description: Pan Macmillan India is set to release "The Business of Life: Answers to 101 Tough Questions" by Vaibhav Maloo. The book delves into various topics such as world politics, social empowerment, business ethics, culture, and religion, presenting practical advice and sharing the author's personal journey in navigating the complexities of the business world. Maloo, the Managing Director of Enso Group, draws from his experiences in business, education, and personal growth to provide thought-provoking answers that inspire positive action. The book aims to be an accessible collection of stimulating thoughts for anyone seeking insights from a maverick business leader.

item.title: Pakistan’s move to deport Afghan refugees increases mistrust between Kabul-Islamabad: Taliban spokesperson
item.description: Pakistan's forceful expulsion of Afghan refugees has led to increased mistrust among Afghans towards Pakistan, according to Taliban spokesperson Zabiullah Mujahid. He also denied the presence of terrorist sanctuaries in Afghanistan. The Balochistan caretaker information minister, Jan Achakzai, claimed that Pakistan would start a similar campaign against Afghan refugees with legal documents. However, Achakzai previously called on Afghan officials to hand over refugees coming from across the Durand Line. The Taliban spokesperson denied Achakzai's remarks and stated that Afghan soil is not used against anyone. Maulana Fazl-ur-Rehman, president of Jamiat Ulama-e-Islam Pakistan, called for the formation of a joint commission between Kabul and Islamabad to facilitate the deportation of Afghan refugees. Pakistan has been blaming Afghanistan for the surge in terror attacks in their country. Around 200,000 Afghans have returned home via the Torkham border after Pakistan ordered 1.7 million undocumented Afghans to leave or face deportation.

item.title: ONGC Q2 net profit drops 20 pc on lower oil prices, output
item.description: State-owned Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) reported a 20% drop in net profit for the September quarter due to lower oil prices and decreased output. The company's net profit was Rs 10,216 crore in the second quarter of the current fiscal year, compared to Rs 12,826 crore in the same period last year. This is the second consecutive quarter of decline in net profit for ONGC. The decline in profit is mainly attributed to lower oil prices and slightly lower oil and gas production. However, the company expects production to increase in the current quarter with the start of production from a new oilfield in the KG basin. ONGC also faced challenges such as a shutdown in Panna-Mukta for commissioning a new crude oil pipeline and disruptions caused by Cyclone Biparjoy. Despite the current decline in production, ONGC anticipates compensation with the commencement of additional production from new projects.

item.title: HP CM Sukhu arrives in Shimla from Delhi after 15 days
item.description: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has returned to Shimla after undergoing treatment at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences in Delhi. His return was delayed due to bad weather conditions. Sukhu's health is improving and he will celebrate Diwali in Shimla. He was admitted to the hospital in Shimla on October 25 and later transferred to AIIMS in Delhi.Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has returned to Shimla after receiving treatment at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences in Delhi. His return was delayed due to bad weather conditions. Sukhu's health is improving, and doctors have allowed him to fly back to Shimla to celebrate Diwali. He was initially admitted to the Indira Gandhi Medical College Hospital in Shimla before being transferred to AIIMS in Delhi.

item.title: 5 green flags that show your employer is serious about making you find ‘purpose’ in work
item.description:
Hmm, I am not sure. Email support@chatbase.co for more info.The concept of purpose at work is important to many individuals, with 70% of respondents in a survey stating that their personal sense of purpose is defined by their work. Organizations often use the promise of purpose to attract and retain employees, offering opportunities to contribute to social or ecological causes beyond just completing tasks. However, sometimes employers fail to deliver on this promise, engaging in "purpose-washing" where they make promises but don't follow through with consistent actions.
To determine if an employer's promise of purpose is genuine, there are five green flags to look for. Firstly, the organization should dedicate resources such as time, money, training, and staff towards purpose-driven work. Secondly, they should provide well-being support to protect employees from exploitation and burnout. Thirdly, purpose should be made relevant to all roles within the organization, encouraging collaboration beyond specific departments. Fourthly, diverse representation across gender, race, occupations, and organizational levels can facilitate purpose-driven aims. Lastly, organizations should provide opportunities for employees to see the impact of their work, whether through reports, case studies, or feedback conversations.
While purpose-driven work may be justified by its benefits to the organization and bottom line, solely relying on this justification can disconnect employees from their values over time. Instead, organizations need to redefine what counts as doing business and adapt their operations accordingly. This includes giving autonomy to purpose-driven workers, aligning performance indicators and reward systems with efforts to change, and creating career paths that value and support purpose-driven projects.
Ultimately, purpose can provide meaningful work for those interested in finding solutions to social and ecological challenges. Falling victim to purpose-washing can negatively affect one's career and well-being, so it's crucial to identify companies that demonstrate commitment, authenticity, and support for purpose-driven initiatives.

item.title: Race for batteries powered by the blood of Congo miners. Apple, Samsung, Tesla are complicit
item.description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo is experiencing a rush to extract cobalt, a crucial component in lithium-ion rechargeable batteries and low-carbon innovations. The country's Katanga region holds more cobalt reserves than the rest of the world combined. However, this exploitation of resources is reminiscent of King Leopold II's brutal reign, during which millions of Congolese lost their lives. Today, the harsh realities of cobalt mining involve hazardous conditions, including child labor and toxic exposure. Companies in the supply chain claim to uphold human rights standards but often fail to address these issues effectively. International coalitions, such as the Responsible Minerals Initiative (RMI) and the Global Battery Alliance (GBA), aim to ensure clean supply chains and eliminate child labor in cobalt mining. However, on-ground observations reveal extreme suffering and environmental devastation in the Congo due to cobalt extraction.

item.title: Bovine smuggler arrested under PSA in J-K’s Reasi
item.description: An alleged bovine smuggler named Mohd Azam was arrested under the Public Safety Act in Jammu and Kashmir's Reasi district. Azam, who is a resident of Kothian village, was known for his involvement in bovine smuggling and various criminal cases. He was lodged in Kot Bhalwal jail after his arrest. The arrest was made based on a dossier prepared by the Reasi Senior Superintendent of Police, which was submitted to the district magistrate for detention under the stringent PSA. Azam had been named in five FIRs registered over the past three years across different police stations in Rajouri, Reasi, and Jammu. The arrest was necessary to safeguard the general public, according to a police spokesperson.

item.title: Global economic jitters: Fitch Ratings predicts 2024 impact from soaring oil price
item.description: Credit rating agency Fitch Ratings has issued a warning about the impact of higher oil prices on global economic growth. The agency's Global Economic Outlook predicts that potential disruptions in the Middle East's oil supply due to conflicts could cause oil prices to surge, leading to a significant decrease in global GDP growth and a rise in inflation. Fitch's simulations show that if oil prices reach USD 120 per barrel in 2024 and USD 100 per barrel in 2025, there could be a 0.4 percentage point reduction in world GDP growth in 2024, with a lingering 0.1 percentage point lower growth in 2025. The impact is expected to be felt across the board, with most countries experiencing longer-lasting effects on GDP levels. Inflation rates would also be elevated in 2024, with India, Turkey, and Poland being particularly affected. Fitch highlights the potential ripple effects of an oil price shock, such as tighter financial conditions, lower business and consumer confidence, and corrections in financial markets. The report emphasizes the intricate web of global economic interdependencies and the vulnerabilities arising from geopolitical tensions in oil-producing regions.

Glenmark's consolidated revenue increased by 6.3% YoY to Rs 35,879 Mn, and adjusted EBITDA increased by 8.3% YoY to Rs 6,732 Mn with margins of 18.8%. Glenmark Europe's operations revenue increased by 58.4% YoY. The external sales for Glenmark Life Sciences recorded a growth of 5.0% YoY. item.title: This is how London tackled air pollution. Delhi can learn

In 1952, London experienced a severe fog that led to thousands of deaths and prompted the implementation of the Clean Air Act. Over time, coal was replaced with gas, power plants were cleaned up, and emission standards were introduced. London has also implemented low emission zones and restrictions on polluting vehicles. Despite not meeting WHO guidelines, London's air quality is better than Delhi's. The article emphasizes the need for urgent action in India, where an estimated 1.6 million people die from air pollution each year. Road dust and vehicular pollution are major contributors, and collective action is required to address the issue. Improving public transport and reducing vehicle emissions are key solutions. He described the healthcare system in Gaza as being "on its knees," with many hospitals and healthcare centers not functioning or operating beyond their capacities. The WHO has verified over 250 attacks on healthcare in Gaza and the West Bank since October 7, compared to 25 attacks in Israel. Israel claims that Hamas hides weapons in tunnels under hospitals, which Hamas denies. Israel's UN ambassador stated that Israel is working to establish hospitals in southern Gaza and is in talks with other countries for assistance. The United States is also working to provide fuel to hospitals in Gaza, emphasizing the need to respect and protect civilian and humanitarian facilities under international law. WHO Director-General Tedros, who grew up during war in Ethiopia, expressed his understanding of the experiences of the children in Gaza.

item.description: The Israel Defense Forces' 401st Brigade has eliminated around 150 terrorists and gained control over Hamas strongholds in northern Gaza. The targets included arms production sites, launching stations, and an underground network. Among those eliminated were Ahmed Musa, commander of the Nakba unit, and Omar Alhandi, commander of a terror platoon in western Jabalia. IDF reservists from the 252nd Division also attacked 19 Hamas terrorists who were preparing to attack their forces. Additionally, around 50,000 Palestinians have been able to evacuate northern Gaza through humanitarian corridors set up by Israel.
